column1: Este é o mundo do receptáculo reciclado, criado para evitar a destruição de tudo.
column2: This is the world of the recycled vessel, created to avoid the destruction of all.
column3: This is the world of the recycled vessel, created to avoid the destruction of all.

column1: Rabisco Negro. Um destino perdido. Um livro branco. Uma falsa verdade.
column2: The Black Scrawl. A lost destiny. A white book. A false truth.
column3: The Black Scrawl. A lost destiny. A white book. A false truth.

column1: Um soldado de sal convocando a morte branca. Ele é a Legião, o homem que mergulhou o mundo na escuridão.
column2: A soldier of salt calling forth white death.<LF>He is Legion, the man who plunged the world into darkness.
column3: A soldier of salt calling forth white death.<LF>He is Legion, the man who plunged the world into darkness.

column1: O cadáver do dragão trouxe a morte ao mundo, entregando-lhe o poder do diabo.
column2: The dragon's corpse brought death to the world, delivering unto it the power of the devil.
column3: The dragon's corpse brought death to the world, delivering unto it the power of the devil.

column1: O Rabisco Negro mancha o futuro. Eles viajam para retornar aos receptáculos sem alma.
column2: The black sickness stains the future. They journey to return to soulless vessels.
column3: The black sickness stains the future. They journey to return to soulless vessels.

column1: O apocalipse dividiu o mundo em dois: um que não conhece o dia e outro que nunca viu a noite.
column2: The apocalypse divided the world in two: <LF>one that knows not day, and one which has never seen the night.
column3: The apocalypse divided the world in two: <LF>one that knows not day, and one which has never seen the night.

column1: Preto e branco. Treze pactos. As formas dos receptáculos oscilam enquanto cruzam o tempo e o espaço.
column2: Black, and white. Thirteen pacts. The vessels' forms waver as they cross time and space.
column3: Black, and white. Thirteen pacts. The vessels' forms waver as they cross time and space.

column1: A música do homem foi abafada. Em seu lugar, o grito de algo desumano.
column2: The song of man has been drowned out. In its place, the scream of something inhuman.
column3: The song of man has been drowned out. In its place, the scream of something inhuman.

column1: O céu cai com o dragão. O mundo acaba hoje.
column2: The sky falls with the dragon. The world ends this day.
column3: The sky falls with the dragon. The world ends this day.

column1: O padre marionete coleta as orações amaldiçoadas e poli o recipiente.
column2: The puppet priest collects the accursed prayers and polishes the vessel.
column3: The puppet priest collects the accursed prayers and polishes the vessel.

column1: Enquanto essa memória existir, enquanto a humanidade tiver esperança, uma batalha sangrenta será travada pela área sagrada do corpo.
column2: As long as this memory exists, as long as mankind has hope,<LF>a bloody battle will be waged over the holy domain of the body.
column3: As long as this memory exists, as long as mankind has hope,<LF>a bloody battle will be waged over the holy domain of the body.

column1: Humano tolo. Humano tolo. Humano tolo. Recipiente tolo.
Tudo está pago. Tudo é sacrifício.
column2: All is paid. All is sacrifice.
column3: All is paid. All is sacrifice.

column1: Não traga de volta a luz. Não traga de volta o recipiente. Não traga de volta o futuro. Não traga de volta.
column2: Do not bring back the light.<LF>Do not bring back the vessel.<LF>Do not bring back the future.<LF>Do not bring it back.
column3: Do not bring back the light.<LF>Do not bring back the vessel.<LF>Do not bring back the future.<LF>Do not bring it back.

column1: Cada raio de luz é um convite para a morte.
column2: Every beam of light is an invitation to death.
column3: Every beam of light is an invitation to death.

column1: Caro <NIER>,<LF><LF>Espero que você esteja bem. Estou bem aqui, embora seja solitária às vezes. Mas sempre que isso acontece, eu olho para o céu e me pergunto se é da mesma cor onde quer que você esteja também. Isso geralmente me faz sentir melhor.<LF><LF>Não pegue um resfriado, está bem?<LF><LF>Yonah
column2: Dear <NIER>,<LF><LF>I hope you're doing okay. I'm doing fine here, though it gets kind of lonely sometimes. But whenever that happens, I just look up at the sky and wonder if it's the same color wherever you are, too. That usually makes me feel better.<LF><LF>Don't catch cold, okay?<LF><LF>Yonah
column3: Dear <NIER>,<LF><LF>I hope you're doing okay. I'm doing fine here, though it gets kind of lonely sometimes. But whenever that happens, I just look up at the sky and wonder if it's the same color wherever you are, too. That usually makes me feel better.<LF><LF>Don't catch cold, okay?<LF><LF>Yonah

column1: Caro <NIER>,<LF><LF>Estou preocupada com você. Você gasta toda sua energia focando na minha doença, e sempre que penso em como você está chateado, isso me faz um pouco triste.<LF><LF>Gostaria que diminuísse um pouco o ritmo e não se preocupasse comigo, porque ver você sofrendo é muito pior do que esse estúpido Rabisco Negro. Sei que parece estranho, mas é a verdade.<LF><LF>Yonah
column2: Dear <NIER>,<LF><LF>I'm worried about you. You spend all your energy focusing on my disease, and whenever I think about how upset you are, it makes me kind of sad.<LF><LF>I wish you'd slow down a little and not worry about me, because seeing you in pain is way worse than this stupid Black Scrawl. I know that sounds weird, but it's the truth.<LF><LF>Yonah
column3: Dear <NIER>,<LF><LF>I'm worried about you. You spend all your energy focusing on my disease, and whenever I think about how upset you are, it makes me kind of sad.<LF><LF>I wish you'd slow down a little and not worry about me, because seeing you in pain is way worse than this stupid Black Scrawl. I know that sounds weird, but it's the truth.<LF><LF>Yonah

column1: Caro <NIER>,<LF><LF>Hoje foi incrível! Popola fez um bolo enorme que estava delicioso, e todos da vila têm me desejado feliz aniversário. É divertido! Me sinto como uma princesa ou algo assim.<LF><LF>Não me sinto doente hoje. Na verdade, quase esqueci que tenho essa doença! Então talvez você possa esquecer também e voltar para casa agora?<LF><LF>Yonah
column2: Dear <NIER>,<LF><LF>Today was awesome! Popola made me this HUGE cake that was really yummy, and everyone in the village has been wishing me happy birthday. It's fun! I feel like a princess or something.<LF><LF>I don't feel sick at all today. In fact, I almost forgot I had this disease! So maybe you can forget about it too and come back home now? <LF><LF>Yonah
column3: Dear <NIER>,<LF><LF>Today was awesome! Popola made me this HUGE cake that was really yummy, and everyone in the village has been wishing me happy birthday. It's fun! I feel like a princess or something.<LF><LF>I don't feel sick at all today. In fact, I almost forgot I had this disease! So maybe you can forget about it too and come back home now? <LF><LF>Yonah

column1: Uma espada simples forjada por um ferreiro de vila. Mais adequada para afastar animais pequenos do que para combate real.
column2: A simple sword forged by a village smith. More suited to fending off small animals than actual combat.
column3: A simple sword forged by a village smith. More suited to fending off small animals than actual combat.

column1: Uma lâmina cerimonial feita de penas do lendário pássaro de fogo. Não foi testado como uma arma.
column2: A ceremonial blade crafted from feathers of the legendary firebird. It is untested as a weapon.
column3: A ceremonial blade crafted from feathers of the legendary firebird. It is untested as a weapon.

column1: Uma espada que apresenta um motivo bestial. Sua lâmina curta e fina parece ansiosa para desaparecer da vista.
column2: A sword that bears a beastly motif. Its short, thin blade seems eager to vanish from sight.
column3: A sword that bears a beastly motif. Its short, thin blade seems eager to vanish from sight.

column1: Forjada em aço e presas liquefeitas de bestas, a lâmina é vermelha com o sangue de inúmeras oferendas sacrificiais.
column2: Forged from steel and liquefied beast fangs, the blade is red with the blood of countless sacrificial offerings.
column3: Forged from steel and liquefied beast fangs, the blade is red with the blood of countless sacrificial offerings.

column1: Uma espada criada depois que um homem, movido pela vingança, selou um dragão amaldiçoado.
column2: A sword created after a man, driven mad by revenge, sealed away a cursed dragon.
column3: A sword created after a man, driven mad by revenge, sealed away a cursed dragon.

column1: Um antigo senhor da guerra usou essa espada para matar seus súditos leais na esperança de ganhar vida eterna.
column2: An ancient warlord used this sword to slay his loyal subjects in hopes of gaining eternal life.
column3: An ancient warlord used this sword to slay his loyal subjects in hopes of gaining eternal life.

column1: Uma espada única com uma lâmina redonda. A lenda afirma que ela rouba a força vital do portador.
column2: A unique sword with a round blade. Legend holds that it robs the wielder of his life force.
column3: A unique sword with a round blade. Legend holds that it robs the wielder of his life force.

column1: Feito do fóssil de uma besta antiga. É mais difícil de manusear do que a maioria das espadas - mas forjamentos adicionais podem ajudar.
column2: Made from the fossil of an ancient beast. It's more unwieldy than most swords—but further forging can help.
column3: Made from the fossil of an ancient beast. It's more unwieldy than most swords—but further forging can help.

column1: Um grupo de garotas usou esta espada para consagrar um novo templo com o próprio sangue.
column2: A group of girls used this sword to consecrate a new temple with their own blood.
column3: A group of girls used this sword to consecrate a new temple with their own blood.

column1: Arma pertencente a um espadachim cego. A lâmina brilha na escuridão, tornando o proprietário fácil de ser visto.
column2: A weapon owned by a blind swordsman. The blade shines in darkness, making the owner easy to spot.
column3: A weapon owned by a blind swordsman. The blade shines in darkness, making the owner easy to spot.

column1: Quando um homem que perdeu o caminho empunha esta espada, a lâmina fica tão cega quanto madeira.
column2: When a man who has lost his way wields this sword, the blade becomes blunt as wood.
column3: When a man who has lost his way wields this sword, the blade becomes blunt as wood.

column1: Uma espada estreita que pertenceu a uma mulher de beleza impossível, que os homens imploravam para que ela tirasse suas vidas.
column2: A narrow sword once owned by a woman of such impossible beauty that men begged her to take their lives.
column3: A narrow sword once owned by a woman of such impossible beauty that men begged her to take their lives.

column3: The favorite spear of a mad queen whose lust for power led her to kill all of her sons' wives.

column1: O ponto desta lança é tão finamente afiado que todos aqueles que são levemente tocados por ela experimentam uma morte instantânea e indolor.
column2: This spear's point is so finely honed that all who are grazed by it experience an instant, painless death.
column3: This spear's point is so finely honed that all who are grazed by it experience an instant, painless death.

column1: Uma lança usada pelo sósia do corpo de um príncipe para matar seu empregador. O traidor foi posteriormente morto com a mesma lança.
column2: A spear used by a prince's body double to slay his employer. The traitor was later killed with the same spear.
column3: A spear used by a prince's body double to slay his employer. The traitor was later killed with the same spear.

column1: Uma lança que simboliza um pacto entre um grande líder de guerra e um dragão antigo.
column2: A spear that symbolizes a pact between a great warlord and an ancient dragon.
column3: A spear that symbolizes a pact between a great warlord and an ancient dragon.

column1: Uma lança empunhada por um líder monge guerreiro que sacrificou sua própria vida para proteger seus camaradas.
column2: A spear brandished by a warrior monk chief who sacrificed his own life to protect his comrades.
column3: A spear brandished by a warrior monk chief who sacrificed his own life to protect his comrades.

column1: Uma espada simples forjada por um ferreiro da vila. Mais adequada para afastar pequenos animais do que para combate real.
column2: A simple sword forged by a village smith. More suited to fending off small animals than actual combat.
column3: A simple sword forged by a village smith. More suited to fending off small animals than actual combat.

column1: Uma lâmina cerimonial feita de penas do lendário pássaro de fogo. Não foi testada como uma arma.
column2: A ceremonial blade crafted from feathers of the legendary firebird. It is untested as a weapon.
column3: A ceremonial blade crafted from feathers of the legendary firebird. It is untested as a weapon.

column1: Uma espada que ostenta um motivo bestial. Sua lâmina curta e fina parece ansiosa para desaparecer da vista.
column2: A sword that bears a beastly motif. Its short, thin blade seems eager to vanish from sight.
column3: A sword that bears a beastly motif. Its short, thin blade seems eager to vanish from sight.

column1: Forjada a partir de aço e presas de fera liquefeitas, a lâmina é vermelha com o sangue de inúmeras oferendas sacrificiais.
column2: Forged from steel and liquefied beast fangs, the blade is red with the blood of countless sacrificial offerings.
column3: Forged from steel and liquefied beast fangs, the blade is red with the blood of countless sacrificial offerings.

column1: Uma espada criada depois que um homem, impulsionado pela vingança, selou um dragão amaldiçoado.
column2: A sword created after a man, driven mad by revenge, sealed away a cursed dragon.
column3: A sword created after a man, driven mad by revenge, sealed away a cursed dragon.

column1: Um antigo líder de guerra usou esta espada para matar seus súditos leais na esperança de ganhar vida eterna.
column2: An ancient warlord used this sword to slay his loyal subjects in hopes of gaining eternal life.
column3: An ancient warlord used this sword to slay his loyal subjects in hopes of gaining eternal life.

column1: Uma espada única com lâmina redonda. A lenda conta que ela rouba a força vital de quem a empunha.
column2: A unique sword with a round blade. Legend holds that it robs the wielder of his life force.
column3: A unique sword with a round blade. Legend holds that it robs the wielder of his life force.

column1: Feita a partir do fóssil de uma besta antiga. É mais difícil de manejar do que a maioria das espadas - mas forjando mais pode ajudar.
column2: Made from the fossil of an ancient beast. It's more unwieldy than most swords—but further forging can help.
column3: Made from the fossil of an ancient beast. It's more unwieldy than most swords—but further forging can help.

column1: Um grupo de meninas usou esta espada para consagrar um novo templo com seu próprio sangue.
column2: A group of girls used this sword to consecrate a new temple with their own blood.
column3: A group of girls used this sword to consecrate a new temple with their own blood.

column1: Arma possuída por um espadachim cego. A lâmina brilha na escuridão, tornando o proprietário fácil de ser localizado.
column2: A weapon owned by a blind swordsman. The blade shines in darkness, making the owner easy to spot.
column3: A weapon owned by a blind swordsman. The blade shines in darkness, making the owner easy to spot.

column1: Quando um homem perdido empunha esta espada, a lâmina se torna tão inútil quanto madeira.
column2: When a man who has lost his way wields this sword, the blade becomes blunt as wood.
column3: When a man who has lost his way wields this sword, the blade becomes blunt as wood.

column1: Uma espada estreita uma vez pertencida a uma mulher de beleza impossível que os homens imploravam para que ela tirasse suas vidas.
column2: A narrow sword once owned by a woman of such impossible beauty that men begged her to take their lives.
column3: A narrow sword once owned by a woman of such impossible beauty that men begged her to take their lives.

column1: Uma espada carregada pelo servo mais leal do mundo. Como essa lealdade, a lâmina da espada é reta e verdadeira.
column2: A sword carried by the world's most loyal servant. Like that loyalty, the sword's blade is straight and true.
column3: A sword carried by the world's most loyal servant. Like that loyalty, the sword's blade is straight and true.

column1: Uma relíquia da idade civilizada. Seu cheiro enferrujado vem do sangue de todos que ousaram se opor ao portador.
column2: A relic of the civilized age. Its rusty scent comes from the blood of all who dared oppose the wielder.
column3: A relic of the civilized age. Its rusty scent comes from the blood of all who dared oppose the wielder.

column1: Uma espada empunhada por uma mulher que amava matar. Originalmente havia duas, mas uma quebrou em meio a uma batalha feroz.
column2: A sword wielded by a woman who loved killing. There were originally two, but one broke in the midst of a fierce battle.
column3: A sword wielded by a woman who loved killing. There were originally two, but one broke in the midst of a fierce battle.

column1: Um homem cuja noiva foi levada por uma besta de oito cabeças usou esta espada para derrotar seu inimigo.
column2: A man whose fiancée was spirited away by an eight-headed beast used this sword to smite his foe.
column3: A man whose fiancée was spirited away by an eight-headed beast used this sword to smite his foe.

column1: Uma grande espada usada pelos guardas do templo e supostamente feita de penas do lendário pássaro de fogo.
column2: A large sword used by temple guardsmen, and supposedly made from feathers of the legendary firebird.
column3: A large sword used by temple guardsmen, and supposedly made from feathers of the legendary firebird.

column1: Uma espada bestial cuja borda afiada está pronta para derrubar todos que questionam o direito divino do portador.
column2: A beastly sword whose keen edge stands ready to mow down all who question the divine right of the wielder.
column3: A beastly sword whose keen edge stands ready to mow down all who question the divine right of the wielder.

column1: Uma espada forjada a partir de metal e chifres liquefeitos de besta. Seu brilho opaco seduz as pessoas a adentrarem o labirinto.
column2: A sword forged from metal and liquefied beast horns. Its dull glow lures people deep into the labyrinth.
column3: A sword forged from metal and liquefied beast horns. Its dull glow lures people deep into the labyrinth.

column1: Uma arma com um motivo heroico de dragão, usada por um homem que tentou salvar o mundo.
column2: A weapon with a heroic dragon motif, used by a man who tried to save the world.
column3: A weapon with a heroic dragon motif, used by a man who tried to save the world.

column1: Um machado gigante e amaldiçoado que foi banhado no sangue de jovens gêmeos antes de ser apresentado aos próprios deuses.
column2: A giant, accursed axe that was bathed in the blood of young twins before being presented to the gods themselves.
column3: A giant, accursed axe that was bathed in the blood of young twins before being presented to the gods themselves.

column1: A demência de um homem o levou a atacar o noivo de sua filha com esse machado. Infelizmente, ele acertou em sua filha.
column2: A man's dementia drove him to attack his daughter's fiancé with this axe. Sadly, he hit his daughter instead.
column3: A man's dementia drove him to attack his daughter's fiancé with this axe. Sadly, he hit his daughter instead.

column1: Um mago com uma alma podre imbuiu a essência de um lagarto de fogo neste machado.
column2: A mage with a putrid soul imbued the essence of a fire lizard into this axe.
column3: A mage with a putrid soul imbued the essence of a fire lizard into this axe.

column1: Uma espada enorme que fica mais pesada a cada morte à medida que sangue e carne se agarra à lâmina.
column2: An enormous sword that grows heavier with every kill as blood and flesh cling to the blade.
column3: An enormous sword that grows heavier with every kill as blood and flesh cling to the blade.

column1: Um cavaleiro foi tão tocado pelo sofrimento de um mendigo que removeu todas as ornamentações desta lança.
column2: A knight was so moved by the suffering of a beggar that he removed all ornamentations from this spear.
column3: A knight was so moved by the suffering of a beggar that he removed all ornamentations from this spear.

column1: Forjada por monges a partir de penas do lendário pássaro de fogo, esta lança foi projetada como uma ferramenta de autodefesa.
column2: Forged by monks from feathers of the legendary firebird, this spear was designed as a tool of self-defense.
column3: Forged by monks from feathers of the legendary firebird, this spear was designed as a tool of self-defense.

column1: Um nobre senhor encomendou esta arma monstruosa para que o mundo pudesse ficar maravilhado com seu poder.
column2: A noble lord commissioned this beastly weapon that the world might stand in awe of his power.
column3: A noble lord commissioned this beastly weapon that the world might stand in awe of his power.

column1: Forjada a partir de metal e garras líquidas de besta, esta lança destrutiva está cheia de um ódio profundo pelo mundo.
column2: Forged from metal and liquefied beast claws, this destructive spear is filled with a deep hatred for the world.
column3: Forged from metal and liquefied beast claws, this destructive spear is filled with a deep hatred for the world.

column1: Uma lança nasceu como parte de um pacto com um antigo dragão vermelho.
column2: A lance birthed as part of a pact with an ancient red dragon.
column3: A lance birthed as part of a pact with an ancient red dragon.

column3: The favorite spear of a mad queen whose lust for power led her to kill all of her sons' wives.

column2: This spear's point is so finely honed that all who are grazed by it experience an instant, painless death.
column3: This spear's point is so finely honed that all who are grazed by it experience an instant, painless death.

column1: 5 de abril<LF><LF> Recebi uma carta do papai hoje! Ele está em uma cidade distante<LF>onde ele pode ver o oceano. Espero que eu possa ver o<LF>oceano um dia. Aposto que é enorme!
column2: April 5<LF><LF>Got a letter from Dad today! He's in a far-away town<LF>where he can see the ocean. I hope I can see the<LF>ocean someday. I bet it's huge!
column3: April 5<LF><LF>Got a letter from Dad today! He's in a far-away town<LF>where he can see the ocean. I hope I can see the<LF>ocean someday. I bet it's huge!

column1: 11 de setembro<LF><LF>Hoje é o aniversário do papai, mas ele não está aqui. Então eu apenas<LF>tive uma festa sozinha!
column2: September 11<LF><LF>Today is Dad's birthday, but he's not here. So I just<LF>had a party by myself!
column3: September 11<LF><LF>Today is Dad's birthday, but he's not here. So I just<LF>had a party by myself!

column1: 20 de julho<LF><LF> Devola e Popola vieram me fazer companhia hoje.<LF>Eles até cantaram uma música para mim! Foi realmente ótimo!<LF>Preciso praticar para poder cantar para o papai quando ele voltar.
column2: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola came to keep me company today.<LF>They even sang a song for me! It was really great!<LF>I need to practice so I can sing to Dad when he gets back.
column3: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola came to keep me company today.<LF>They even sang a song for me! It was really great!<LF>I need to practice so I can sing to Dad when he gets back.

column1: 28 de outubro<LF><LF>Hoje estava cansado, então fiquei em casa e me escondi na cama.<LF>Mas ainda consegui ouvir Devola cantando de algum lugar.<LF>Ouvir ela sempre me faz feliz.
column2: October 28<LF><LF>I was tired today, so I stayed home and hid in bed.<LF>I could still hear Devola singing from somewhere, though.<LF>Listening to her always makes me happy.
column3: October 28<LF><LF>I was tired today, so I stayed home and hid in bed.<LF>I could still hear Devola singing from somewhere, though.<LF>Listening to her always makes me happy.

column1: 1 de dezembro<LF><LF>Hoje Popola me enviou um novo livro sobre uma árvore gigante.<LF><LF>Espero que tenha um final feliz. Não há nada<LF>pior do que uma árvore triste.
column2: December 1<LF><LF>Today Popola sent me a new book about a great big tree.<LF>I really hope it has a happy ending. There's nothing<LF>worse than a sad tree.
column3: December 1<LF><LF>Today Popola sent me a new book about a great big tree.<LF>I really hope it has a happy ending. There's nothing<LF>worse than a sad tree.

column1: 30 de janeiro<LF><LF>Pai voltou! Ele voltou para casa para me ver!<LF>Yaaay, Pai!
column2: January 30<LF><LF>Dad came back! He came back home to see me!<LF>Yaaay, Dad!
column3: January 30<LF><LF>Dad came back! He came back home to see me!<LF>Yaaay, Dad!

column1: 4 de fevereiro<LF><LF>Vou aprender a fazer comidas incríveis para o Papai.<LF>Melhor começar a trabalhar em uma nova receita secreta.
column2: February 4<LF><LF>I'm gonna learn to make awesome food for Dad.<LF>I better start working on a new secret recipe.
column3: February 4<LF><LF>I'm gonna learn to make awesome food for Dad.<LF>I better start working on a new secret recipe.

column1: 16 de março<LF><LF>O menino que está sempre correndo lá fora me deu<LF>uma flor super bonita hoje! Eu me pergunto se Popola sabe<LF>como ele se chama?
column2: March 16<LF><LF>The boy who's always running around outside gave me a<LF>super pretty flower today! I wonder if Popola knows what<LF>it's called?
column3: March 16<LF><LF>The boy who's always running around outside gave me a<LF>super pretty flower today! I wonder if Popola knows what<LF>it's called?

column1: 31 de Agosto<LF><LF>A vila está agitada hoje e tem muita coisa acontecendo.<LF>Não sei o que está acontecendo, mas Devola me disse para não me preocupar.<LF>No começo eu pensei que fosse um festival, mas agora não sei.
column2: August 31<LF><LF>The village is buzzing with excitement and stuff today.<LF>I dunno what happened, but Devola told me not to worry.<LF>At first I thought it was a festival, but now I don't know.
column3: August 31<LF><LF>The village is buzzing with excitement and stuff today.<LF>I dunno what happened, but Devola told me not to worry.<LF>At first I thought it was a festival, but now I don't know.

column1: 4 de Maio<LF><LF>Eu escrevo cartas para o papai todos os dias. Ele sempre se preocupa<LF>comigo, mas eu estou bem.
column2: May 4<LF><LF>I write Dad letters every single day. He always worries<LF>about me, but I feel fine.
column3: May 4<LF><LF>I write Dad letters every single day. He always worries<LF>about me, but I feel fine.

column1: 21 de Setembro<LF><LF>Eu queria poder encontrar a senhora Kainé sobre a qual o papai me falou.<LF>Aposto que ela é muito legal e sempre diz coisas legais.<LF><LF>Eu me pergunto se foi assim que minha mãe era?
column2: September 21<LF><LF>I wish I could meet the Kainé lady Dad told me about.<LF>I bet she's really nice and always says nice things.<LF><LF>I wonder if that's what my mom was like?
column3: September 21<LF><LF>I wish I could meet the Kainé lady Dad told me about.<LF>I bet she's really nice and always says nice things.<LF><LF>I wonder if that's what my mom was like?

column1: 22 de Dezembro<LF><LF>A neve não para de cair, então papai disse que vai ficar aqui<LF>comigo até que pare. Provavelmente ele irá embora novamente quando<LF>isso acontecer, então meio que espero que a neve caia para sempre.
column2: December 22<LF><LF>The snow won't stop falling, so Dad said he'd stay here<LF>with me until it stops. He'll probably leave again when<LF>it does, so I kinda hope it snows forever.
column3: December 22<LF><LF>The snow won't stop falling, so Dad said he'd stay here<LF>with me until it stops. He'll probably leave again when<LF>it does, so I kinda hope it snows forever.

column1: 5 de Abril<LF><LF>Sempre que leio uma carta do papai, sinto que preciso<LF>vê-lo novamente.
column2: April 5<LF><LF>Whenever I read a letter from Dad, I really feel like I need<LF>to see him again.
column3: April 5<LF><LF>Whenever I read a letter from Dad, I really feel like I need<LF>to see him again.

column1: 11 de Setembro<LF><LF>Papai disse que voltaria para casa para o meu aniversário, mas eu quero<LF>comemorar o aniversário dele de vez em quando!
column2: September 11<LF><LF>Dad said he'd come home for my birthday, but I wanna<LF>celebrate his birthday once in a while!
column3: September 11<LF><LF>Dad said he'd come home for my birthday, but I wanna<LF>celebrate his birthday once in a while!

column1: 20 de Julho<LF><LF>Devola e Popola voltaram para casa. Isso me deixou<LF>solitária, então saí correndo cantando canções tão alto<LF>quanto eu pude.<LF>Mas depois isso ficou estranho e assustador, então parei.
column2: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola went back home. That made me<LF>lonely, so I ran around singing songs as loud as I could.<LF>But then that got kinda weird and scary, so I stopped.
column3: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola went back home. That made me<LF>lonely, so I ran around singing songs as loud as I could.<LF>But then that got kinda weird and scary, so I stopped.

column1: 28 de Outubro<LF><LF>Essas marcas pretas continuam aparecendo no meu corpo.<LF>Às vezes eu me pergunto se vou virar um duende ou algo assim, mas pensar nisso faz meu estômago doer,<LF>então tento não pensar.
column2: October 28<LF><LF>These black marks keep showing up on my body.<LF>Sometimes I wonder if I'm gonna turn into a goblin or<LF>something, but thinking about it makes my stomach hurt,<LF>so I try not to.
column3: October 28<LF><LF>These black marks keep showing up on my body.<LF>Sometimes I wonder if I'm gonna turn into a goblin or<LF>something, but thinking about it makes my stomach hurt,<LF>so I try not to.

column1: 1º de Dezembro<LF><LF>No livro, a grande árvore continuou esperando e esperando.<LF>Tenho que esperar muito também. Queria poder fazer algo.
column2: December 1<LF><LF>In the book, the big tree kept on waiting and waiting.<LF>I have to wait a lot, too. I wish I could do something.
column3: December 1<LF><LF>In the book, the big tree kept on waiting and waiting.<LF>I have to wait a lot, too. I wish I could do something.

column1: 30 de Janeiro<LF><LF>Papai saiu rápido. Ele disse que só passou para ver meu rosto.
column2: January 30<LF><LF>Dad left pretty quick. He said he just stopped by so he<LF>could see my face.
column3: January 30<LF><LF>Dad left pretty quick. He said he just stopped by so he<LF>could see my face.

column1: 4 de fevereiro<LF><LF>Assim que terminar meu prato secreto, vou alimentá-lo para o papai!<LF>Então ele verá o quanto posso ser útil!
column2: February 4<LF><LF>Once I finish my secret dish, I'm gonna feed it to Dad!<LF>Then he'll see how helpful I can be!
column3: February 4<LF><LF>Once I finish my secret dish, I'm gonna feed it to Dad!<LF>Then he'll see how helpful I can be!

column1: 16 de março<LF><LF>A flor não estava em nenhum dos livros de Devola, então ela<LF>disse que eu poderia dar qualquer nome. Talvez eu dê o nome<LF>depois do papai!
column2: March 16<LF><LF>The flower wasn't in any of Devola's books, so she<LF>said I could name it whatever I want. Maybe I'll name it<LF>after Dad!
column3: March 16<LF><LF>The flower wasn't in any of Devola's books, so she<LF>said I could name it whatever I want. Maybe I'll name it<LF>after Dad!

column1: 31 de agosto<LF><LF>Eu acho que uma Sombra se aproximou da vila hoje.<LF>As pessoas continuavam vindo até mim e dizendo<LF>"Garoto, nós desejamos que seu pai estivesse aqui!"<LF>E eu disse: "Eu também! Papai poderia chutar o traseiro daquela Sombra!"
column2: August 31<LF><LF>I guess a Shade came near the village today.<LF>People kept coming up to me and saying<LF>"Boy, we sure wish your father was around!"<LF>And I said, "Me too! Dad could kick that Shade's butt!"
column3: August 31<LF><LF>I guess a Shade came near the village today.<LF>People kept coming up to me and saying<LF>"Boy, we sure wish your father was around!"<LF>And I said, "Me too! Dad could kick that Shade's butt!"

column1: 4 de maio<LF><LF>Eu gostaria que meu pai me enviasse cartas todos os dias como eu faço.<LF>Mas eu sei que ele está ocupado, então um dia sim, outro não, está ok.
column2: May 4<LF><LF>I wish Dad would send me letters every day like I do.<LF>But I know he's busy, so every other day is okay.
column3: May 4<LF><LF>I wish Dad would send me letters every day like I do.<LF>But I know he's busy, so every other day is okay.

column1: 21 de setembro<LF><LF>Hoje Devola disse que Kainé está "com tudo no lugar certo". Eu não sei o que isso significa, mas eu quero ser assim quando crescer!
column2: September 21<LF><LF>Today Devola said that Kainé is "put together in all the<LF>right places." I dunno what all of that means, but I<LF>wanna be like that when I grow up!
column3: September 21<LF><LF>Today Devola said that Kainé is "put together in all the<LF>right places." I dunno what all of that means, but I<LF>wanna be like that when I grow up!

column1: Relatório de caso 18/05/2004<LF><LF>・ Mutação encontrada na estrutura celular subcutânea.<LF>・ Aumento dos distúrbios mentais acreditados em ser causado por fatores externos.<LF>・ Transmissão aérea provavelmente o mecanismo mais provável.<LF><LF>A pesquisa sobre tratamentos eficazes está em andamento.
column2: Case Report 05/18/2004<LF><LF>・ Mutations found in subcutaneous cell structure.<LF>・ Rise in mental disorders believed to be caused by<LF>external factors.<LF>・ Airborne transmission most likely mechanism.<LF><LF>Research into effective treatments is underway.
column3: Case Report 05/18/2004<LF><LF>・ Mutations found in subcutaneous cell structure.<LF>・ Rise in mental disorders believed to be caused by<LF>external factors.<LF>・ Airborne transmission most likely mechanism.<LF><LF>Research into effective treatments is underway.

column1: Relatório de danos 06/02/2008<LF><LF>・ Muro de Jericó desabou.<LF>・ 5.000 pessoas acreditadas mortas.<LF>・ Pedidos de reforços chegam de várias localidades. <LF><LF>Nós continuamos monitorando a situação.
column2: Damage Report 02/06/2008<LF><LF>・ Wall of Jericho collapsed.<LF>・ 5,000 people believed dead.<LF>・ Requests for reinforcements streaming in from<LF>multiple locations. <LF><LF>We continue to monitor the situation.
column3: Damage Report 02/06/2008<LF><LF>・ Wall of Jericho collapsed.<LF>・ 5,000 people believed dead.<LF>・ Requests for reinforcements streaming in from<LF>multiple locations. <LF><LF>We continue to monitor the situation.

column1: Confirmação de morte 03/01/2030<LF><LF>・ Corpo com 99,999% de probabilidade de ser de um Olho Vermelho.<LF><LF>・ Morte do Olho Vermelho confirmada.<LF>・ 13ª Força Expedicionária ordenada a retornar.<LF>・ Movimentos da Legião são impossíveis de rastrear.
column2: Death Confirmation 03/01/2030<LF><LF>・ Body 99.999% likely that of a Red Eye.<LF>・ Death of Red Eye confirmed.<LF>・ 13th Expeditionary Force ordered home.<LF>・ Legion movements untraceable.
column3: Death Confirmation 03/01/2030<LF><LF>・ Body 99.999% likely that of a Red Eye.<LF>・ Death of Red Eye confirmed.<LF>・ 13th Expeditionary Force ordered home.<LF>・ Legion movements untraceable.

column1: Relatório de Pesquisa do Fundador 06/06/2010<LF><LF>・ Ataques físicos inúteis.<LF>・ Ataques termonucleares inúteis.<LF>・ Partículas desconhecidas foram detectadas.<LF><LF>O tratamento da situação exigirá provar<LF>a teoria de múltiplas origens.
column2: Founder Research Report 06/06/2010<LF><LF>・ Physical attacks useless.<LF>・ Thermonuclear attacks useless.<LF>・ Unknown particles have been detected.<LF><LF>Dealing with the situation will require proving<LF>the multi-origin theory.
column3: Founder Research Report 06/06/2010<LF><LF>・ Physical attacks useless.<LF>・ Thermonuclear attacks useless.<LF>・ Unknown particles have been detected.<LF><LF>Dealing with the situation will require proving<LF>the multi-origin theory.

column1: Novo Ciclo de Medicamentos 02/09/2016<LF><LF>・ Observado que retarda o progresso da Coloração Branca.<LF>・ Nenhuma leitura incomum vista no sujeito.<LF>・ Envie registros diretamente para a Sala de Comando do Gabinete.
column2: New Medication Cycle 02/09/2016<LF><LF>・ Observed to slow the progress of white chlorination.<LF>・ No unusual readings seen in subject.<LF>・ Send records directly to Cabinet Command Room.
column3: New Medication Cycle 02/09/2016<LF><LF>・ Observed to slow the progress of white chlorination.<LF>・ No unusual readings seen in subject.<LF>・ Send records directly to Cabinet Command Room.

column1: Relatório de Nova Tecnologia 08/07/2032<LF><LF>Apesar da infecção resultante da síndrome de Coloração Branca tornar nossa solução imperfeita, temos motivos para esperar alguns resultados positivos. Os testes começarão nos sujeitos previamente selecionados; registrar a segurança do procedimento é a maior prioridade.
column2: New Technology Report 08/07/2032<LF><LF>Although the resultant white chlorination syndrome infection makes ours an imperfect solution, we have reason to expect some positive results. Testing will begin on the previously selected subjects; recordkeeping on the procedure's safety is top priority.
column3: New Technology Report 08/07/2032<LF><LF>Although the resultant white chlorination syndrome infection makes ours an imperfect solution, we have reason to expect some positive results. Testing will begin on the previously selected subjects; recordkeeping on the procedure's safety is top priority.

column1: Anomalias 06/23/2033<LF><LF>Várias anormalidades deletérias foram encontradas em um sujeito nos estágios iniciais do tratamento, incluindo um estado de recaída resultando em uma perda total do eu. Investigaremos a causa desse erro e submeteremos imediatamente um plano de contramedida.
column2: Abnormalities 06/23/2033<LF><LF>Several deleterious abnormalities have been found with a subject in the early stages of treatment, including a relapse state resulting in a total loss of self. We will investigate the cause of this error and submit a countermeasure plan immediately.
column3: Abnormalities 06/23/2033<LF><LF>Several deleterious abnormalities have been found with a subject in the early stages of treatment, including a relapse state resulting in a total loss of self. We will investigate the cause of this error and submit a countermeasure plan immediately.

column1: Caso de teste bem-sucedido 01/15/2034<LF><LF>Um caso de teste bem-sucedido foi descoberto e detido. A cooperação com o espécime foi solicitada de acordo com as estipulações predeterminadas. O tratamento do espécime continuará em uma base classificada até determinarmos por que nossos resultados têm uma ampla gama de variação.
column2: Successful Test Case 01/15/2034<LF><LF>A successful test case has been discovered and detained. The specimen's cooperation has been requested according to the predetermined stipulations. Treatment of the specimen will continue on a classified basis until we determine why our results have such a wide range of variation.
column3: Successful Test Case 01/15/2034<LF><LF>A successful test case has been discovered and detained. The specimen's cooperation has been requested according to the predetermined stipulations. Treatment of the specimen will continue on a classified basis until we determine why our results have such a wide range of variation.

column1: Relatório da Comissão de Purificação Mundial 09/30/2032<LF><LF>O primeiro destacamento está funcionando corretamente. No entanto, precaução contínua será necessária no futuro. Uma discussão sobre lidar com casos de recaída será adiada para a próxima conferência.
column2: World Purification Commission Report 09/30/2032<LF><LF>The first detachment is functioning properly. However, continued caution will be required well into the future. A discussion about dealing with relapse cases will be deferred to the next conference.
column3: World Purification Commission Report 09/30/2032<LF><LF>The first detachment is functioning properly. However, continued caution will be required well into the future. A discussion about dealing with relapse cases will be deferred to the next conference.

column1: Transição para o Modo de Sono 28/12/2034<LF><LF>A transição para o modo de sono está ocorrendo sem problemas.<LF>Tudo o que resta é rezarmos pelo sucesso final do Projeto Gestalt.<LF><LF>Que Deus tenha piedade de todos nós.
column2: Transition into Sleep Mode 12/28/2034<LF><LF>Transition into sleep mode is proceeding smoothly.<LF>All that remains is to pray for Project Gestalt's<LF>ultimate success.<LF><LF>May god have mercy on us all.

column1: 5 de Abril<LF><LF>Recebi uma carta do <SNOW_NIER> hoje! Ele está em uma cidade distante onde pode ver o oceano. Espero poder ver o oceano um dia. Aposto que é enorme!
column2: April 5<LF><LF>Got a letter from <SNOW_NIER> today! He's in a<LF>far-away town where he can see the ocean. I hope<LF>I can see the ocean someday. I bet it's huge!
column3: April 5<LF><LF>Got a letter from <SNOW_NIER> today! He's in a<LF>far-away town where he can see the ocean. I hope<LF>I can see the ocean someday. I bet it's huge!

column1: 6 de Junho<LF><LF>Hoje é o aniversário do <SNOW_NIER>, mas ele não está aqui. Então tive uma festa sozinha!
column2: June 6<LF><LF>Today is <SNOW_NIER>'s birthday, but he's not here.<LF>So I just had a party by myself!
column3: June 6<LF><LF>Today is <SNOW_NIER>'s birthday, but he's not here.<LF>So I just had a party by myself!

column1: 20 de Julho<LF><LF>Devola e Popola vieram me fazer companhia hoje. Elas até cantaram uma música para mim! Foi realmente ótimo! Preciso praticar para poder cantar para o <SNOW_NIER> quando ele voltar.
column2: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola came to keep me company today.<LF>They even sang a song for me! It was really great!<LF>I need to practice so I can sing to <SNOW_NIER> when he gets back.
column3: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola came to keep me company today.<LF>They even sang a song for me! It was really great!<LF>I need to practice so I can sing to <SNOW_NIER> when he gets back.

column1: 28 de outubro<LF><LF>Eu estava cansado hoje, então fiquei em casa e me escondi na cama.<LF>Ainda conseguia ouvir Devola cantando de algum lugar, porém.<LF>Ouvir ela sempre me faz feliz.
column2: October 28<LF><LF>I was tired today, so I stayed home and hid in bed.<LF>I could still hear Devola singing from somewhere, though.<LF>Listening to her always makes me happy.
column3: October 28<LF><LF>I was tired today, so I stayed home and hid in bed.<LF>I could still hear Devola singing from somewhere, though.<LF>Listening to her always makes me happy.

column1: 1 de dezembro<LF><LF>Hoje, Popola me mandou um novo livro sobre uma árvore grande e maravilhosa.<LF><LF>Eu realmente espero que ele tenha um final feliz.<LF>Não há nada pior do que uma árvore triste.
column2: December 1<LF><LF>Today, Popola sent me a new book about a great big tree.<LF>I really hope it has a happy ending. There's nothing<LF>worse than a sad tree.
column3: December 1<LF><LF>Today, Popola sent me a new book about a great big tree.<LF>I really hope it has a happy ending. There's nothing<LF>worse than a sad tree.

column1: 30 de janeiro<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> voltou!<LF>Ele voltou para casa para me ver! Uhuuu!
column2: January 30<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> came back!<LF>He came back home to see me! Yaaay!
column3: January 30<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> came back!<LF>He came back home to see me! Yaaay!

column1: 4 de fevereiro<LF><LF>Eu vou aprender a fazer comida incrível para <SNOW_NIER>. Melhor começar a trabalhar em uma nova receita secreta.
column2: February 4<LF><LF>I'm gonna learn to make awesome food for <SNOW_NIER>. I better start working on a new secret recipe.
column3: February 4<LF><LF>I'm gonna learn to make awesome food for <SNOW_NIER>. I better start working on a new secret recipe.

column1: 16 de março<LF><LF>O menino que sempre está correndo lá fora<LF>me deu uma flor super bonita hoje!<LF>Eu me pergunto se Popola sabe o nome dele?
column2: March 16<LF><LF>The boy who's always running around outside<LF>gave me a super pretty flower today!<LF>I wonder if Popola knows what it's called?
column3: March 16<LF><LF>The boy who's always running around outside<LF>gave me a super pretty flower today!<LF>I wonder if Popola knows what it's called?

column1: 31 de agosto<LF><LF>A vila está zumbindo de empolgação e coisas hoje.<LF>Não sei o que aconteceu, mas Devola me disse para não me preocupar.<LF>No começo pensei que fosse um festival, mas agora eu não sei.
column2: August 31<LF><LF>The village is buzzing with excitement and stuff today.<LF>I dunno what happened, but Devola told me not to worry.<LF>At first I thought it was a festival, but now I don't know.
column3: August 31<LF><LF>The village is buzzing with excitement and stuff today.<LF>I dunno what happened, but Devola told me not to worry.<LF>At first I thought it was a festival, but now I don't know.

column1: 4 de maio<LF><LF>Eu escrevo cartas para <SNOW_NIER> todos os dias.<LF>Ele sempre se preocupa comigo, mas eu me sinto bem.
column2: May 4<LF><LF>I write <SNOW_NIER> letters every single day. <LF>He always worries about me, but I feel fine.
column3: May 4<LF><LF>I write <SNOW_NIER> letters every single day. <LF>He always worries about me, but I feel fine.

column1: 21 de setembro<LF><LF>Eu gostaria de conhecer a senhora Kainé que <SNOW_NIER><LF>me falou. Aposto que ela é realmente legal<LF>e sempre diz coisas legais.<LF><LF>Eu me pergunto se minha mãe era assim?
column2: September 21<LF><LF>I wish I could meet the Kainé lady <SNOW_NIER><LF>told me about. I bet she's really nice<LF>and always says nice things.<LF><LF>I wonder if that's what my mom was like?
column3: September 21<LF><LF>I wish I could meet the Kainé lady <SNOW_NIER><LF>told me about. I bet she's really nice<LF>and always says nice things.<LF><LF>I wonder if that's what my mom was like?

column1: 22 de dezembro<LF><LF>A neve não para de cair, então <SNOW_NIER><LF>disse que ficaria aqui comigo até parar.<LF>Provavelmente ele vai embora de novo quando isso acontecer,<LF>então meio que espero que neve para sempre.
column2: December 22<LF><LF>The snow won't stop falling, so <SNOW_NIER><LF>said he'd stay here with me until it stops.<LF>He'll probably leave again when it does,<LF>so I kinda hope it snows forever.
column3: December 22<LF><LF>The snow won't stop falling, so <SNOW_NIER><LF>said he'd stay here with me until it stops.<LF>He'll probably leave again when it does,<LF>so I kinda hope it snows forever.

column1: 5 de abril<LF><LF>Quando eu leio uma carta do <SNOW_NIER>,<LF>eu realmente sinto que preciso vê-lo novamente.
column2: April 5<LF><LF>Whenever I read a letter from <SNOW_NIER>,<LF>I really feel like I need to see him again.
column3: April 5<LF><LF>Whenever I read a letter from <SNOW_NIER>,<LF>I really feel like I need to see him again.

column1: 6 de junho<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> disse que viria para casa no meu aniversário, <LF>mas eu quero comemorar o aniversário dele de vez em quando!
column2: June 6<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> said he'd come home for my birthday, <LF>but I wanna celebrate his birthday once in a while!
column3: June 6<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> said he'd come home for my birthday, <LF>but I wanna celebrate his birthday once in a while!

column1: 20 de julho<LF><LF>Devola e Popola voltaram para casa. Isso me deixou<LF>solitária, então eu saí correndo cantando músicas tão alto quanto podia.<LF><LF>Mas depois isso ficou estranho e assustador, então eu parei.
column2: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola went back home. That made me<LF>lonely, so I ran around singing songs as loud as I could.<LF>But then that got kinda weird and scary, so I stopped.
column3: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola went back home. That made me<LF>lonely, so I ran around singing songs as loud as I could.<LF>But then that got kinda weird and scary, so I stopped.

column1: 28 de outubro<LF><LF>Essas marcas pretas continuam aparecendo no meu corpo.<LF>Às vezes eu me pergunto se vou me transformar em um goblin<LF>ou algo assim, mas pensar sobre isso faz meu<LF>estômago doer, então tento não pensar nisso.
column2: October 28<LF><LF>These black marks keep showing up on my body.<LF>Sometimes I wonder if I'm gonna turn into a goblin<LF>or something, but thinking about it makes my<LF>stomach hurt, so I try not to.
column3: October 28<LF><LF>These black marks keep showing up on my body.<LF>Sometimes I wonder if I'm gonna turn into a goblin<LF>or something, but thinking about it makes my<LF>stomach hurt, so I try not to.

column1: 1º de dezembro<LF><LF>No livro, a grande árvore continuava esperando e esperando.<LF>Eu também tenho que esperar muito. Queria poder fazer algo.
column2: December 1<LF><LF>In the book, the big tree kept on waiting and waiting.<LF>I have to wait a lot, too. I wish I could do something.
column3: December 1<LF><LF>In the book, the big tree kept on waiting and waiting.<LF>I have to wait a lot, too. I wish I could do something.

column1: 30 de janeiro<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> saiu rapidamente. Ele disse que só passou<LF>para ver meu rosto.
column2: January 30<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> left pretty quick. He said he just<LF>stopped by so he could see my face.
column3: January 30<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> left pretty quick. He said he just<LF>stopped by so he could see my face.

column3: February 4<LF><LF>Once I finish my secret dish,<LF>I'm gonna feed it to <SNOW_NIER>!<LF>Then he'll see how helpful I can be!

column1: 16 de março<LF><LF>A flor não estava em nenhum dos livros da Devola,<LF>então ela disse que eu podia dar qualquer nome.<LF>Talvez eu dê o nome dele para <SNOW_NIER>!
column2: March 16<LF><LF>The flower wasn't in any of Devola's books,<LF>so she said I could name it whatever I want.<LF>Maybe I'll name it after <SNOW_NIER>!
column3: March 16<LF><LF>The flower wasn't in any of Devola's books,<LF>so she said I could name it whatever I want.<LF>Maybe I'll name it after <SNOW_NIER>!

column1: 31 de agosto<LF><LF>Eu acho que uma sombra se aproximou da vila hoje.<LF>As pessoas ficavam vindo até mim e dizendo<LF>"Caramba, como seria bom se seu irmão estivesse aqui!"<LF>E eu respondi, "Eu também! <SNOW_NIER> chutaria o traseiro dessa Sombra!"
column2: August 31<LF><LF>I guess a Shade came near the village today.<LF>People kept coming up to me and saying<LF>"Boy, we sure wish your brother was around!"<LF>And I said, "Me too! <SNOW_NIER> could kick that Shade's butt!"
column3: August 31<LF><LF>I guess a Shade came near the village today.<LF>People kept coming up to me and saying<LF>"Boy, we sure wish your brother was around!"<LF>And I said, "Me too! <SNOW_NIER> could kick that Shade's butt!"

column1: 4 de maio<LF><LF>Eu queria que <SNOW_NIER> enviasse cartas<LF>todos os dias como eu faço. Mas eu sei que ele está ocupado,<LF>então dia sim, dia não está bom.
column2: May 4<LF><LF>I wish <SNOW_NIER> would send letters<LF>every day like I do. But I know he's busy,<LF>so every other day is okay.
column3: May 4<LF><LF>I wish <SNOW_NIER> would send letters<LF>every day like I do. But I know he's busy,<LF>so every other day is okay.

column1: 21 de setembro<LF><LF>Hoje Devola disse que Kainé está "bem arrumada em todos<LF>os lugares certos." Eu não sei o que isso significa,<LF>mas eu quero ser assim quando eu crescer!
column2: September 21<LF><LF>Today Devola said that Kainé is "put together in all<LF>the right places." I dunno what all of that means,<LF>but I wanna be like that when I grow up!
column3: September 21<LF><LF>Today Devola said that Kainé is "put together in all<LF>the right places." I dunno what all of that means,<LF>but I wanna be like that when I grow up!

column1: 22 de dezembro<LF><LF>Um mercador passou pela vila hoje,<LF>e ela continuava tirando coisas loucas<LF>de sua grande bolsa! Ela disse que seu nome era Accord.
column2: December 22<LF><LF>A merchant passed through the village today,<LF>and she just kept pulling the craziest stuff out<LF>of her big bag! She said her name was Accord.
column3: December 22<LF><LF>A merchant passed through the village today,<LF>and she just kept pulling the craziest stuff out<LF>of her big bag! She said her name was Accord.

column1: 6 de junho<LF><LF>Eu tinha lágrimas nos olhos quando acordei esta manhã.<LF>Eu devo ter tido um sonho muito triste. Talvez eu fale com<LF>Kainé sobre isso na próxima vez que a ver.
column2: June 6<LF><LF>I had tears in my eyes when I woke up this morning.<LF>I must have had a really sad dream. Maybe I'll talk to<LF>Kainé about it the next time I see her.
column3: June 6<LF><LF>I had tears in my eyes when I woke up this morning.<LF>I must have had a really sad dream. Maybe I'll talk to<LF>Kainé about it the next time I see her.

column1: 5 de abril<LF><LF>Recebi uma carta de Kainé! Ela disse que há uma cidade<LF>muito, muito longe onde se pode ver o oceano.<LF>Eu queria poder vê-lo também. Eu me pergunto o quão grande é?
column2: April 5<LF><LF>I got a letter from Kainé! She said there's a town<LF>far, far away where you can see the ocean.<LF>I wish I could see it, too. I wonder how big it is?
column3: April 5<LF><LF>I got a letter from Kainé! She said there's a town<LF>far, far away where you can see the ocean.<LF>I wish I could see it, too. I wonder how big it is?

column1: 20 de julho<LF><LF>Devola e Popola vieram aqui brincar comigo. <LF>Foi muito divertido - eles cantaram para mim e tudo mais! <LF>Vou praticar muito e cantar para a Kainé!
column2: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola came over to play with me.<LF>It was so much fun—they sang for me and everything!<LF>I'm gonna practice real hard and sing for Kainé!
column3: July 20<LF><LF>Devola and Popola came over to play with me.<LF>It was so much fun—they sang for me and everything!<LF>I'm gonna practice real hard and sing for Kainé!

column1: 30 de janeiro<LF><LF>A Kainé veio me ver!<LF>Ela veio até aqui só para me ver!
column2: January 30<LF><LF>Kainé came to see me!<LF>She came all the way here just to see ME!
column3: January 30<LF><LF>Kainé came to see me!<LF>She came all the way here just to see ME!

column1: 4 de fevereiro<LF><LF>Decidi que quero ficar muito bom na cozinha, para poder fazer algo superespecial para a Kainé. <LF>Será o meu prato assinatura, supersecreto!
column2: February 4<LF><LF>I've decided I want to get really good at cooking so<LF>I can make Kainé something that knocks her socks off.<LF>It'll be my super-secret signature dish!
column3: February 4<LF><LF>I've decided I want to get really good at cooking so<LF>I can make Kainé something that knocks her socks off.<LF>It'll be my super-secret signature dish!

column1: 4 de maio<LF><LF>Escrevo cartas todos os dias, mas às vezes me pergunto se a Kainé vai se preocupar se eu enviar muitas delas. <LF>Melhor escrever e dizer que estou ótimo!
column2: May 4<LF><LF>I write letters every single day, but sometimes I<LF>wonder if Kainé will worry if I send too many.<LF>I'd better write her and say I'm doing great!
column3: May 4<LF><LF>I write letters every single day, but sometimes I<LF>wonder if Kainé will worry if I send too many.<LF>I'd better write her and say I'm doing great!

column1: 22 de dezembro<LF><LF>Não para de nevar. Mas tudo bem, porque a Kainé vai ficar aqui comigo até parar. <LF>Espero que ela não vá embora quando isso acontecer...
column2: December 22<LF><LF>It won't stop snowing. But that's okay, because<LF>Kainé will stay here with me until it does.<LF>I hope she doesn't leave when it stops...
column3: December 22<LF><LF>It won't stop snowing. But that's okay, because<LF>Kainé will stay here with me until it does.<LF>I hope she doesn't leave when it stops...

column1: 5 de abril<LF><LF>Eu estava lendo uma carta da Kainé<LF>e percebi que sinto muita falta dela...
column2: April 5<LF><LF>I was reading a letter from Kainé<LF>and realized that I really miss her...
column3: April 5<LF><LF>I was reading a letter from Kainé<LF>and realized that I really miss her...

column1: 6 de junho<LF><LF>A Kainé disse que viria me visitar no meu aniversário,<LF>mas eu gostaria de comemorar O ANIVERSÁRIO DELA<LF>alguma vez. Seria tão divertido!
column2: June 6<LF><LF>Kainé said she'd come visit for my birthday,<LF>but I wish we could celebrate HER birthday<LF>sometime. That'd be so fun!
column3: June 6<LF><LF>Kainé said she'd come visit for my birthday,<LF>but I wish we could celebrate HER birthday<LF>sometime. That'd be so fun!

column1: 30 de janeiro<LF><LF>A Kainé veio me ver, mas depois foi embora rapidamente.<LF>Ela disse que só queria ver meu rosto.
column2: January 30<LF><LF>Kainé stopped by, but then left right away.<LF>She said she just wanted to see my face.
column3: January 30<LF><LF>Kainé stopped by, but then left right away.<LF>She said she just wanted to see my face.

column1: 4 de fevereiro<LF><LF>Assim que eu terminar minha receita secreta, a Kainé<LF>será a primeira a experimentar! Não é legal ter<LF>alguém tão prestativo por perto, Kainé?
column2: February 4<LF><LF>Once I'm done with my secret recipe, Kainé<LF>will be the first one to eat it! Isn't it nice to<LF>have someone so helpful around, Kainé?
column3: February 4<LF><LF>Once I'm done with my secret recipe, Kainé<LF>will be the first one to eat it! Isn't it nice to<LF>have someone so helpful around, Kainé?

column1: 4 de maio<LF><LF>Gostaria de receber uma carta da Kainé todos os dias.<LF>Será que isso a incomodaria se eu dissesse?
column2: May 4<LF><LF>I wish I could get a letter from Kainé every day.<LF>I wonder if it would bother her to know that?
column3: May 4<LF><LF>I wish I could get a letter from Kainé every day.<LF>I wonder if it would bother her to know that?

column1: 14 de agosto<LF><LF>Assim que eu melhorar, quero ir nadar no oceano.<LF>Tenho certeza de que <SNOW_NIER> vai dizer que é perigoso demais,<LF>mas sei que eu seria ótimo nisso!
column2: August 14<LF><LF>Once I get better, I want to go swimming in the ocean.<LF>I'm sure <SNOW_NIER> will say it's too dangerous,<LF>but I know I'd be great at it!
column3: August 14<LF><LF>Once I get better, I want to go swimming in the ocean.<LF>I'm sure <SNOW_NIER> will say it's too dangerous,<LF>but I know I'd be great at it!

column1: 22 de novembro<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> me contou uma história antes de dormir outro dia sobre um casal com bolsas vermelhas combinando.<LF>Ele disse que eles brigam o tempo todo, mas também se dão muito bem?
column2: November 22<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> told me a story before bedtime the other<LF>day about a husband and wife with matching red bags.<LF>He said they fight all the time, but also get along great?
column3: November 22<LF><LF><SNOW_NIER> told me a story before bedtime the other<LF>day about a husband and wife with matching red bags.<LF>He said they fight all the time, but also get along great?

column1: 22 de abril<LF><LF>Eu vi <SNOW_NIER> lendo o diário da mãe.<LF>Tentei ler uma vez também, mas estava cheio de<LF>palavras difíceis e eu não entendi nada.
column2: April 22<LF><LF>I saw <SNOW_NIER> reading Mom's diary.<LF>I tried reading it once, too, but it was filled with<LF>all these hard words and I didn't get it at all.
column3: April 22<LF><LF>I saw <SNOW_NIER> reading Mom's diary.<LF>I tried reading it once, too, but it was filled with<LF>all these hard words and I didn't get it at all.

column1: 12 de dezembro<LF><LF>Dei as mãos a <SNOW_NIER> quando voltamos para casa hoje. As mãos dele são muito maiores<LF>do que a minha, e são realmente quentes!
column2: December 12<LF><LF>I held hands with <SNOW_NIER> when we walked<LF>home today. His hands are so much bigger<LF>than mine, and they're really warm!
column3: December 12<LF><LF>I held hands with <SNOW_NIER> when we walked<LF>home today. His hands are so much bigger<LF>than mine, and they're really warm!

column1: 3 de fevereiro<LF><LF>Devola me disse que eu não vou crescer se eu continuar sendo exigente<LF>com o que eu como - mas ainda acho que cenouras são nojentas.
column2: February 3<LF><LF>Devola told me that I won't grow if I keep being picky<LF>about what I eat—but I still think carrots are gross.
column3: February 3<LF><LF>Devola told me that I won't grow if I keep being picky<LF>about what I eat—but I still think carrots are gross.

column1: 29 de março<LF><LF>Esta é a primeira vez em um tempo que escrevo<LF>em meu diário. Estava lendo minhas entradas antigas<LF>e não pude resistir!
column2: March 29<LF><LF>This is the first time in a while I've written<LF>in my diary. I was reading my older entries<LF>and just couldn't help myself!

column1: Relatório de Nova Tecnologia 08/07/2032<LF><LF>Embora a infecção resultante da síndrome de Coloração Branca<LF>torne nossa solução imperfeita, temos motivos para esperar<LF>alguns resultados positivos. Os testes começarão nos<LF>sujeitos previamente selecionados; manter registros sobre<LF>a segurança do procedimento é a maior prioridade.
column2: New Technology Report 08/07/2032<LF><LF>Although the resultant white chlorination syndrome infection<LF>makes ours an imperfect solution, we have reason to expect<LF>some positive results. Testing will begin on the previously<LF>selected subjects; recordkeeping on the procedure's safety<LF>is top priority.

column1: Anomalias 06/23/2033<LF><LF>Várias anomalias deletérias foram encontradas em um<LF>sujeito nas fases iniciais de tratamento, incluindo um estado<LF>de recaída resultando na perda total de si mesmo. Nós vamos<LF>investigar a causa deste erro e apresentar um plano de<LF>contra medida imediatamente.
column2: Abnormalities 06/23/2033<LF><LF>Several deleterious abnormalities have been found with a<LF>subject in the early stages of treatment, including a relapse<LF>state resulting in a total loss of self. We will investigate<LF>the cause of this error and submit a countermeasure plan<LF>immediately.
column3: Abnormalities 06/23/2033<LF><LF>Several deleterious abnormalities have been found with a<LF>subject in the early stages of treatment, including a relapse<LF>state resulting in a total loss of self.
