column3: The young man has become a soldier.

column1: O dono da loja de itens precisa da sua ajuda para encontrar os culpados que roubaram sua loja. Comece perguntando por pistas.
column2: The item shopkeeper needs your help finding the culprits that robbed his store. Begin by asking around for clues.
column3: The item shopkeeper needs your help finding the culprits that robbed his store. Begin by asking around for clues.

column1: Aparentemente os culpados trabalham em dupla...
column2: Apparently the culprits work as a pair...
column3: Apparently the culprits work as a pair...

column1: Os ladrões eram um par de crianças. Você precisa falar com o pai deles. Tente a taverna.
column2: The robbers were a pair of children. You need to talk to their father. Try the tavern.
column3: The robbers were a pair of children. You need to talk to their father. Try the tavern.

column1: O pai é inútil. Relate ao cliente por agora.
column2: The father is useless. Report back to the client for now.
column3: The father is useless. Report back to the client for now.

column2: Can anyone take care of these kids?
column3: Can anyone take care of these kids?

column1: Seu cliente diz que ele procurará um guardião para as crianças. Esperançosamente ele encontrará alguém bom.
column2: Your client says he'll search for a guardian for the children. Hopefully he'll find someone good.
column3: Your client says he'll search for a guardian for the children. Hopefully he'll find someone good.

column1: Popola concordou em cuidar das crianças.
column2: Popola has agreed to take care of the children.
column3: Popola has agreed to take care of the children.

column1: Um homem viajando em um navio em Beira-mar quer fazer um medicamento que irá prevenir o enjoo. Compre para ele uma folha de mandrágora na loja de coisa-estranhas em Facade.
column2: A man traveling on a ship in Seafront wants to make a medication that will prevent seasickness. Buy him a mandrake leaf from the strange-thing store in Facade.
column3: A man traveling on a ship in Seafront wants to make a medication that will prevent seasickness. Buy him a mandrake leaf from the strange-thing store in Facade.

column1: Você obteve a folha de mandrágora. O dono da loja de coisa-estranhas agiu estranhamente quando você perguntou por ela...
column2: You obtained the mandrake leaf. The shopkeeper at the strange-thing store sure acted funny when you asked for it...
column3: You obtained the mandrake leaf. The shopkeeper at the strange-thing store sure acted funny when you asked for it...

column1: Seu cliente ainda está trabalhando em uma cura para o enjoo no mar. Traga para ele um pouco de óleo de sapo da Armamento dos Dois Irmãos na Lixão.
column2: Your client is still working on his seasickness cure. Bring him some toad oil from Two Brothers Weaponry in the Junk Heap.
column3: Your client is still working on his seasickness cure. Bring him some toad oil from Two Brothers Weaponry in the Junk Heap.

column1: Com uma piscadela e um empurrãozinho, o irmão mais novo lhe vendeu um pouco de óleo de sapo.
column2: With a nudge and a wink, the younger brother sold you some toad oil.
column3: With a nudge and a wink, the younger brother sold you some toad oil.

column1: O cliente acabou entrando no ramo de medicamentos.
column2: The client wound up going into the medicine business.
column3: The client wound up going into the medicine business.

column1: A criança do comerciante foi afetada por uma doença misteriosa depois de brincar com seus amigos. Talvez as outras crianças saibam a causa.
column2: The grocer's child has been stricken by a mysterious illness after playing with his friends. Maybe the other children would know the cause.
column3: The grocer's child has been stricken by a mysterious illness after playing with his friends. Maybe the other children would know the cause.

column1: Aparentemente a chave está na Floresta dos Mitoss.
column2: Apparently the key lies in the Forest of Myth.
column3: Apparently the key lies in the Forest of Myth.

column1: Você encontrou algumas frutas com aparência venenosa. Elas poderiam ter algo a ver com a doença?
column2: You found some poisonous-looking berries. Could they have something to do with the illness?
column3: You found some poisonous-looking berries. Could they have something to do with the illness?

column1: Pesquise a biblioteca por pistas sobre um antídoto.
column2: Scour the library for clues to an antidote.
column3: Scour the library for clues to an antidote.

column1: A criança aparentemente consumiu algumas frutas venenosas. Traga o antídoto para o cliente.
column2: The child apparently consumed some poisonous berries. Bring the antidote to the client.
column3: The child apparently consumed some poisonous berries. Bring the antidote to the client.

column1: Você salvou a vida da criança.
A mulher sentada diagonalmente em frente à loja de armas pediu que você encontrasse um jovem usando um colar de ouro. Pergunte por aí para ver se alguém próximo o viu.
column2: The woman sitting diagonally across from the weapon shop asked you to find a young man wearing a golden necklace. Ask around to see if anyone nearby saw him.
column3: The woman sitting diagonally across from the weapon shop asked you to find a young man wearing a golden necklace. Ask around to see if anyone nearby saw him.

column1: Você descobriu que ele está na Floresta dos Mitos.
column2: You learned that he's in the Forest of Myth.
column3: You learned that he's in the Forest of Myth.

column1: Você descobriu que ele está em Beira-Mar.
column2: You learned that he's in Seafront.
column3: You learned that he's in Seafront.

column1: Você descobriu que ele está no Lixão. Vá até a Loja de Armas Dos Dois Irmãos e pergunte sobre ele.
column2: You learned that he's at the Junk Heap. Go to Two Brothers Weaponry and ask about him.
column3: You learned that he's at the Junk Heap. Go to Two Brothers Weaponry and ask about him.

column1: Você descobriu que ele está bem fundo no Lixão.
column2: You learned that he's deep inside the Junk Heap.
column3: You learned that he's deep inside the Junk Heap.

column1: O homem está morto. Informe o cliente.
column2: The man is dead. Report back to the client.
column3: The man is dead. Report back to the client.

column1: Você informou o cliente da situação. Este não foi um trabalho muito agradável...
column2: You informed the client of the situation. This wasn't a very pleasant job...
column3: You informed the client of the situation. This wasn't a very pleasant job...

column1: O dono da taverna em Beira-Mar quer que você compre uma faca de cozinha no Lixão. Ele está disposto a pagar generosamente.
column2: The tavern keeper in Seafront wants you to purchase a kitchen knife from the Junk Heap. He's willing to pay handsomely.
column3: The tavern keeper in Seafront wants you to purchase a kitchen knife from the Junk Heap. He's willing to pay handsomely.

column1: A loja não tem as dez ligas de titânio necessárias para construir tal faca.
column2: The shop lacks the ten titanium alloys needed to build such a knife.
column3: The shop lacks the ten titanium alloys needed to build such a knife.

column1: Você coletou a liga. Retorne para a loja para que eles possam criar a faca.
column2: You collected the alloy. Return to the shop so they can craft the knife.
column3: You collected the alloy. Return to the shop so they can craft the knife.

column1: A faca está completa. Leve-a de volta ao cliente.
column2: The knife is complete. Bring it back to the client.
column3: The knife is complete. Bring it back to the client.

column1: Você entregou o facão para o homem.
column2: You gave the man his kitchen knife.
column3: You gave the man his kitchen knife.

column1: Colete cinco baterias quebradas e cinco motores quebrados para reparar o elevador no Lixão.
column2: Collect five broken batteries and five broken motors to repair the elevator in the Junk Heap.
column3: Collect five broken batteries and five broken motors to repair the elevator in the Junk Heap.

column1: Você coletou as peças de reparo. Traga-as de volta para o irmão mais novo.
column2: You collected the repair parts. Bring them back to the younger brother.
column3: You collected the repair parts. Bring them back to the younger brother.

column1: O elevador está funcionando novamente. Derrote todos as Sombras no segundo andar do Lixão.
column2: The elevator is back online. Defeat all the Shades on the second floor of the Junk Heap.
column3: The elevator is back online. Defeat all the Shades on the second floor of the Junk Heap.

column1: As Sombras foram derrotados. Informe de volta à loja no Lixão.
column2: The Shades are defeated. Report back to the shop at the Junk Heap.
column3: The Shades are defeated. Report back to the shop at the Junk Heap.

column1: Você informou de volta ao irmão mais novo, mas a única coisa na mente dele é destruir robôs...
column2: You reported back to the younger brother, but destroying robots is the only thing on his mind...
column3: You reported back to the younger brother, but destroying robots is the only thing on his mind...

column1: O ferreiro pediu que você encontrasse um mapa do tesouro. Onde você procuraria por tal coisa...?
column2: The blacksmith has asked you to find a treasure map. Where would you look for such a thing...?
column3: The blacksmith has asked you to find a treasure map. Where would you look for such a thing...?

column1: O mapa está muito danificado. Talvez a loja de coisas estranhas de Facade possa restaurá-lo.
column2: The map is heavily damaged. Perhaps Facade's strange-thing store would be able to restore it.
column3: The map is heavily damaged. Perhaps Facade's strange-thing store would be able to restore it.

column1: Recolha três gotas de óleo de máquina, três berinjelas e três peles de cabra para reparar o mapa.
column2: Gather three drops of machine oil, three eggplants, and three goat hides to repair the map.
column3: Gather three drops of machine oil, three eggplants, and three goat hides to repair the map.

column1: Você coletou os materiais necessários para restaurar o mapa. Traga-os para a loja de objetos estranhos.
column2: You collected the materials needed to restore the map. Bring them to the strange-thing store.
column3: You collected the materials needed to restore the map. Bring them to the strange-thing store.

column1: O mapa foi restaurado. Leve-o para o cliente.
column2: The map has been restored. Bring it to the client.
column3: The map has been restored. Bring it to the client.

column1: A esposa do homem pediu que você procurasse o tesouro no lugar dele. Leve o mapa para Popola decifrá-lo para você.
column2: The man's wife asked you to search for the treasure in place of her husband. Bring the map to Popola to have her decipher it for you.
column3: The man's wife asked you to search for the treasure in place of her husband. Bring the map to Popola to have her decipher it for you.

column1: De acordo com o mapa, o tesouro está dentro do Santuário Perdido, em um lugar onde a luz do sol não alcança.
column2: According to the map, the treasure is inside the Lost Shrine, in a place where sunlight does not reach.
column3: According to the map, the treasure is inside the Lost Shrine, in a place where sunlight does not reach.

column1: Você encontrou o tesouro, mas acabou sendo inútil. Informe a esposa do cliente.
column2: You found the treasure, but it turned out to be worthless. Report back to the client's wife.
column3: You found the treasure, but it turned out to be worthless. Report back to the client's wife.

column1: O cliente lhe deu um mapa do tesouro. Pode ser inútil, mas talvez uma viagem para Popola esteja em ordem para ver se ela pode decifrá-lo.
column2: The client gave you a treasure map. It might be worthless, but perhaps a trip to Popola's is in order to see if she can decipher it.
column3: The client gave you a treasure map. It might be worthless, but perhaps a trip to Popola's is in order to see if she can decipher it.

column1: Você deu ao cliente o ouro que recebeu em troca do enfeite de cabelo.
column2: You gave the client the gold you got in exchange for the hair ornament.
column3: You gave the client the gold you got in exchange for the hair ornament.

column1: O mapa aparentemente retrata "o início de uma ponte de aço".
column2: The map apparently depicts "the start of a steel bridge."
column3: The map apparently depicts "the start of a steel bridge."

column1: Você deu ao homem o enfeite de cabelo.
column2: You gave the man the hair ornament.
column3: You gave the man the hair ornament.

column1: Você encontrou tesouro nas planícies do norte. O que você sabe? Parece que mapas de tesouro reais existem.
column2: You found treasure in the northern plains. What do you know? It seems real treasure maps do exist.
column3: You found treasure in the northern plains. What do you know? It seems real treasure maps do exist.

column1: O mordomo quer que você explore as instalações subterrâneas da mansão em busca de uma maneira de restaurar o corpo de Emil ao normal. Uma pista aparentemente aguarda no segundo andar do porão.
column2: The butler wants you to explore the manor's underground facility in search of a way to restore Emil's body to normal. A clue apparently awaits in the second basement floor.
column3: The butler wants you to explore the manor's underground facility in search of a way to restore Emil's body to normal. A clue apparently awaits in the second basement floor.

column1: Você obteve o endereço de um ex-pesquisador, cuja residência está localizada acima da entrada de Beira-mar.
column2: You've obtained the address of a former researcher, whose residence is located above the entrance to Seafront.
column3: You've obtained the address of a former researcher, whose residence is located above the entrance to Seafront.

column1: Você encontrou uma carta misteriosa na casa do ex-pesquisador. Mostre-a ao mordomo.
column2: You found a mysterious letter in the ex-researcher's house. Show it to the butler.
column3: You found a mysterious letter in the ex-researcher's house. Show it to the butler.

column1: A carta misteriosa foi endereçada a Emil. Emil parecia feliz em vê-la.
column2: The mysterious letter was addressed to Emil.<LF>Emil seemed happy to see it.
column3: The mysterious letter was addressed to Emil.<LF>Emil seemed happy to see it.

column1: Você derrotou a mulher, que estava disfarçada como um dos Masked People. Será que ela era uma Sombra o tempo todo?
column2: You defeated the woman, who was disguised as one of the Masked People. Had she been a Shade this whole time?
column3: You defeated the woman, who was disguised as one of the Masked People. Had she been a Shade this whole time?

column1: O guarda da entrada sul do distrito comercial diz que há uma Sombra na vila.
column2: The guard by the shopping district's southern entrance claims there's a Shade in the village.
column3: The guard by the shopping district's southern entrance claims there's a Shade in the village.

column1: De acordo com a garota, a Sombra estava perto do rio.
column2: According to the girl, the Shade was near the river.
column3: According to the girl, the Shade was near the river.

column1: Você não conseguiu encontrar a Sombra. Pergunte à garota onde ela viu mais uma vez.
column2: You failed to find the Shade. Ask the girl where she saw it one more time.
column3: You failed to find the Shade. Ask the girl where she saw it one more time.

column1: A Sombra estava supostamente em frente à biblioteca.
column2: The Shade was reportedly in front of the library.
column3: The Shade was reportedly in front of the library.

column1: Não havia Sombra para ser achado. A menina está dando declarações conflitantes. Pergunte a outros moradores por pistas.
column2: There was no Shade to be found. The girl is giving you conflicting statements. Ask some other villagers for clues.
column3: There was no Shade to be found. The girl is giving you conflicting statements. Ask some other villagers for clues.

column1: Aparentemente, a garota tem estado mentindo para você. Volte e confronte-a sobre isso.
column2: Apparently the girl has been telling you lies. Go back and confront her about it.
column3: Apparently the girl has been telling you lies. Go back and confront her about it.

column1: A garota diz que a Sombra definitivamente não está perto do portão norte ou da colina a oeste. Hmm...
column2: The girl says that the Shade is definitely not near the northern gate or the hill to the west. Hmm...
column3: The girl says that the Shade is definitely not near the northern gate or the hill to the west. Hmm...

column1: Você derrotou com sucesso a Sombra. Reporte-se ao guarda.
column2: You successfully defeated the Shade. Report back to the guard.
column3: You successfully defeated the Shade. Report back to the guard.

column1: Você perseguiu a Sombra para fora da vila.
column2: You chased the Shade out of the village.
column3: You chased the Shade out of the village.

column1: Um homem que vive acima da loja de armas em Beira-mar pediu para você entregar uma flor freesia para a pessoa que comanda a loja de materiais em Facade.
column2: A man who lives above the weapon shop in Seafront asked you to deliver a freesia flower to the person running the material shop in Facade.
column3: A man who lives above the weapon shop in Seafront asked you to deliver a freesia flower to the person running the material shop in Facade.

column1: Você entregou com segurança a freesia. Retorne ao homem para coletar sua recompensa.
column2: You safely delivered the freesia. Return to the man to collect your reward.
column3: You safely delivered the freesia. Return to the man to collect your reward.

column1: Você recebeu uma recompensa do homem.
column2: You received a reward from the man.
column3: You received a reward from the man.

column1: O mordomo quer que você acabe com as Sombras da mansão.
column2: The butler wants you to clear Shades from the manor.
column3: The butler wants you to clear Shades from the manor.

column1: Você derrotou todas as Sombras, incluindo uma disfarçada de mercenário.
column2: You defeated all of the Shades, including one disguised as a mercenary.
column3: You defeated all of the Shades, including one disguised as a mercenary.

column1: Uma mulher perto da entrada da Floresta dos Mitos pediu para você encontrar uma "pedra mágica<LF>" usada na adivinhação. Fale com Popola para obter mais detalhes.
column2: A woman near the entrance to the Forest of Myth asked you to find a "magical <LF>stone" used in fortune-telling. Talk to Popola to get more details.
column3: A woman near the entrance to the Forest of Myth asked you to find a "magical <LF>stone" used in fortune-telling. Talk to Popola to get more details.

column1: O Olho do Poder aparentemente pode ser encontrado no telhado do Santuário Perdido.
column2: The Eye of Power can apparently be found on the roof of the Lost Shrine.
column3: The Eye of Power can apparently be found on the roof of the Lost Shrine.

column1: Você obteve o Olho do Poder. Traga-o de volta para o cliente.
column2: You obtained the Eye of Power. Bring it back to the client.
column3: You obtained the Eye of Power. Bring it back to the client.

column1: Você deu a pedra para o cliente. Mas o que você viu...?
column2: You gave the stone to the client. But what did you see...?
column3: You gave the stone to the client. But what did you see...?

column1: Despache a Sombra que se instalou perto da ponte nas planícies do norte. No entanto, parece que a Sombra nem sempre está lá ...
column2: Dispatch the Shade that has taken up residence near the bridge in the northern plains. However, it seems the Shade isn't always there...
column3: Dispatch the Shade that has taken up residence near the bridge in the northern plains. However, it seems the Shade isn't always there...

column1: Você matou a Sombra; a ponte está segura novamente. Informe ao cliente.
column2: You killed the Shade; the bridge is safe once more. Report back to the client.
column3: You killed the Shade; the bridge is safe once more. Report back to the client.

column1: Você deu a notícia ao cliente. Infelizmente, sua filha morreu por causa de seus ferimentos.
column2: You gave the news to the client. Sadly, his daughter died from her injuries.
column3: You gave the news to the client. Sadly, his daughter died from her injuries.

column1: Uma grande Sombra foi avistada nas planícies do sul. O carteiro de Beira-mar pediu para você eliminá-la.
column2: A large Shade has been sighted in the southern plains. The Seafront postman has asked you to eliminate it for him.
column3: A large Shade has been sighted in the southern plains. The Seafront postman has asked you to eliminate it for him.

column1: Você derrotou a grande Sombra. Informe ao carteiro.
column2: You defeated the large Shade. Report back to the postman.
column3: You defeated the large Shade. Report back to the postman.

column1: Você deu a boa notícia ao carteiro.
column2: You gave the good news to the postman.
column3: You gave the good news to the postman.

column1: Investigue uma Sombra que apareceu no escritório.
column2: Investigate a Shade that has appeared in the study.
column3: Investigate a Shade that has appeared in the study.

column1: Você aniquilou a Sombra. Isso deve manter o lugar seguro por um tempo.
column2: You annihilated the Shade. That should keep the place safe for a while.
column3: You annihilated the Shade. That should keep the place safe for a while.

column1: O botânico ao lado da loja de itens em Beira-mar pediu um pedaço de raiz da grande árvore do Lost Shrine.
column2: The botanist next to the item shop in Seafront asked for a piece of root from the Lost Shrine's great tree.
column3: The botanist next to the item shop in Seafront asked for a piece of root from the Lost Shrine's great tree.

column1: Você obteve o pedaço de raiz. Leve-o de volta para o cliente.
column2: You obtained the piece of root. Bring it back to the client.
column3: You obtained the piece of root. Bring it back to the client.

column1: Você entregou a raiz para o cliente.
column2: You gave the root to the client.
column3: You gave the root to the client.

column1: Um guarda na entrada da Facade diz que muitas pessoas têm desaparecido em tempestades de areia recentemente. Talvez seja melhor investigar.
column2: A gate guard in Facade says a great number of people have gone missing in sandstorms as of late. Perhaps you'd better investigate.
column3: A gate guard in Facade says a great number of people have gone missing in sandstorms as of late. Perhaps you'd better investigate.

column1: Você derrotou a Sombra. Relate ao cliente.
column2: You defeated the Shade. Report back to the client.
column3: You defeated the Shade. Report back to the client.

column1: Você relatou ao cliente. Esperançosamente não haverão mais dessas Sombras.
column2: You reported back to the client. Hopefully there aren't any more of those Shades.
column3: You reported back to the client. Hopefully there aren't any more of those Shades.

column1: O rei de Facade pediu que você limpe todos as Sombras do Templo Árido.
column2: The king of Facade asked you to clear all of the Shades from the Barren Temple.
column3: The king of Facade asked you to clear all of the Shades from the Barren Temple.

column1: Você matou todos as Sombras. Os reis antigos agora podem descansar.
column2: You killed all of the Shades. The ancient kings can rest now.
column3: You killed all of the Shades. The ancient kings can rest now.

column1: Um velho sentado ao lado da loja de itens no distrito comercial diz que um javali selvagem tem ferido pessoas nas planícies do norte. É hora de acabar com sua rampagem.
column2: An old man sitting next to the item shop in the shopping district says that a wild boar has been injuring people in the northern plains. It's time to end its rampage.
column3: An old man sitting next to the item shop in the shopping district says that a wild boar has been injuring people in the northern plains. It's time to end its rampage.

column1: Você derrotou o javali selvagem. Relate ao cliente.
column2: You defeated the wild boar. Report back to the client.
column3: You defeated the wild boar. Report back to the client.

column1: O cliente disse que um dente de javali permitirá que você domine e monte os animais.
column2: The client said that a boar's tusk will allow you to tame and ride the animals.
column3: The client said that a boar's tusk will allow you to tame and ride the animals.

column1: Uma carta chegou do carteiro do Beira-mar. Ele quer que você entregue um pacote para a senhora do farol.
column2: A letter has arrived from the Seafront postman. He wants you to deliver a parcel to the lighthouse lady.
column3: A letter has arrived from the Seafront postman. He wants you to deliver a parcel to the lighthouse lady.

column1: Você recebeu o pacote da velha senhora. Leve-o para o farol.
column2: You received the old lady's parcel. Bring it to the lighthouse.
column3: You received the old lady's parcel. Bring it to the lighthouse.

column1: Você entregou o pacote para a senhora.
column2: You delivered the parcel to the lady.
column3: You delivered the parcel to the lady.

column1: O carteiro do Beira-mar quer que você entregue uma carta para a velha senhora.
column2: The Seafront postman wants you to bring a letter to the old lady.
column3: The Seafront postman wants you to bring a letter to the old lady.

column1: Você entregou a carta para a senhora. Ela é falante, mas pelo menos paga bem.
column2: You delivered the letter to the lady. She's got a big mouth, but at least she pays well.
column3: You delivered the letter to the lady. She's got a big mouth, but at least she pays well.

column1: A senhora quer deixar a cidade, e o carteiro pediu para você convencê-la do contrário. Vá visitá-la.
column2: The lady wants to leave town, and the postman has asked you to convince her otherwise. Go pay her a visit.
column3: The lady wants to leave town, and the postman has asked you to convince her otherwise. Go pay her a visit.

column1: A velha senhora está aflita com o Rabisco Negro. Visite o carteiro para ajudar a realizar o último pedido dela.
column2: The old lady is afflicted with the Black Scrawl. Visit the postman to help make her last request come true.
column3: The old lady is afflicted with the Black Scrawl. Visit the postman to help make her last request come true.

column1: O carteiro está agindo estranhamente. Volte ao escritório postal.
column2: The postman is acting strange. Return to the post office.
column3: The postman is acting strange. Return to the post office.

column1: O carteiro aparentemente tem algo para lhe mostrar. Procure dentro do depósito dos correios.
column2: The postman apparently has something to show you. Search for it inside the post office's storeroom.
column3: The postman apparently has something to show you. Search for it inside the post office's storeroom.

column1: As cartas para a senhora idosa eram falsas escritas pelo carteiro. Como você deve explicar isso para a mulher?
column2: The letters to the old lady were fakes written by the postman. How should you explain this to the woman?
column3: The letters to the old lady were fakes written by the postman. How should you explain this to the woman?

column1: Você entregou a carta para a senhora e contou a verdade.
column2: You gave the letter to the lady and told her the truth.
column3: You gave the letter to the lady and told her the truth.

column1: Você entregou a carta para a senhora, mas decidiu não contar a verdade.
column2: You gave the letter to the lady, but decided not to tell her the truth.
column3: You gave the letter to the lady, but decided not to tell her the truth.

column1: Você recebeu um recado do carteiro de Beira-Mar. Aparentemente ele tem algo para lhe contar.
column2: You received word from the Seafront postman. Apparently he has something to tell you.
column3: You received word from the Seafront postman. Apparently he has something to tell you.

column1: A velha senhora faleceu. Foi melhor assim? Quem pode dizer?
column2: The old woman has passed away. Was it better this way? Who can say?
column3: The old woman has passed away. Was it better this way? Who can say?

column1: A carnificina começa! Não faço ideia de onde estou ou por quê... ainda.
column2: The carnage begins! No idea where I am or why...yet.
column3: The carnage begins! No idea where I am or why...yet.

column1: Fortalecendo ao matar essas coisas escuras e assustadoras.
column2: Building strength by killing these dark, creepy...things.
column3: Building strength by killing these dark, creepy...things.

column1: Uma voz instável clama em um mundo instável...
column2: An unstable voice cries out in an unstable world...
column3: An unstable voice cries out in an unstable world...

column1: De repente no...futuro? Ou será o passado? Hmm...
column2: Suddenly in the...future? Or is this the past? Hmm...
column3: Suddenly in the...future? Or is this the past? Hmm...

column1: Caçando carneiro agora? Isso parece estranhamente parecido com um MMO.
column2: Hunting for mutton now? This seems oddly MMO-esque.
column3: Hunting for mutton now? This seems oddly MMO-esque.

column1: Vastas planícies, céus azuis... e ovelhas brancas e fofas.
column2: Vast plains, blue skies...and white, fluffy sheep.
column3: Vast plains, blue skies...and white, fluffy sheep.

column1: Aparentemente, eu sou um mensageiro freelancer. Uau.
column2: Apparently I'm a freelance errand boy. Yippee.
column3: Apparently I'm a freelance errand boy. Yippee.

column1: Fui às compras. As pessoas deste mundo parecem muito pobres...
column2: Out shopping. The people of this world seem very poor...
column3: Out shopping. The people of this world seem very poor...

column1: Tirei uma pausa. Visitei minha irmã. Eu tenho uma irmã?
column2: Took a break. Visited my sister. I have a sister?
column3: Took a break. Visited my sister. I have a sister?

column1: Este mundo é terrivelmente sombrio, mas pelo menos parece seguro.
column2: This world is awful gloomy, but at least it seems safe.
column3: This world is awful gloomy, but at least it seems safe.

column1: Lutando contra alguns inimigos crepusculares. Vá em frente, pesquise.
column2: Taking on some crepuscular foes. Go on, look it up.
column3: Taking on some crepuscular foes. Go on, look it up.

column1: Terminei de tirar o lixo. Foi um teste...
column2: Finished taking out the trash. That was an ordeal...
column3: Finished taking out the trash. That was an ordeal...

column1: Voltando para casa depois de um dia correndo de um lado para o outro.
column2: Returning home after a day of running back and forth.
column3: Returning home after a day of running back and forth.

column1: Minha irmã se foi. Primeiro, o carneiro, agora isso...
column2: My sister's gone. First, the mutton, now this...
column3: My sister's gone. First, the mutton, now this...

column1: Nada de bom pode vir de uma irmã desaparecida.
column2: Nothing good can come from a missing sister.
column3: Nothing good can come from a missing sister.

column1: Procurando por minha irmã. Isso não vai acabar bem.
column2: Searching for my sister. This can't end well.
column3: Searching for my sister. This can't end well.

column1: Operação: Busca pela Irmã continua. Onde ela está?
column2: Operation: Sister Quest continues. Where is she?
column3: Operation: Sister Quest continues. Where is she?

column1: Ainda procurando por Yonah. Agora estou perto de uma árvore gigante.
column2: Still searching for Yonah. Now I'm near a giant tree.
column3: Still searching for Yonah. Now I'm near a giant tree.

column1: Essas criaturas estão por toda parte, mas ainda não há sinal de Yonah...
column2: Those creatures are all over, but still no sign of Yonah...
column3: Those creatures are all over, but still no sign of Yonah...

column1: Lá está ela! ... Como ela consegue dormir em um momento como este?
column2: There she is! ...How can she sleep at a time like this?
column3: There she is! ...How can she sleep at a time like this?

column1: Acabei de derrotar um par de cavaleiros de ferro. Nada é fácil...
column2: Just defeated a pair of iron knights. Nothing's easy...
column3: Just defeated a pair of iron knights. Nothing's easy...

column1: Minha irmã está amaldiçoada, seu corpo coberto com símbolos negros...
column2: My sister's cursed, her body covered with black symbols...
column3: My sister's cursed, her body covered with black symbols...

column1: O que essa garota fez para merecer esse destino?
column2: What did that girl do to deserve this fate?
column3: What did that girl do to deserve this fate?

column1: Então É esse o objetivo deste jogo. Muito inteligente.
column2: So THAT'S the objective of this game. Very clever.
column3: So THAT'S the objective of this game. Very clever.

column1: Atravessando as planícies. Isso está demorando uma eternidade.
column2: Crossing the plains. This is taking forever.
column3: Crossing the plains. This is taking forever.

column1: Explorando uma cidade estranha construída na encosta de um penhasco.
column2: Exploring a strange town built into the side of a cliff.
column3: Exploring a strange town built into the side of a cliff.

column1: Encontrei uma cabana insignificante logo fora da cidade.
column2: Stumbled upon a trashy little shack just outside town.
column3: Stumbled upon a trashy little shack just outside town.

column1: Quem é essa garota mesmo? Ela está usando apenas roupas íntimas.
column2: Who's this girl, anyway? She's wearing nothing but underwear.
column3: Who's this girl, anyway? She's wearing nothing but underwear.

column1: A Garota de Roupas Íntimas está lutando contra um lagarto. Isso é loucura...
column2: Underwear Girl's fighting a lizard. This is nuts...
column3: Underwear Girl's fighting a lizard. This is nuts...

column1: Então eu só preciso coletar todos os [SPOILER], certo? Ótimo!
column2: So I just need to gather all the [SPOILER], right? Great!
column3: So I just need to gather all the [SPOILER], right? Great!

column1: Partindo para uma excursão de campo para fortalecer minha arma.
column2: Off on a field trip to get my weapon powered-up.
column3: Off on a field trip to get my weapon powered-up.

column1: Procurando trabalho na taverna. Ei, um cara tem que comer.
column2: Looking for work in the tavern. Hey, a guy's gotta eat.
column3: Looking for work in the tavern. Hey, a guy's gotta eat.

column1: Indo para o Monturo para tentar encontrar algumas coisas para matar.
column2: Off to the Junk Heap to try and find some stuff to kill.
column3: Off to the Junk Heap to try and find some stuff to kill.

column1: Minha irmã está doente e eu estou meio que surtando.
column2: My sister's sick, and I'm kinda freaking out.
column3: My sister's sick, and I'm kinda freaking out.

column2: Shh. I'm off looking for fish. ...Don't ask.
column3: Shh. I'm off looking for fish. ...Don't ask.

column1: Encontrei uma senhora velha chorona. Pelo menos Sombras não falam...
column2: Ran across a whiny old lady. At least Shades don't talk...
column3: Ran across a whiny old lady. At least Shades don't talk...

column1: Entregando cartas, fazendo missões...o de sempre.
column2: Delivering letters, running fetch quests...the usual.
column3: Delivering letters, running fetch quests...the usual.

column1: Hora de voltar para a vila da Garota de Roupas Íntimas.
column2: Time to head back to Underwear Girl's village.
column3: Time to head back to Underwear Girl's village.

column1: Lutando contra um lagarto gigante que dispara bolas mágicas. Tão incrível.
column2: Fighting a giant, magical-ball shooting lizard. So. Awesome.
column3: Fighting a giant, magical-ball shooting lizard. So. Awesome.

column1: A batalha acabou, mas ainda tenho que salvar a Garota de Roupas Íntimas!
column2: Battle's over, but I still gotta save Underwear Girl!
column3: Battle's over, but I still gotta save Underwear Girl!

column1: Indo para o deserto. Melhor relembrar minha linguagem de sinais.
column2: Heading for the desert. Better brush up on my sign language.
column3: Heading for the desert. Better brush up on my sign language.

column1: Um cara tem enviado cartas para a minha irmã. Não estou muito animado com isso.
column2: Some guy's been sending mail to my sister. Not too thrilled.
column3: Some guy's been sending mail to my sister. Not too thrilled.

column1: A Garota de Roupas Íntimas se perdeu em uma mansão assombrada. Ótimo.
column2: Underwear Girl got lost in a haunted manor. Great.
column3: Underwear Girl got lost in a haunted manor. Great.

column1: Encontrei um garoto tocando piano de olhos vendados. Uau.
column2: Found a boy with a blindfold playing the piano. Um, yeah.
column3: Found a boy with a blindfold playing the piano. Um, yeah.

column1: Finalmente saí daquela mansão. Hora de visitar a família.
column2: Finally got out of that manor. Time for a visit home.
column3: Finally got out of that manor. Time for a visit home.

column1: O Lixão ainda está funcionando. ...Eu meio que queria que não estivesse.
column2: The Junk Heap's still humming. ...I kinda wish it wasn't.
column3: The Junk Heap's still humming. ...I kinda wish it wasn't.

column1: Lutei contra um robô de lata, uma caixa de lata e um cano de lata.
column2: Fought a tin robot, a tin box, and a tin pipe. Tin-acious!
column3: Fought a tin robot, a tin box, and a tin pipe. Tin-acious!

column1: Dois irmãos me pediram para encontrar sua mãe. Espero que ela esteja bem.
column2: Two brothers asked me to find their mom. I hope she's okay.
column3: Two brothers asked me to find their mom. I hope she's okay.

column1: Isso foi infeliz. A realidade pode ser muito dura às vezes.
column2: That was unfortunate. Reality can be pretty rough sometimes.
column3: That was unfortunate. Reality can be pretty rough sometimes.

column1: Isso foi deprimente. Nem sempre pode ter um final feliz...
column2: That was depressing. Can't always have a happy ending...
column3: That was depressing. Can't always have a happy ending...

column1: Em uma bela cidade à beira-mar, procurando por peixes.
column2: At a lovely seaside town, searching for fish.
column3: At a lovely seaside town, searching for fish.

column1: Quem diria que eu mesmo iria pescar esse tipo de coisa do mar?
column2: Who knew I'd be fishing this thing out of the sea myself?
column3: Who knew I'd be fishing this thing out of the sea myself?

column1: Hora de levar os remédios para Yonah. Eu odeio vê-la sofrer...
column2: Time to bring Yonah her meds. I hate to see her suffer...
column3: Time to bring Yonah her meds. I hate to see her suffer...

column1: Aquela velha bruxa precisa de nossa ajuda. Ela é uma verdadeira dor de cabeça...
column2: That old battle-axe needs our help. She's a real pain...
column3: That old battle-axe needs our help. She's a real pain...

column1: Recebi uma carta da velha senhora. Estou sendo punido?
column2: Got a letter for the old lady. Am I being punished?
column3: Got a letter for the old lady. Am I being punished?

column1: Terminei de ajudar a velha senhora. Espero que ela esteja feliz agora.
column2: Finished helping the old lady. Hope she's happy now.
column3: Finished helping the old lady. Hope she's happy now.

column1: Terminei de ajudar a velha senhora. Eu me pergunto como era o cara dela?
column2: Finished helping the old lady. Wonder what her guy was like?
column3: Finished helping the old lady. Wonder what her guy was like?

column1: Deserto? Checado. Lobos? Checado. Pessoas mascaradas estranhas? ...Checado.
column2: Desert? Check. Wolves? Check. Weird masked people? ...Check.
column3: Desert? Check. Wolves? Check. Weird masked people? ...Check.

column1: Em uma cidade estranha cheia de areia. As pessoas aqui são loucas.
column2: In a weird town full of sand. The people here are crazy.
column3: In a weird town full of sand. The people here are crazy.

column1: Regras, regras, regras, regras! Que dor no [SPOILER]!
column2: Rules, rules, rules, rules! What a pain in the [SPOILER]!
column3: Rules, rules, rules, rules! What a pain in the [SPOILER]!

column1: Eu nunca poderia, JAMAIS, viver aqui. Sério, eu morreria.
column2: I could never, EVER live here. Seriously, I'd die.
column3: I could never, EVER live here. Seriously, I'd die.

column1: Envolvido em um plano para salvar o príncipe da cidade louca.
column2: Caught up in a plot to save the prince of crazytown.
column3: Caught up in a plot to save the prince of crazytown.

column1: Príncipe louco salvo. Cidade louca satisfeita. Estou fora daqui.
column2: Crazy prince saved. Crazytown pleased. I'm outta here.
column3: Crazy prince saved. Crazytown pleased. I'm outta here.

column1: Algum tipo de...sonho? O que diabos está acontecendo?
column2: Some kind of...dream? What the heck is going on?
column3: Some kind of...dream? What the heck is going on?

column1: Aldeões em um pesadelo... Eles estão me atormentando...
column2: Villagers in a nightmare... They're tormenting me...
column3: Villagers in a nightmare... They're tormenting me...

column1: Aquela vila era um pesadelo. Tipo como esse jogo!
column2: That village was a nightmare. Kinda like this game!
column3: That village was a nightmare. Kinda like this game!

column1: Indo para casa pela primeira vez em um tempo!
column2: Heading home for the first time in a while!
column3: Heading home for the first time in a while!

column1: Está piorando. O que ela fez para merecer essa dor?
column2: It's getting worse. What did she do to deserve this pain?
column3: It's getting worse. What did she do to deserve this pain?

column1: Preciso de remédio para Yonah. Caso contrário...
column2: I need medicine for Yonah. Otherwise...
column3: I need medicine for Yonah. Otherwise...

column1: Parece que esta é a calma antes da tempestade...
column2: Seems like this is the calm before the storm...
column3: Seems like this is the calm before the storm...

column1: Criaturas gigantes estão atacando a vila. Isso é ruim!
column2: Giant creatures are attacking the village. This is bad!
column3: Giant creatures are attacking the village. This is bad!

column1: Os gritos dos mortos e moribundos ecoam por toda parte.
column2: The screams of the dead and dying echo throughout.
column3: The screams of the dead and dying echo throughout.

column1: Inimigos na biblioteca. Preciso proteger minha irmã!
column2: Enemies in the library. Must protect my sister!
column3: Enemies in the library. Must protect my sister!

column1: Hora de visitar a criança vendada em sua mansão assustadora.
column2: Time to visit the blindfolded kid at his creepy manor.
column3: Time to visit the blindfolded kid at his creepy manor.

column1: Procurando por uma sala secreta. Tudo é secreto aqui...
column2: Searching for a secret room. Everything's a secret here...
column3: Searching for a secret room. Everything's a secret here...

column1: Eu não acho que nada possa me surpreender neste ponto.
column2: I don't think anything could surprise me at this point.
column3: I don't think anything could surprise me at this point.

column1: Aquilo...aquilo foi um preço muito alto a pagar, não foi...
column2: That...that was a heck of a price to pay, wasn't it...
column3: That...that was a heck of a price to pay, wasn't it...

column1: Acabando com um inimigo. Fique no chão e não se mexa!
column2: Beating an enemy senseless. Get down and stay down!
column3: Beating an enemy senseless. Get down and stay down!

column1: Voltando para onde tudo começou. Eu cheguei no círculo completo.
column2: Heading back to where it all began. I've come full circle.
column3: Heading back to where it all began. I've come full circle.

column1: Partindo para destruir mais robôs no Lixão.
column2: Off to brain some more robots at the ol' Junk Heap.
column3: Off to brain some more robots at the ol' Junk Heap.

column1: De volta à floresta dos pesadelos. Talvez um dia eu entenderei.
column2: Back to the nightmare forest. Maybe someday I'll understand.
column3: Back to the nightmare forest. Maybe someday I'll understand.

column1: Alguma carta chegará a uma casa em que ninguém espera?
column2: Would any letters come to a house in which no one waits?
column3: Would any letters come to a house in which no one waits?

column1: Preciso de algumas informações. Hora de buscar mais pistas.
column2: I need some leads. Time to go seek out more info.
column3: I need some leads. Time to go seek out more info.

column1: Partindo para ver os irmãos Lixão. Faz tempo.
column2: Off to see the Junk Heap brothers. It's been a while.
column3: Off to see the Junk Heap brothers. It's been a while.

column1: Vagueando por cavernas de ferro em um paraíso mecanizado.
column2: Wandering through iron caverns in a mechanized paradise.
column3: Wandering through iron caverns in a mechanized paradise.

column1: Eu me pergunto o que os robôs sobreviventes estão pensando?
column2: I wonder what the surviving robots are thinking?
column3: I wonder what the surviving robots are thinking?

column1: Indo pegar a nova arma. Deve tornar a vida um pouco mais fácil.
column2: Off to pick up the new weapon. Should make life a bit easier.
column3: Off to pick up the new weapon. Should make life a bit easier.

column1: Experimentando a nova arma. Espero que as máquinas não sintam dor!
column2: Trying out the new weapon. Hope machines don't feel pain!
column3: Trying out the new weapon. Hope machines don't feel pain!

column1: Lutando contra uma máquina insana. Todo esse mundo é insano...
column2: Fighting an insane machine. This whole world's insane...
column3: Fighting an insane machine. This whole world's insane...

column1: Voltando ao ponto de origem mais uma vez.
column2: Back to the point of origin yet again.
column3: Back to the point of origin yet again.

column1: Lutando contra um inimigo que se recusa a desistir.
column2: Fighting a foe that refuses to give up the ghost.
column3: Fighting a foe that refuses to give up the ghost.

column1: A Garota da Roupa Íntima ficou louca. Isso é ruim.
column2: Underwear Girl's gone berserk. This is bad.
column3: Underwear Girl's gone berserk. This is bad.

column1: Todas as respostas que procuro estão além deste altar...
column2: All the answers I seek lie beyond this altar...
column3: All the answers I seek lie beyond this altar...

column1: Retornando a uma casa solitária. Uma carta espera.
column2: Returning to a lonely home. A letter awaits.
column3: Returning to a lonely home. A letter awaits.

column1: Recebi um convite do rei de Facade.
column2: Received an invitation from the king of Facade.
column3: Received an invitation from the king of Facade.

column1: Tendo uma conversa agradável e pacífica. Já era hora.
column2: Having a nice, peaceful chat. It's about time.
column3: Having a nice, peaceful chat. It's about time.

column1: Gritos ecoando. Fluxos de sangue. Um futuro perdido...
column2: Echoing screams. Streams of blood. A future lost...
column3: Echoing screams. Streams of blood. A future lost...

column1: Cumprindo uma promessa de destruir os lobos.
column2: Keeping a promise to destroy the wolves.
column3: Keeping a promise to destroy the wolves.

column2: Man vs. wolf. Who will emerge victorious?
column3: Man vs. wolf. Who will emerge victorious?

column1: Para tudo o que eu ganho, eu perco algo mais precioso.
column2: For everything I gain, I lose something more precious.
column3: For everything I gain, I lose something more precious.

column1: De volta à estranha vila no penhasco. Algo está acontecendo.
column2: Back to the strange cliffside village. Something's up.
column3: Back to the strange cliffside village. Something's up.

column1: Todos são amigáveis. Muito amigáveis. Eu não confio neles.
column2: Everyone's friendly. Too friendly. I don't trust them.
column3: Everyone's friendly. Too friendly. I don't trust them.

column1: Eu SABIA que isso ia acontecer. Como é irritante.
column2: I KNEW this was coming. How infuriating.
column3: I KNEW this was coming. How infuriating.

column1: Uma batalha contra o caos. Quem está certo?
column2: A battle against chaos. Who's in the right?
column3: A battle against chaos. Who's in the right?

column1: Tudo está em seu lugar. É hora de encerrar este conto.
column2: Everything's in place. It's time to end this tale.
column3: Everything's in place. It's time to end this tale.

column1: Minha irmã espera no último bastião do inimigo.
column2: My sister awaits in the last bastion of the enemy.
column3: My sister awaits in the last bastion of the enemy.

column1: No castelo do Shadowlord. Que visão incrível.
column2: Into the Shadowlord's castle. What an incredible sight.
column3: Into the Shadowlord's castle. What an incredible sight.

column1: Lutando contra o chefe final. A jornada está quase acabando!
column2: Taking on the final boss. The journey's almost over!
column3: Taking on the final boss. The journey's almost over!

column1: Metade de um cookie nunca foi tão bom.
column2: Half a cookie never tasted better.
column3: Half a cookie never tasted better.

column1: Ah deuses, que escolha. Todos os caminhos levam à desolação...
column2: Ah gods, what a choice. All paths lead to heartbreak...
column3: Ah gods, what a choice. All paths lead to heartbreak...

column1: Um mundo mergulhado em desespero. Minha história começa...
column2: A world draped in despair. My tale begins...
column3: A world draped in despair. My tale begins...

column1: Caminhando pelas terras desoladas. Hoje e sempre.
column2: Wandering through the desolate lands. Today and always.
column3: Wandering through the desolate lands. Today and always.

column1: Indo procurar um cara com uma mochila. (Então ele SEMPRE a tem consigo, ou o quê?)
column2: Off to find a dude with a bag. (So does he ALWAYS have it on him, or what?)
column3: Off to find a dude with a bag. (So does he ALWAYS have it on him, or what?)

column1: A esposa do Cara da Mochila está desaparecida! Se a encontrarmos, saberemos porque ela tem...exatamente a mesma mochila.
column2: Bag Dude's wife is missing! If we find her, we'll know because she has...the exact same bag.
column3: Bag Dude's wife is missing! If we find her, we'll know because she has...the exact same bag.

column1: A esposa do Cara da Mochila saiu da cidade sozinha. Esse tipo de reviravolta nunca termina bem.
column2: Bag Dude's wife left town on her own. This kind of twist never ends well.
column3: Bag Dude's wife left town on her own. This kind of twist never ends well.

column1: Esse cara está em casa esperando sua esposa voltar. Como eu deveria dar a notícia?
column2: This guy's home waiting for his wife to come back. How am I supposed to break the news?
column3: This guy's home waiting for his wife to come back. How am I supposed to break the news?

column1: Nenhuma pessoa sã quer se envolver em brigas de casal. ...Nenhum livro sã, também.
column2: No sane person wants to get caught up in a couple's squabbles. ...No sane book, either.
column3: No sane person wants to get caught up in a couple's squabbles. ...No sane book, either.

column1: Faça o seu melhor nesse canal, amigo. Isso tornaria as coisas muito mais fáceis para mim.
column2: Do your best on that canal, bud. It'd make things a hell of a lot easier for me.
column3: Do your best on that canal, bud. It'd make things a hell of a lot easier for me.

column1: O barqueiro tem faltado ao trabalho. Estou prestes a ir bater na porta do cara.
column2: The boatman's been ditching work. I'm about to go knock down the dude's door.
column3: The boatman's been ditching work. I'm about to go knock down the dude's door.

column1: Procurando pelo Cara da Mochila, que aparentemente teve uma briga com a esposa e saiu da cidade. Que dor de cabeça.
column2: Looking for Bag Dude, who apparently had a fight with his wife and split town. What a pain.
column3: Looking for Bag Dude, who apparently had a fight with his wife and split town. What a pain.

column1: Parece que eu não fiz nada além de procurar pessoas ultimamente e, para ser sincero: não estou muito animado.
column2: Feels like I've done nothing but look for people lately, and I'll be honest: I ain't thrilled.
column3: Feels like I've done nothing but look for people lately, and I'll be honest: I ain't thrilled.

column1: Já faz um tempo desde que algo foi empurrado para mim assim. A recompensa melhor ser incrível...
column2: Been a while since I've had something shunted on me like that. The reward better be nuts...
column3: Been a while since I've had something shunted on me like that. The reward better be nuts...

column1: Um navio naufragado encalhou na costa. Será que ele estava carregando algo originalmente?
column2: A wrecked ship drifted ashore. Wonder what it was carrying originally?
column3: A wrecked ship drifted ashore. Wonder what it was carrying originally?

column1: Encontrei uma garota estranha no navio. Além disso, está escuro pra caramba e só tenho essa lanterna.
column2: Ran into a weird girl on the ship. Also, it's dark as hell and all I've got is this lantern.
column3: Ran into a weird girl on the ship. Also, it's dark as hell and all I've got is this lantern.

column1: Um navio em ruínas, incontáveis tentáculos... e um inimigo desconhecido.
column2: A crumbling ship, countless tentacles...and an unknown enemy.
column3: A crumbling ship, countless tentacles...and an unknown enemy.

column1: A canção da Sombra ecoa. Este é o inimigo mais forte e a pior situação até agora.
column2: The Shade's song echoes out. This is the strongest foe and the worst situation to date.
column3: The Shade's song echoes out. This is the strongest foe and the worst situation to date.

column1: As pessoas que sempre estiveram por perto simplesmente... desapareceram, mas o mundo continua girando.
column2: People who were always around are just...gone, but the world keeps on turning.
column3: People who were always around are just...gone, but the world keeps on turning.

column1: De volta a uma floresta de pesadelos que visitamos há muito tempo, mas isso não é um sonho. Isso é realidade.
column2: Back to a forest of nightmares we visited long ago, but this is no dream. This is reality.
column3: Back to a forest of nightmares we visited long ago, but this is no dream. This is reality.

column1: A floresta está infestada de máquinas e os aldeões sumiram.
column2: The forest is crawling with machines, and the villagers are gone.
column3: The forest is crawling with machines, and the villagers are gone.

column1: Uma entrada para a escuridão pura apareceu na grande árvore.
column2: An entrance to pure darkness appeared in the great tree.
column3: An entrance to pure darkness appeared in the great tree.

column1: Memórias perdidas e o significado de recuperá-las.
column2: Lost memories, and the meaning in reclaiming them.
column3: Lost memories, and the meaning in reclaiming them.

column1: Essas vozes misteriosas estão me irritando. Eu vou sair e quebrar algumas coisas.
column2: These mysterious voices are getting on my nerves. I'm just gonna go smash some crap.
column3: These mysterious voices are getting on my nerves. I'm just gonna go smash some crap.

column1: As memórias estão sendo chamadas de volta. Eu esqueci algo muito importante...
column2: Memories are being called back. I've forgotten something very important...
column3: Memories are being called back. I've forgotten something very important...

column1: Ok, agora eu estou lutando contra mim mesmo. Esta é a pior batalha real de todos os tempos.
column2: Okay, now I'm fighting myself. This is the worst battle royale ever.
column3: Okay, now I'm fighting myself. This is the worst battle royale ever.

column1: Um velho amigo aparece, e minhas memórias estão começando a se clarear.
column2: An old friend appears, and my memories are starting to clear up.
column3: An old friend appears, and my memories are starting to clear up.

column1: Está voltando para mim. Eu...tinha um amigo.
column2: It's coming back to me. I...had a friend.
column3: It's coming back to me. I...had a friend.

column1: Eu tinha um amigo! Alguém importante para mim!
column2: I had a friend! Someone important to me!
column3: I had a friend! Someone important to me!

column1: Qual é a grande ideia, indo embora e desaparecendo assim!?
column2: The hell's the big idea, going off and disappearing like that!?
column3: The hell's the big idea, going off and disappearing like that!?

column1: Volte aqui logo, seu pequeno saco de merda sneaky!
column2: Get back here already, you sneaky little crapbag!
column3: Get back here already, you sneaky little crapbag!

column1: Nós vamos viver - mesmo que seja um erro.
column2: We will live—even if it's a mistake.
column3: We will live—even if it's a mistake.

column1: Quebrar. Quebrar. Quebrar. Quebrar.<LF><LF O suor escorre pelo rosto dos homens lutadores enquanto eles quebram o minério de ferro, seu alegre canto ecoando pela mina.<LF><LF>Somos trabalhadores. Trabalhadores na mina. Sujo da cabeça aos pés, hoje novamente buscamos ferro com todo nosso esforço.<LF><LF> Quebrar. Quebrar. Quebrar. Quebrar.
column2: Smash. Smash. Smash. Smash.<LF><LF>Sweat rolls down the faces of hardscrabble men as they chip away<LF>at ironstone, their cheerful singing echoing through the mine.<LF><LF>We are workers. Workers in the mine. Dirty from tip to toe,<LF>again today we search for iron with all our might.<LF><LF>Smash. Smash. Smash. Smash.
column3: Smash. Smash. Smash. Smash.<LF><LF>Sweat rolls down the faces of hardscrabble men as they chip away<LF>at ironstone, their cheerful singing echoing through the mine.<LF><LF>We are workers. Workers in the mine. Dirty from tip to toe,<LF>again today we search for iron with all our might.<LF><LF>Smash. Smash. Smash. Smash.

column1: Foom. Foom. Foom. Foom.<LF><LF> O som das mulheres pisando nos foles na fábrica.<LF>O som do ferro sendo recolhido das areias calcinadas.<LF><LF> Somos trabalhadores. Trabalhadores na fábrica. Trabalhadores que enviam vento.<LF>Hoje, pisamos nos foles novamente com todo nosso esforço.<LF><LF> Foom. Foom. Foom. Foom.
column2: Foom. Foom. Foom. Foom.<LF><LF>The sound of women stomping on bellows in the mill.<LF>The sound of iron being gathered from the scorched sands.<LF><LF>We are workers. Workers in the mill. Workers who send wind.<LF>Today, we stomp the bellows again with all our might.<LF><LF>Foom. Foom. Foom. Foom.
column3: Foom. Foom. Foom. Foom.<LF><LF>The sound of women stomping on bellows in the mill.<LF>The sound of iron being gathered from the scorched sands.<LF><LF>We are workers. Workers in the mill. column1: Clang. Clang. Clang. Clang.<LF><LF>O som dos ferreiros de espadas usando martelos em suas forjas.<LF>O ressoar desses golpes transformadores é impressionante de fato.<LF><LF>Nós somos ferreiros de espadas. Ferreiros de espadas que dão vida às lâminas.<LF>Senhores do aço.<LF><LF>Clang. Clang. Clang. Clang.
column2: Clang. Clang. Clang. Clang.<LF><LF>The sound of swordsmiths wielding hammers at their forges.<LF>The ringing of such transformative blows is stunning indeed.<LF><LF>We are swordsmiths. Swordsmiths who bring blades to life.<LF>Lords of steel.<LF><LF>Clang. Clang. Clang. Clang.
column3: Clang. Clang. Clang. Clang.<LF><LF>The sound of swordsmiths wielding hammers at their forges.<LF>The ringing of such transformative blows is stunning indeed.<LF><LF>We are swordsmiths. Swordsmiths who bring blades to life.<LF>Lords of steel.<LF><LF>Clang. Clang. Clang. Clang.

column1: Rip. Rip. Rip. Rip.<LF><LF>O som da carne sendo rasgada no campo de batalha.<LF>O som de matar inimigos. Matar alguém. Matar humanos.<LF>Alguém me ajude. Dói - dói muito. Me ajuda, mamãe...<LF><LF>Rip. Rip. Rip. Rip.
column2: Rip. Rip. Rip. Rip.<LF><LF>The sound of flesh being rent on the battlefield.<LF>The sound of killing enemies. Killing someone. Killing humans.<LF>Someone help me. It hurts—it hurts so much. Help me, Mommy...<LF><LF>Rip. Rip. Rip. Rip.
column3: Rip. Rip. Rip. Rip.<LF><LF>The sound of flesh being rent on the battlefield.<LF>The sound of killing enemies. Killing someone. Killing humans.<LF>Someone help me. It hurts—it hurts so much. Help me, Mommy...<LF><LF>Rip. Rip. Rip. Rip.

column1: Houve uma vez uma mulher que prometeu sua mão a um homem que estava partindo para a frente. Devota por natureza, ela passava manhãs, tardes e noites em oração pela segurança de seu amado. Talvez em resposta às suas súplicas sinceras, uma noite um pássaro envolto em luz apareceu para ela em um sonho e começou a falar:
column2: There once was a woman who promised her hand to a man who was departing for the front. Devout by nature, she spent mornings, afternoons, and evenings in prayer for the safety of her beloved. Perhaps in response to her earnest pleas, one night a bird enveloped in light appeared to her in a dream and began to speak:
column3: There once was a woman who promised her hand to a man who was departing for the front. Devout by nature, she spent mornings, afternoons, and evenings in prayer for the safety of her beloved. Perhaps in response to her earnest pleas, one night a bird enveloped in light appeared to her in a dream and began to speak:

column1: "O homem que você ama certamente voltará em segurança", disse o pássaro com uma voz bela. Estas palavras trouxeram grande conforto à mulher, e ela começou a chorar lágrimas de alegria.<LF><LF>"No entanto", continuou o pássaro, "seu coração certamente não."
column2: "The man you love will surely return safely," said the bird in a beautiful voice. These words brought great comfort to the woman, and she began weeping tears of joy.<LF><LF>"However," continued the bird, "his heart will surely not."
column3: "The man you love will surely return safely," said the bird in a beautiful voice. These words brought great comfort to the woman, and she began weeping tears of joy.<LF><LF>"However," continued the bird, "his heart will surely not."

column1: Em breve, o homem voltou como a ave havia previsto, seu corpo coberto de cicatrizes além de contar. Mas como a ave também havia previsto, ele voltou com uma mulher desconhecida de beleza extraordinária ao seu lado. Apesar disso, a mulher piedosa não conseguiu conter seu amor pelo homem e correu para encontrá-lo quando ele se aproximou.
column2: Soon, the man returned as the bird had foretold, his body covered in scars beyond counting. But as the bird had also foretold, he returned with an unfamiliar woman of extraordinary beauty at his side. Despite this, the pious woman could not contain her love for the man, and ran out to meet him as he approached.
column3: Soon, the man returned as the bird had foretold, his body covered in scars beyond counting. But as the bird had also foretold, he returned with an unfamiliar woman of extraordinary beauty at his side. Despite this, the pious woman could not contain her love for the man, and ran out to meet him as he approached.

column1: Surpreso, o homem a abraçou e então desabou no chão. A mulher piedosa ficou sobre ele, uma adaga ensanguentada em uma mão e o fruto vermelho e maduro de seu coração na outra. "Seu coração não vagará mais", ela sussurrou. No meio da poça de sangue que se formava, seu rosto lavado por pura êxtase, ela deu um beijo terno no coração amado e ofereceu uma oração de gratidão.
column2: Surprised, the man embraced her, then collapsed to the ground.<LF>The pious woman stood over him, a bloody dagger in one hand<LF>and the ripe crimson fruit of his heart in the other.<LF><LF>"His heart will stray no longer," she whispered. Amidst the gathering pool of blood, her face awash with pure ecstasy, she placed a tender kiss on her beloved's heart and offered a prayer of gratitude.
column3: Surprised, the man embraced her, then collapsed to the ground.<LF>The pious woman stood over him, a bloody dagger in one hand<LF>and the ripe crimson fruit of his heart in the other.<LF><LF>"His heart will stray no longer," she whispered. Amidst the gathering pool of blood, her face awash with pure ecstasy, she placed a tender kiss on her beloved's heart and offered a prayer of gratitude.

column1: Há muito, muito tempo, em um reino distante, viviam três irmãos. O irmão do meio era um famoso general que comandava um vasto exército. As pessoas em todos os lugares temiam suas tropas, pois elas eram realmente violentas.
column2: Long, long ago, in a faraway kingdom, there lived three brothers.<LF><LF>The middle brother was a famous general who commanded a vast army. People everywhere were terrified of his troops, for they were most violent indeed.
column3: Long, long ago, in a faraway kingdom, there lived three brothers.<LF><LF>The middle brother was a famous general who commanded a vast army. People everywhere were terrified of his troops, for they were most violent indeed.

column1: Este general adorava fazer guerra. Ele não tinha nada mais divertido do que assistir cidades queimando e corpos se acumulando - e ele lutou não para subjugar, mas simplesmente para destruir tudo o que podia. Seus soldados bem treinados devastaram cidades, vilarejos e até mesmo nações pelo bem de seu general. E enquanto eles cortavam e retalhavam, o general ria consigo mesmo em tons mais vulgares.
column2: This general loved to make war.<LF><LF>He enjoyed nothing more than watching cities burn and corpses pile up—and he fought not to subjugate, but simply to destroy all that he could. His well-trained soldiers laid waste to towns, cities, and even nations for the sake of their general. And as they hewed and hacked and chopped, the general would chuckle to himself in the most vulgar of tones.
column3: This general loved to make war.<LF><LF>He enjoyed nothing more than watching cities burn and corpses pile up—and he fought not to subjugate, but simply to destroy all that he could. His well-trained soldiers laid waste to towns, cities, and even nations for the sake of their general. And as they hewed and hacked and chopped, the general would chuckle to himself in the most vulgar of tones.

column1: O exército marchou sem parar.<LF><LF>Nações à beira-mar. Nações nas montanhas. Nações nos desertos.<LF>Nações na tundra. Nações a leste. Nações a oeste.<LF>O general não se importava - ele simplesmente queria ver tudo queimar.<LF><LF>As ordens dele eram absolutas, e por anos incontáveis ​​os soldados mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram e mataram.
column2: The army marched on and on.<LF><LF>Nations by the sea. Nations in the mountain. Nations in the deserts.<LF>Nations in the tundra. Nations to the east. Nations to the west.<LF>The general cared not—he simply wished to watch it all burn.<LF><LF>His orders were absolute, and for years beyond counting the soldiers killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed.
column3: The army marched on and on.<LF><LF>Nations by the sea. Nations in the mountain. Nations in the deserts.<LF>Nations in the tundra. Nations to the east. Nations to the west.<LF>The general cared not—he simply wished to watch it all burn.<LF><LF>His orders were absolute, and for years beyond counting the soldiers killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed and killed.

column1: Depois de algum tempo, o exército chegou em uma certa nação.<LF><LF> Eles mataram seus soldados. Eles mataram seus habitantes. Eles mataram suas princesas, príncipes, duques, padeiros, advogados, contadores, mendigos e ladrões.<LF><LF> Eventualmente, um general maltrapilho apareceu implorando por sua vida com lágrimas nos olhos, mas eles o mataram também. No entanto, os soldados acharam que ele parecia familiar e tentaram lembrar como poderiam tê-lo conhecido. Nesse momento, no entanto, a filha do general apareceu, e eles ficaram tão envolvidos em acabar com a vida dela que nunca mais pensaram no assunto novamente.
column2: After some time, the army arrived in a certain nation.<LF><LF>They killed its soldiers. They killed its townspeople. They killed its princesses and princes and dukes and bakers and lawyers and accountants and beggars and thieves.<LF><LF>Eventually, a shabby general came pleading for his life with tears in his eyes, but they killed him as well. However, the soldiers thought he seemed familiar and tried to recall how they might have known him. In that moment, however, the general's daughter appeared, and they became so engrossed in ending her life, they never thought about the matter again.
column3: After some time, the army arrived in a certain nation.<LF><LF>They killed its soldiers. They killed its townspeople. They killed its princesses and princes and dukes and bakers and lawyers and accountants and beggars and thieves.<LF><LF>Eventually, a shabby general came pleading for his life with tears in his eyes, but they killed him as well. However, the soldiers thought he seemed familiar and tried to recall how they might have known him. In that moment, however, the general's daughter appeared, and they became so engrossed in ending her life, they never thought about the matter again.

column1: Então esta garota tinha um enorme conjunto de chifres nela. Belos chifres como um touro, crescendo apenas acima de suas orelhas. Eu dei uma olhada em onde os chifres encontravam a cabeça, e deixe-me dizer, eles estavam saindo diretamente do seu CRÂNIO!<LF>Ela era a única criança assim em toda a vila - os outros eram todos normais. A criança com os chifres, no entanto? Nascida muito pequena, aparentemente... Bem, os chifres eram, eu quero dizer. Não a criança. E, inferno, eles teriam que ser! Pouca chance da mãe dessa criança ter sido capaz de expulsar um par de chifres tão grandes quanto aqueles! Haw haw haw!
column2: So this girl had a huge set'a horns on her. Beautiful horns like a bull, just growin' outta her head above her ears. I had myself a gander at where the horns met the head, and let me tell ya, they were comin' straight outta her SKULL!<LF><LF>She was the only kid like that in the whole village—the others were all normal. The kid with the horns, though? Born real small, apparently. ...Er, the horns were, I mean. Not the kid. And hell, they woulda needed to be! Fat chance the kid's momma would have been able to push out a pair of horns huge as that! Haw haw haw!
column3: So this girl had a huge set'a horns on her. Beautiful horns like a bull, just growin' outta her head above her ears. I had myself a gander at where the horns met the head, and let me tell ya, they were comin' straight outta her SKULL!<LF><LF>She was the only kid like that in the whole village—the others were all normal. The kid with the horns, though? Born real small, apparently. ...Er, the horns were, I mean. Not the kid. And hell, they woulda needed to be! Fat chance the kid's momma would have been able to push out a pair of horns huge as that! Haw haw haw!

column1: Você pensaria que uma garota assim seria vítima de bullying, certo? Bem, você estaria errado - aquela criança era a pessoa mais forte a quilômetros em qualquer direção! Não havia um homem na vila que se atrevesse a enfrentá-la - e estamos falando de homens que não têm medo de nada. Ela era a melhor em fazer o trabalho que exigia força física e tudo mais, e sempre liderava o ataque quando as Sombras atacavam. E as pessoas a amavam por isso, com certeza - mas acima de tudo, eles a amavam porque ela era sempre alegre e simplesmente resistente.
column2: You'd think a girl like that woulda been bullied, right? Well, you'd be wrong—that kid was the hardest person for miles in any direction! Wasn't a man in the village who'd tangle with her—<LF>and we're talkin' men what ain't scared of nothin'.<LF><LF>She was the best at doin' work what needed physical strength and all that, and she always led the charge whenever Shades attacked. And folks loved her for that, sure—but most of all, they loved her because she was always cheerful and just plain tough.
column3: You'd think a girl like that woulda been bullied, right? Well, you'd be wrong—that kid was the hardest person for miles in any direction! Wasn't a man in the village who'd tangle with her—<LF>and we're talkin' men what ain't scared of nothin'.<LF><LF>She was the best at doin' work what needed physical strength and all that, and she always led the charge whenever Shades attacked. And folks loved her for that, sure—but most of all, they loved her because she was always cheerful and just plain tough.

column1: Mas um dia, essa enorme Sombra atacou a vila e foi simplesmente...muito forte. Ela rasgou os homens em pedaços como se fossem trapos velhos, e metade dos caras da vila morreram. A garota com os chifres lutou com todas as suas forças, mas eventualmente não conseguiu aguentar, e a Sombra a levantou do chão e arrancou os chifres direto de sua cabeça.<LF><LF>O jeito que ela gritou era como nada que você já tenha ouvido - o som abalava a própria terra. Depois disso, as coisas ficaram realmente quietas, então eu saí e encontrei tanto a Sombra quanto a garota mortas. Cada um deles tinha ferimentos por todo o corpo e estavam vazando sangue por quase todos os lugares. E não me julgue por dizer isso agora, mas foi quase...bonito. Como olhar para flores vermelhas escuras em plena florada, sabe?
column2: But one day, this huge Shade attacked the village that was just...too strong. It tore the men apart like old rags, and half the guys in the village died. The girl with the horns fought with all she had, but eventually she couldn't keep up, and the Shade lifted her off the ground and ripped the horns right outta her head.<LF><LF>The way she screamed was like nothin' you've ever heard—sound shook the earth itself, it did. After that, things got real quiet, so I stepped outside and found both the Shade and the girl dead. Each of 'em had wounds all over, and they were leakin' blood outta just about everywhere. And don't judge me for sayin' this now, but it was almost...beautiful. Like lookin' at dark red flowers in full bloom, ya know?
column3: But one day, this huge Shade attacked the village that was just...too strong. It tore the men apart like old rags, and half the guys in the village died. The girl with the horns fought with all she had, but eventually she couldn't keep up, and the Shade lifted her off the ground and ripped the horns right outta her head.<LF><LF>The way she screamed was like nothin' you've ever heard—sound shook the earth itself, it did. After that, things got real quiet, so I stepped outside and found both the Shade and the girl dead. Each of 'em had wounds all over, and they were leakin' blood outta just about everywhere. And don't judge me for sayin' this now, but it was almost...beautiful. Like lookin' at dark red flowers in full bloom, ya know?

column1: Espero que isso responda à sua primeira pergunta sobre por que as pessoas desta vila não podem ouvir nada. Mas você deve saber que nenhum de nós pensa mal da garota por nos fazer assim - ser surdo é muito melhor do que estar morto! Hahaha!<LF><LF>De qualquer forma, todos conversamos sobre aquele dia até a morte, e achamos que o último grito foi a maneira dela de se despedir. Todos na vila se sentem honrados por ter ouvido a última coisa que ela disse, e essa é uma verdade honesta de Deus.
column2: Hope that answers your first question about why folks in this village can't hear nothin'. But you should know, none of us think badly of the girl for makin' us this way—bein' deaf is a hell of a sight better than bein' dead! Haw haw haw!<LF><LF>Anyway, we've all talked over that day to death, and we think that final scream was her way of sayin' goodbye. Everyone in the village is honored that the last thing we ever heard was her farewell, and that's the god's honest truth.
column3: Hope that answers your first question about why folks in this village can't hear nothin'. But you should know, none of us think badly of the girl for makin' us this way—bein' deaf is a hell of a sight better than bein' dead! Haw haw haw!<LF><LF>Anyway, we've all talked over that day to death, and we think that final scream was her way of sayin' goodbye. Everyone in the village is honored that the last thing we ever heard was her farewell, and that's the god's honest truth.

column1: Eu fui salvo do desespero que me acorrentava.<LF>Eu fui libertado do destino que me amaldiçoou.<LF>Eu fui pacificado da indignação que me assolava.<LF>Eu fui mudado pelo dia em que te conheci.
column2: I was saved from the despair that shackled me.<LF>I was freed from the fate that cursed me.<LF>I was pacified from the indignation that plagued me.<LF>I was changed by the day I met you.
column3: I was saved from the despair that shackled me.<LF>I was freed from the fate that cursed me.<LF>I was pacified from the indignation that plagued me.<LF>I was changed by the day I met you.

column1: Minhas chamas queimarão a terra abaixo.<LF>Meus dentes conhecerão o gosto de sangue.<LF>Minhas garras rasgarão meus inimigos em pedaços. <LF>Minhas asas voarão pelos céus acima.
column2: My flames will scorch the earth below.<LF>My fangs will know the taste of blood.<LF>My claws will rend my enemies asunder.<LF>My wings will soar the skies above.
column3: My flames will scorch the earth below.<LF>My fangs will know the taste of blood.<LF>My claws will rend my enemies asunder.<LF>My wings will soar the skies above.

column1: Se seus olhos forem roubados da luz ...<LF>Se sua pele for manchada de sangue ...<LF>Se sua espada for um fardo pesado ...<LF>Se seus lábios não puderem mais produzir discurso ...
column2: If your eyes are to be robbed of their light...<LF>If your skin is to be stained with blood...<LF>If your sword is too heavy a burden...<LF>If your lips can no longer produce speech...
column3: If your eyes are to be robbed of their light...<LF>If your skin is to be stained with blood...<LF>If your sword is too heavy a burden...<LF>If your lips can no longer produce speech...

column1: Mesmo que este corpo seja extinto.<LF>Mesmo que essas palavras sejam roubadas.<LF>Até que nosso contrato esteja completo.<LF>Até o momento em que esse calor seja perdido.
column2: Even if this body is snuffed out.<LF>Even if these words are stolen.<LF>Until our contract is complete.<LF>Until the moment this warmth is lost.
column3: Even if this body is snuffed out.<LF>Even if these words are stolen.<LF>Until our contract is complete.<LF>Until the moment this warmth is lost.

column1: Houve uma vez uma espada real passada em um reino prodigioso que havia prosperado por gerações. Dizia-se que o cristal incrustado nela continha uma grande magia e, caso absorvesse o sangue de dez mil pessoas, brilharia vermelho vivo e concederia ao seu usuário a imortalidade. No entanto, o último governante deste reino - conhecido pelo mundo como o Alto Rei - valorizava a prosperidade contínua do reino que havia herdado de seus antepassados ​​em detrimento de qualquer perspectiva de vida eterna.
column2: There once was a royal sword passed down in a prodigious kingdom that had prospered for generations. It was said the crystal embedded upon it contained a great magic, and should it ever absorb the blood of ten thousand people, it would glow bright red and grant its wielder immortality. However, this kingdom's final ruler—known to the world as the High King—valued the continued prosperity of the kingdom he had inherited from his ancestors over any prospect of eternal life.
column3: There once was a royal sword passed down in a prodigious kingdom that had prospered for generations.
