It was said the crystal embedded upon it contained a great magic, and should it ever absorb the blood of ten thousand people, it would glow bright red and grant its wielder immortality. However, this kingdom's final ruler—known to the world as the High King—valued the continued prosperity of the kingdom he had inherited from his ancestors over any prospect of eternal life.

column1: Um dia, a rainha - o amor mais querido do rei - perdeu a vida em um acidente trágico. Ela estava grávida, e a tragédia ocorreu pouco antes do bebê nascer. Dilacerado pela dor ao ouvir a notícia, o rei idoso se viu incapaz de aceitar a perspectiva de sua linhagem real morrendo com ele.
column2: One day, the queen—the king's dearest love—lost her life in a tragic accident. She was with child, and the tragedy occurred shortly before the babe was to be born. Distraught with grief upon hearing the news, the aged king found himself unable to accept the prospect of his royal bloodline dying with him.
column3: One day, the queen—the king's dearest love—lost her life in a tragic accident. She was with child, and the tragedy occurred shortly before the babe was to be born. Distraught with grief upon hearing the news, the aged king found himself unable to accept the prospect of his royal bloodline dying with him.

column1: Na tentativa de continuar o legado do reino alcançando um corpo sem morte, o agora louco Rei Supremo usou a espada para derrubar todos os subordinados ou cidadãos infelizes o suficiente para cruzar seu caminho. "Se eu for o último rei", foi ouvido chorar, "então o reino sobrevive enquanto eu viver!"
column2: In an attempt to continue the kingdom's legacy by attaining a body without death, the now-mad High King used the sword to cut down any and all subordinates or citizens unlucky enough to cross his path. "If I am to be the final king," he was heard to cry, "then the kingdom survives so long as I live!"
column3: In an attempt to continue the kingdom's legacy by attaining a body without death, the now-mad High King used the sword to cut down any and all subordinates or citizens unlucky enough to cross his path. "If I am to be the final king," he was heard to cry, "then the kingdom survives so long as I live!"

column1: Ele matou seus súditos aos montes. Aos centenas. Aos milhares. E a cada vida que ele tirava, a luz do cristal ficava mais radiante. Mas quando o cristal estava quase cheio, o coração do rei doente não aguentou o fardo e explodiu, matando-o no mesmo instante. Infelizmente, se ele tivesse acabado com a mulher grávida e a criança que estavam diante de seus olhos, ele teria tirado exatamente dez mil vidas.
column2: He killed his subjects by the dozens. The hundreds. The thousands. And with each life he stole, the crystal's light grew more radiant. But when the crystal was nearly full, the king's ailing heart proved unable to bear the burden and burst, killing him on the spot. Alas, had he just slain the pregnant woman and unborn child that were before his very eyes, he would have taken exactly ten thousand lives.
column3: He killed his subjects by the dozens. The hundreds. The thousands. And with each life he stole, the crystal's light grew more radiant. But when the crystal was nearly full, the king's ailing heart proved unable to bear the burden and burst, killing him on the spot. Alas, had he just slain the pregnant woman and unborn child that were before his very eyes, he would have taken exactly ten thousand lives.

column1: Isso mesmo, esta é a arma que vai acabar com a sua vida. Ah, não se preocupe - não há nada com que se preocupar. Será uma dor como você nunca sentiu antes. Na verdade, você nem sentirá dor no começo - será mais como água escorrendo pela sua pele. Honestamente, para a maioria das pessoas, não é a dor que as faz gritar - é a visão do próprio sangue jorrando delas.
column2: That's right, this here's the weapon that'll be ending your life. Aw, don't sweat it—there's nothin' to worry about. It'll be a pain the likes of which you've never felt before. In fact, you won't even feel pain at first—it'll be more like water slidin' across your skin. Honestly, for most folks, it ain't the pain that makes 'em scream—it's the sight of their own blood flowin' out of 'em.
column3: That's right, this here's the weapon that'll be ending your life. Aw, don't sweat it—there's nothin' to worry about. It'll be a pain the likes of which you've never felt before. In fact, you won't even feel pain at first—it'll be more like water slidin' across your skin. Honestly, for most folks, it ain't the pain that makes 'em scream—it's the sight of their own blood flowin' out of 'em.

column1: Sim, não vai terminar tão fácil. Veja essa parte da lâmina aqui? Essa parte dói como um filho da puta de verdade. É a minha favorita, por isso eu sempre a guardo pro final. Eu gosto de usá-la depois que as pessoas ficam roucas demais e você não consegue entender o que elas estão dizendo, o que é uma verdadeira merda...<LF><LF>Caramba, você é bem barulhento! Pode abaixar o volume aí?<LF>Você vai fazer minha mão escorregar.
column2: Yeah, it won't end so easy. See this part of the blade right here? This part hurts like a real sonuvabitch. It's my favorite, which is why I always save it for last. I like to use it after people's voices get too hoarse and you can't tell what they're sayin', which is a real...<LF><LF>Fucking hell, are you ever loud! Mind pipin' down there?<LF>You're gonna make my hand slip.
column3: Yeah, it won't end so easy. See this part of the blade right here? This part hurts like a real sonuvabitch. It's my favorite, which is why I always save it for last. I like to use it after people's voices get too hoarse and you can't tell what they're sayin', which is a real...<LF><LF>Fucking hell, are you ever loud! Mind pipin' down there?<LF>You're gonna make my hand slip.

column1: Eu não vou matar você imediatamente, então não se preocupe, campeão. Eu vou levar meu tempo antes de você finalmente desistir. Honestamente, você ficaria surpreso com o quanto é preciso para matar uma pessoa. Quer dizer, pense nisso! As pessoas têm dois olhos - a maioria delas, de qualquer maneira - e duas orelhas. Dez dedos, dez dedos dos pés, vinte unhas no total - e nem comece a falar sobre as juntas, porque as pessoas têm centenas delas! Sim, temos muitas maneiras de nos manter entretidos.
column2: I won't kill ya right away, so don't worry about a thing there, champ. I'm gonna take my sweet time before ya finally give up the ghost. Honestly, you'd be surprised how much it takes to kill a person.<LF><LF>I mean, think about it! People got two eyes—most of 'em anyway—and two ears. Ten fingers, ten toes, twenty nails across the lot—and don't even get me started on joints, 'cause folks got hundreds of the damn things! Yeah, we got plenty of ways to keep ourselves entertained.
column3: I won't kill ya right away, so don't worry about a thing there, champ. I'm gonna take my sweet time before ya finally give up the ghost. Honestly, you'd be surprised how much it takes to kill a person.<LF><LF>I mean, think about it! People got two eyes—most of 'em anyway—and two ears. Ten fingers, ten toes, twenty nails across the lot—and don't even get me started on joints, 'cause folks got hundreds of the damn things! Yeah, we got plenty of ways to keep ourselves entertained.

column1: ...Huh? Por que estou fazendo isso? Não é uma pergunta interessante? Amigo, estou apenas fazendo o que você vem fazendo há muito tempo: capturando cidadãos inocentes com acusações falsas, torturando-os e exibindo suas cabeças cortadas.<LF><LF>Isso te lembra alguma coisa, amigo? Deveria, porque foi tudo você. Talvez você tenha esquecido de tudo isso, não é? Bem, não tem problema. Vou gastar todo o tempo necessário para ter certeza de que você se lembre de cada coisa que fez com minha esposa e filha.<LF><LF>Heh heh... Heh heh heh...
column2: ...Huh? Why am I doing this? Now ain't that a question!<LF>Buddy, I'm just doing what you've been doing for a good long while now: nabbing innocent citizens on fake charges, torturing 'em, and puttin' their severed heads on display.<LF><LF>That ring any bells, buddy? It should, 'cause it was all you. Guess maybe you forgot about all that, eh? Well, that's okay. I'll spend all the time it takes to make sure you remember every last thing ya did to my wife and daughter.<LF><LF>Heh heh... Heh heh heh...
column3: ...Huh? Why am I doing this? Now ain't that a question!<LF>Buddy, I'm just doing what you've been doing for a good long while now: nabbing innocent citizens on fake charges, torturing 'em, and puttin' their severed heads on display.<LF><LF>That ring any bells, buddy? It should, 'cause it was all you. Guess maybe you forgot about all that, eh? Well, that's okay. I'll spend all the time it takes to make sure you remember every last thing ya did to my wife and daughter.<LF><LF>Heh heh... Heh heh heh...

column1: Um sábio idoso está sentado na sala de referência escura de um museu mofado. Diante dele, há uma única caixa que há muito tempo está selada; é um artigo sobre o qual o curador anterior do museu deixou bem claro que nunca deveria ser aberto.
column2: An elderly scholar sits in the dim reference room of a moldy museum. Before him lies a single box which has long been sealed away; it is an article the museum's previous curator made abundantly clear should never be opened.
column3: An elderly scholar sits in the dim reference room of a moldy museum. Before him lies a single box which has long been sealed away; it is an article the museum's previous curator made abundantly clear should never be opened.

column1: Dizem que a caixa contém um fóssil que bebe o sangue dos humanos. Que tolice! Poderíamos pensar que como povo teríamos superado tal absurdo. Somente alguém que passa toda a vida rodeado de livros poderia acreditar em tal superstição preposterous.
column2: It is said the box contains a fossil that drinks the blood of humans. What foolishness! One would think we as a people would have outgrown such nonsense. Only someone who spends all their life surrounded by books could possibly believe such preposterous superstition.
column3: It is said the box contains a fossil that drinks the blood of humans. What foolishness! One would think we as a people would have outgrown such nonsense. Only someone who spends all their life surrounded by books could possibly believe such preposterous superstition.

column1: Ele abre a caixa, que cospe uma nuvem de poeira, e contempla uma única pedra de forma bizarra. Olhando para a alça anexada, pode-se facilmente concluir que foi usada de alguma maneira cerimonial. No entanto, também pode ser vista como uma arma. E que forma fascinante! Sim, isso exigirá uma pesquisa rigorosa de fato...
column2: He opens the box, which spits forth a cloud of dust, and beholds a single stone of bizarre shape. Looking at the attached handle, one could easily conclude it was used in some manner of ceremony. However, it could also be viewed as a weapon. And what a fascinating shape! Yes, this will require rigorous research indeed...
column3: He opens the box, which spits forth a cloud of dust, and beholds a single stone of bizarre shape. Looking at the attached handle, one could easily conclude it was used in some manner of ceremony. However, it could also be viewed as a weapon. And what a fascinating shape! Yes, this will require rigorous research indeed...

column1: Como todos eram tolos por ter medo de algo assim! <LF>O estudioso ri suavemente consigo mesmo enquanto estende a mão e<LF>arranca seu olho esquerdo com a ponta do fóssil.
column2: How foolish everyone was, to be afraid of something like this!<LF>The scholar chuckles softly to himself as he reaches up and<LF>gouges out his left eye with the fossil's tip.
column3: How foolish everyone was, to be afraid of something like this!<LF>The scholar chuckles softly to himself as he reaches up and<LF>gouges out his left eye with the fossil's tip.

column1: A garota havia sido prometida a um lorde local no dia de seu nascimento.<LF><LF>Conforme crescia, seus dias eram ocupados estudando técnicas adequadas para noivas, enquanto suas noites eram passadas olhando pela janela do quarto e oferecendo orações ao céu noturno por seu prometido. <LF><LF>"Oh, meu lorde. Se ao menos você viesse a mim apenas um dia antes."
column2: The girl had been betrothed to a local lord on the day of her birth.<LF><LF>As she grew, her days were taken up studying proper bridal technique, while her evenings were spent staring out her bedroom window and offering prayers for her betrothed to the night sky.<LF><LF>"Oh, my lord. If only you would come to me but a single day<LF>sooner."
column3: The girl had been betrothed to a local lord on the day of her birth.<LF><LF>As she grew, her days were taken up studying proper bridal technique, while her evenings were spent staring out her bedroom window and offering prayers for her betrothed to the night sky.<LF><LF>"Oh, my lord. If only you would come to me but a single day<LF>sooner."

column1: A casa dela foi ocupada por várias outras meninas da mesma idade. Cada uma dividia o mesmo noivo e passava seus dias estudando técnicas de noiva e suas noites rezando para o céu noturno.<LF><LF> "Oh, meu senhor, se apenas você tivesse vindo a mim apenas um dia antes."
column2: Her home was occupied by several other girls her age. Each one shared the same betrothed, and spent her days studying bridal techniques and her evenings praying to the night sky.<LF><LF>"Oh, my lord, if only you would come to me but a single day<LF>sooner."
column3: Her home was occupied by several other girls her age. Each one shared the same betrothed, and spent her days studying bridal techniques and her evenings praying to the night sky.<LF><LF>"Oh, my lord, if only you would come to me but a single day<LF>sooner."

column1: Um dia, uma briga começou quando as meninas discutiram que apenas a maior entre elas poderia se tornar noiva do seu senhor. Nenhuma cedeu um centímetro, cada qual afirmando que apenas ela sozinha poderia satisfazê-lo.<LF><LF> Vendo isso, o cuidador delas disse com voz gentil: "Não se preocupem, meninas! Cada uma de vocês certamente se tornará a noiva do nosso senhor!" Ao ouvir isso, cada rosto se iluminou com uma expressão de pura alegria.
column2: One day, a quarrel broke out as the girls argued that only the greatest among them could become their lord's betrothed. None would yield an inch, each asserting only they alone could possibly satisfy him.<LF><LF>Seeing this, their caretaker said in a kind voice, "Worry not, girls! Each and every one of you shall surely become bride to our lord!" Hearing this, every face lit up in an expression of pure joy.
column3: One day, a quarrel broke out as the girls argued that only the greatest among them could become their lord's betrothed. None would yield an inch, each asserting only they alone could possibly satisfy him.<LF><LF>Seeing this, their caretaker said in a kind voice, "Worry not, girls! Each and every one of you shall surely become bride to our lord!" Hearing this, every face lit up in an expression of pure joy.

column1: No dia em que elas iriam se casar, as meninas foram levadas para um lugar de pedras que podiam ver das janelas de suas casas. Uma única adaga foi colocada diante delas e disseram que precisavam acabar com suas vidas ali e agora se quisessem encontrar com seus noivos prometidos. Ao ouvirem isso, as meninas lutaram para pegar a adaga uma da outra, afundando-a em seus peitos no momento em que a seguraram. Anos depois, um templo chamado "O Prometido" foi construído no local onde as meninas tiraram suas próprias vidas.
column2: On the day they were to be married, the girls were brought to a place of cobbled stone they could see from the windows of their home.<LF><LF>A single dagger was then placed before them, and the girls were told they needed to end their life here and now if they wished to meet their betrothed. Upon hearing this news, the girls scrambled to seize the dagger from one another, plunging it into their chest the moment they held it.<LF><LF>Years later, a temple named "The Betrothed" was built on the spot where the girls took their own lives.
column3: On the day they were to be married, the girls were brought to a place of cobbled stone they could see from the windows of their home.<LF><LF>A single dagger was then placed before them, and the girls were told they needed to end their life here and now if they wished to meet their betrothed. Upon hearing this news, the girls scrambled to seize the dagger from one another, plunging it into their chest the moment they held it.<LF><LF>Years later, a temple named "The Betrothed" was built on the spot where the girls took their own lives.

column1: Existe uma lenda antiga que fala de uma nação ameaçada por um grande inferno. Essa nação, no entanto, foi salva do fogo do inferno eterno por uma espada com o poder de congelar qualquer coisa. Em volta dessa espada estavam milhares e milhares de esculturas de gelo humanas.
column2: There is a legend of long ago that speaks of a nation threatened by a great inferno. This nation, however, was saved from eternal hellfire by a sword with the power to freeze anything. Around this sword stood thousands upon thousands of human ice sculptures.
column3: There is a legend of long ago that speaks of a nation threatened by a great inferno. This nation, however, was saved from eternal hellfire by a sword with the power to freeze anything. Around this sword stood thousands upon thousands of human ice sculptures.

column1: Um homem em uma jornada em busca de armas eventualmente descobriu a espada. Ele a embrulhou em várias camadas de pano e a levou consigo, colocando-a na bolsa que carregava nas costas. Mas antes que o homem percebesse o que estava acontecendo, o pano, a espada e seu próprio corpo acabaram congelados sólidos.
column2: A man on a journey to seek out weapons eventually discovered the sword.<LF><LF>He wrapped it in several layers of cloth and took it with him, placing it in the bag he carried upon his back. But before the man realized what was happening, the cloth, the sword, and his own body ended up frozen solid.
column3: A man on a journey to seek out weapons eventually discovered the sword.<LF><LF>He wrapped it in several layers of cloth and took it with him, placing it in the bag he carried upon his back. But before the man realized what was happening, the cloth, the sword, and his own body ended up frozen solid.

column1: Uma sacerdotisa itinerante eventualmente descobriu a espada. Ela ofereceu uma oração ao seu deus e segurou o cabo, mas o frio instantaneamente atravessou seus dedos e se infiltrou em seu corpo, congelando-a sólida. Em seus momentos finais, a sacerdotisa proferiu palavras de grande blasfêmia ao deus que havia falhado com ela.
column2: A traveling shrine maiden eventually discovered the sword.<LF><LF>She offered a prayer to her god and gripped the hilt, but cold instantly shot through her fingers and into her body, freezing her solid. In her final moments, the shrine maiden unleashed words of great blasphemy to the god who had failed her.
column3: A traveling shrine maiden eventually discovered the sword.<LF><LF>She offered a prayer to her god and gripped the hilt, but cold instantly shot through her fingers and into her body, freezing her solid. In her final moments, the shrine maiden unleashed words of great blasphemy to the god who had failed her.

column1: Uma mulher escravizada em uma mina eventualmente descobriu a espada. Desejando uma morte fácil em vez da continuação de seu sofrimento diário, ela segurou firmemente a arma. E embora a mulher não tenha congelado, ela também foi incapaz de perfurar sua própria carne. Logo, a luz da lua brilhou sobre a lâmina da arma, refletindo a visão da mulher sendo espancada e arrastada por seu mestre.
column2: An enslaved woman in a mine eventually discovered the sword.<LF><LF>Desiring an easy death over the continuation of her daily suffering, she grasped the weapon firmly. And while the woman did not freeze, she was also unable to pierce her own flesh. Soon, moonlight shone upon the blade of the weapon, reflecting the sight of the woman being beaten and dragged away by her master.
column3: An enslaved woman in a mine eventually discovered the sword.<LF><LF>Desiring an easy death over the continuation of her daily suffering, she grasped the weapon firmly. And while the woman did not freeze, she was also unable to pierce her own flesh. Soon, moonlight shone upon the blade of the weapon, reflecting the sight of the woman being beaten and dragged away by her master.

column1: As irmãs eram marionetes de uma complexa maquinaria. Sua construção era tão perfeita que qualquer um que as visse assumiria que elas eram humanas em todos os aspectos. Elas eram a personificação das maiores conquistas tecnológicas do homem; elas caminhavam como humanos, comiam como humanos, riam como humanos. A única coisa que elas não podiam fazer, no entanto, era chorar, pois não foram projetadas dessa forma.
column2: The sisters were puppets of complex machinery. So fine was their construction that any who laid eyes upon them assumed they were human in every way.<LF><LF>They were the embodiment of man's greatest technological achievements; they walked like humans, ate like humans, laughed like humans. The one thing they could not do, however, was shed tears, for they were not designed in that way.
column3: The sisters were puppets of complex machinery. So fine was their construction that any who laid eyes upon them assumed they were human in every way.<LF><LF>They were the embodiment of man's greatest technological achievements; they walked like humans, ate like humans, laughed like humans. The one thing they could not do, however, was shed tears, for they were not designed in that way.

column1: Por serem máquinas, as irmãs não sentiam nada. Oh, elas poderiam lamentar como os humanos faziam, mas não experimentavam tristeza verdadeira, pois não sabiam o que era tristeza. Mesmo quando seus amigos faleciam em acidentes trágicos e seu criador morria de doença, elas não sentiam nada. Para as irmãs, tudo o que significava era que aquelas pessoas não existiam mais.
column2: Because the sisters were machines, they felt nothing. Oh, they might mourn as humans did, but they experienced no true sadness, for they did not know what sadness was. Even when their friends perished in tragic accidents and their creator died of disease, they felt nothing. To the sisters, all it meant was that those people no longer existed.
column3: Because the sisters were machines, they felt nothing. Oh, they might mourn as humans did, but they experienced no true sadness, for they did not know what sadness was. Even when their friends perished in tragic accidents and their creator died of disease, they felt nothing. To the sisters, all it meant was that those people no longer existed.

column1: Era um dia quente de primavera quando um único gato vagou para dentro da casa delas. Era um animal magro e sujo, tomado por doenças. "Que aborrecimento", as irmãs pensaram enquanto olhavam para a criatura miserável. Mas elas o alimentaram com leite, o limparam e o mantiveram aquecido e em breve o gato estava bem novamente. A partir daquele dia, ele ficaria onde quer que as irmãs estivessem, esfregando-se nas pernas delas quando quisesse comida. Se pegasse um rato, traria de volta para mostrar sua habilidade. Se quisesse amor, choraria por eles em um miado. "Que aborrecimento", as irmãs pensaram.
column2: It was a warm spring's day when a lone cat wandered into their home. It was a scrawny, filthy thing, riddled with disease.<LF><LF>"What a bother," the sisters thought as they looked down at the wretched creature.<LF><LF>But they fed it milk, wiped it clean, and kept it warm, and soon the cat was well again. From that day forth, it would linger wherever the sisters were, brushing against their legs when it wanted food.<LF>If it caught a mouse, it would bring it back to boast its prowess.<LF>If it wanted love, it would cry out to them in a mewling voice. <LF><LF>"What a bother," the sisters thought.
column3: It was a warm spring's day when a lone cat wandered into their home. It was a scrawny, filthy thing, riddled with disease.<LF><LF>"What a bother," the sisters thought as they looked down at the wretched creature.<LF><LF>But they fed it milk, wiped it clean, and kept it warm, and soon the cat was well again. From that day forth, it would linger wherever the sisters were, brushing against their legs when it wanted food.<LF>If it caught a mouse, it would bring it back to boast its prowess.<LF>If it wanted love, it would cry out to them in a mewling voice. <LF><LF>"What a bother," the sisters thought.

column1: Era um dia de inverno frio quando o gato entrou em sua casa, soltou um gemido fraco e morreu. Vez após vez, a irmã mais nova balançava o corpo do gato. Vez após vez, a irmã mais velha chamava por ele. Mas o gato não se mexeu nem respondeu. <LF><LF>Naquele momento, as irmãs sentiram como se algo quebrasse profundamente dentro de seus peitos. E a partir daquele dia, elas realmente não sentiram nada.
column2: It was a cold winter's day when the cat came into their house, let out a feeble squeak, and died. Time and again did the younger sister shake the cat's body. Time and again did the elder sister call out to it. But the cat neither moved nor responded.<LF><LF>In that moment, the sisters felt as though they felt something break deep inside their chests. And from that day forth, they truly felt nothing at all.
column3: It was a cold winter's day when the cat came into their house, let out a feeble squeak, and died. Time and again did the younger sister shake the cat's body. Time and again did the elder sister call out to it. But the cat neither moved nor responded.<LF><LF>In that moment, the sisters felt as though they felt something break deep inside their chests. And from that day forth, they truly felt nothing at all.

column1: Eu o amo com todo meu coração, assim como ele me ama. Quando nos cruzamos ao ar livre, ele envia sinais com seus olhos que apenas eu posso entender. Ele valoriza tanto meus presentes que os mantém trancados em um cofre. Ah, eu não poderia pedir um amante melhor!
column2: I love him with all my heart, as he does me. When we cross paths outdoors, he sends signals with his eyes that only I can understand. He treasures my gifts so much, he keeps them locked away in a safe. Oh, I couldn't ask for a better lover!
column3: I love him with all my heart, as he does me. When we cross paths outdoors, he sends signals with his eyes that only I can understand. He treasures my gifts so much, he keeps them locked away in a safe. Oh, I couldn't ask for a better lover!

column1: Eu não posso acreditar nisso! Minha melhor amiga enganou o amor da minha vida e o roubou de mim! Em um momento ele estava lá, e no próximo ele se foi - tudo que resta são alguns dos meus presentes, que estão espalhados pelo quarto vazio dele. Tudo o mais de valor foi vendido no mercado da vila.
column2: I can't believe this! My best friend deceived the love of my life and stole him from me! One moment he was there, and the next he was gone—all that remains are some of my gifts, which are scattered across his empty room. Everything else of value has been sold at the village marketplace.
column3: I can't believe this! My best friend deceived the love of my life and stole him from me! One moment he was there, and the next he was gone—all that remains are some of my gifts, which are scattered across his empty room. Everything else of value has been sold at the village marketplace.

column1: Isso não vai ficar assim. Ele não me abandonou, ele está apenas sendo enganado por aquela mulher! Eu sei que ele ainda tem sentimentos por mim - ele deve! Eu sou muito mais bonita do que ela, e ele sabe disso! Ah, sim - ele sabe. Mas eu tenho que fazê-lo ver a verdade, e rapidamente. Eu tenho que afastá-la dele! Eu tenho que matá-la! Matar! Apressa-te e mata!
column2: This will not stand. He hasn't abandoned me, he's just being tricked by that woman! I know he still has feelings for me—he must! I'm far more beautiful than she is, and he knows it! Oh, yes—he knows. But I must make him see the truth, and quickly. I have to get her away from him! I have to kill her! Kill! Hurry up and kill!
column3: This will not stand. He hasn't abandoned me, he's just being tricked by that woman! I know he still has feelings for me—he must! I'm far more beautiful than she is, and he knows it! Oh, yes—he knows. But I must make him see the truth, and quickly. I have to get her away from him! I have to kill her! Kill! Hurry up and kill!

column1: Consumida por sua loucura, a mulher massacrou o jovem marido e esposa, cortando-os com tanta força que a lâmina de sua espada entortou. A mulher então se escondeu, deixando para trás apenas pedaços de carne irreconhecíveis e uma espada com uma lâmina horrivelmente torta. Mas não importa quantos ferreiros tentaram consertar a espada, ela nunca mais recuperou sua forma original.
column2: Consumed by her madness, the woman slaughtered the young husband and wife, hacking them with such force that the blade of her sword warped. The woman then went into hiding, leaving behind only clumps of unrecognizable meat and a sword with a horribly bent blade. But no matter how many smiths attempted to repair the sword, it never again retained its original shape.
column3: Consumed by her madness, the woman slaughtered the young husband and wife, hacking them with such force that the blade of her sword warped. The woman then went into hiding, leaving behind only clumps of unrecognizable meat and a sword with a horribly bent blade. But no matter how many smiths attempted to repair the sword, it never again retained its original shape.

column1: Houve uma vez um famoso poeta em uma terra muito distante, no extremo leste. Agora, em seus últimos anos, sua habilidade havia murchado tanto que ele não conseguia mais criar uma única estrofe ou verso. <LF><LF> O pobre poeta passava cada momento angustiado pela perda, mas um dia, um monge apareceu ao seu lado, colocou gentilmente uma espada em sua mão e transmitiu as seguintes palavras:
column2: There was once a famous poet in a land to the far, far east. Now in his twilight years, his ability had withered such that he could no longer craft a single stanza or verse.<LF><LF>The poor poet spent every moment wracked with sorrow for what had been lost—but one day, a monk appeared by his side, gently placed a blade in his hand, and imparted the following words:
column3: There was once a famous poet in a land to the far, far east. Now in his twilight years, his ability had withered such that he could no longer craft a single stanza or verse.<LF><LF>The poor poet spent every moment wracked with sorrow for what had been lost—but one day, a monk appeared by his side, gently placed a blade in his hand, and imparted the following words:

column1: "Mate um com esta lâmina por um poema, e dois por dois do mesmo tipo; os quais serão mais esplêndidos do que qualquer um que este mundo já ouviu."<LF><LF>Agarrando-se às palavras do monge, o homem esperou pela cobertura da escuridão e matou um homem que encontrou na beira da estrada.<LF>No dia seguinte, ele escreveu um poema mais bonito, recuperando instantaneamente a fama e a prosperidade que havia perdido.
column2: "Kill one by this blade for one poem, and two for two in kind; the likes of which will be more splendid than any this world has ever heard."<LF><LF>Clinging to the monk's words, the man waited for the cover of darkness and cut down a man he encountered by the roadside.<LF>The following day, he wrote a most beautiful poem, instantly<LF>reclaiming the fame and prosperity he had lost.
column3: "Kill one by this blade for one poem, and two for two in kind; the likes of which will be more splendid than any this world has ever heard."<LF><LF>Clinging to the monk's words, the man waited for the cover of darkness and cut down a man he encountered by the roadside.<LF>The following day, he wrote a most beautiful poem, instantly<LF>reclaiming the fame and prosperity he had lost.

column1: O poeta continuou matando, sucessivamente. Ele matou um e escreveu um poema, depois matou novamente e escreveu outro, chegando a níveis quase deslumbrantes de riqueza e renome. Mas logo, ele se tornou obcecado em saber quão esplêndido seria um poema que ele poderia escrever se matasse alguém precioso para ele.
column2: The poet went on to kill two in succession. He killed one and wrote a poem, then killed again and wrote another, rising to almost dazzling levels of wealth and renown. But soon, he became obsessed with knowing how splendid a poem he might write if he were to kill someone precious to him.
column3: The poet went on to kill two in succession. He killed one and wrote a poem, then killed again and wrote another, rising to almost dazzling levels of wealth and renown. But soon, he became obsessed with knowing how splendid a poem he might write if he were to kill someone precious to him.

column1: Ele matou sua esposa e escreveu um poema. Ele matou seus filhos e escreveu um poema para cada um. Ele se movia por sua propriedade matando todos lá, escrevendo e escrevendo e escrevendo e escrevendo e escrevendo.<LF><LF>No final, ele matou tantos transeuntes que os poemas não conseguiam acompanhar. Ele mataria e escreveria, depois mataria e mataria e mataria e mataria - até o fim ele tirou a própria vida, sem mais criar poemas. Tudo o que restou foi uma lâmina molhada de sangue.
column2: He killed his wife and wrote a poem. He killed his children and wrote a poem for each. He moved through his estate killing everyone there, writing and writing and writing and writing and writing.<LF><LF>Eventually, he killed so many passers-by that the poems could not keep up. He would kill and write, then kill and kill and kill and kill—until in the end he took his own life, no longer crafting poems at all. All that remained was a blade wet with blood.
column3: He killed his wife and wrote a poem. He killed his children and wrote a poem for each. He moved through his estate killing everyone there, writing and writing and writing and writing and writing.<LF><LF>Eventually, he killed so many passers-by that the poems could not keep up. He would kill and write, then kill and kill and kill and kill—until in the end he took his own life, no longer crafting poems at all. All that remained was a blade wet with blood.

column1: 21 de maio<LF><LF>Finalmente ficamos sem dinheiro. A comida está custando muito mais<LF>agora por causa da guerra. Tentamos pedir na igreja,<LF>mas eles já estão ocupados cuidando dos feridos e<LF>não podem dar nada.<LF><LF>Yonah realmente perdeu muito peso.<LF>Eu queria poder conseguir algo para ela comer.
column2: May 21<LF><LF>We've finally run out of money. Food just costs a lot more<LF>nowadays because of the war. We tried begging at the church,<LF>but they have their hands full caring for the wounded and<LF>can't spare anything.<LF><LF>Yonah's really lost a lot of weight.<LF>I wish I could get her something to eat.
column3: May 21<LF><LF>We've finally run out of money. Food just costs a lot more<LF>nowadays because of the war. We tried begging at the church,<LF>but they have their hands full caring for the wounded and<LF>can't spare anything.<LF><LF>Yonah's really lost a lot of weight.<LF>I wish I could get her something to eat.

column1: 15 de julho<LF><LF>Conhecemos uma senhora simpática que nos deu um pouco de comida. No início, pensei que ela<LF>fosse sem-teto como nós, mas ela disse que estava se juntando a algum tipo de<LF>projeto de apoio e assistência do governo, então decidimos<LF>ir com ela.<LF><LF>Pelo menos Yonah parece estar bem hoje.
column2: July 15<LF><LF>We met a nice lady who gave us some food. At first, I thought she<LF>was homeless like us, but she said she was joining some kind of<LF>relief and support thing run by the government, so we decided to<LF>go with her.<LF><LF>At least Yonah seems to be doing okay today.
column3: July 15<LF><LF>We met a nice lady who gave us some food. At first, I thought she<LF>was homeless like us, but she said she was joining some kind of<LF>relief and support thing run by the government, so we decided to<LF>go with her.<LF><LF>At least Yonah seems to be doing okay today.

column1: 1 de agosto<LF><LF>Aquela senhora simpática de antes usou um livro e se transformou em um monstro. Nós fugimos o mais rápido que pudemos, porque eu não acho que ela seja humana anymore.<LF><LF>Tudo o que esses adultos nos disseram era mentira - eles não nos darão dinheiro e não tratarão da doença de Yonah. Além disso, há um grande muro ao redor da cidade agora e não podemos sair. Nunca deveríamos ter vindo para cá.
column2: August 1<LF><LF>That nice lady from before used a book and turned into a monster. We ran away as fast as we could, because I don't think she's human anymore.<LF><LF>Everything those adults told us was a lie—they won't give us money, and they won't treat Yonah's illness. Also, there's a huge wall around the city now and we can't get out. We never should have come here.
column3: August 1<LF><LF>That nice lady from before used a book and turned into a monster. We ran away as fast as we could, because I don't think she's human anymore.<LF><LF>Everything those adults told us was a lie—they won't give us money, and they won't treat Yonah's illness. Also, there's a huge wall around the city now and we can't get out. We never should have come here.

column1: 5 de agosto<LF><LF>Está tão frio hoje. Eu não consigo acreditar que é verão.<LF>Eu posso realmente ver minha respiração.<LF><LF>Decidimos nos esconder dos monstros em um supermercado abandonado. Encontramos algumas latas de comida lá, mas agora elas se foram.<LF>Também, a tosse de Yonah simplesmente não vai embora.<LF><LF>Eu tenho um pressentimento muito ruim sobre isso...
column2: August 5<LF><LF>It's so cold today. I can't believe it's summer.<LF>I can actually see my breath.<LF><LF>We decided to hide from the monsters in an abandoned supermarket. We found a few old cans of food there, but now those are gone.<LF>Also, Yonah's cough just won't quit.<LF><LF>I've got a really bad feeling about this...
column3: August 5<LF><LF>It's so cold today. I can't believe it's summer.<LF>I can actually see my breath.<LF><LF>We decided to hide from the monsters in an abandoned supermarket. We found a few old cans of food there, but now those are gone.<LF>Also, Yonah's cough just won't quit.<LF><LF>I've got a really bad feeling about this...

column1: O escudo deixado pendurado na parede estava coberto de poeira. <LF>A lâmina deixada em sua bainha havia enferrujado.<LF>As técnicas que eu não usei foram esquecidas.<LF>O corpo que eu deveria treinar foi deixado para amolecer.<LF>Eu tinha perdido a vontade de praticar disciplina.
column2: The shield left hanging on the wall was covered in dust.<LF>The blade left in its scabbard had rusted over.<LF>The techniques I hadn't used were forgotten.<LF>The body I was to train was left to grow soft.<LF>I had lost the will to practice discipline.
column3: The shield left hanging on the wall was covered in dust.<LF>The blade left in its scabbard had rusted over.<LF>The techniques I hadn't used were forgotten.<LF>The body I was to train was left to grow soft.<LF>I had lost the will to practice discipline.

column1: Eu pensei que as coisas terminariam sem uma única palavra dita.<LF>Eu fingi não ver a violência infligida por outros.<LF>Eu desisti, assumindo que as coisas nunca mudariam.<LF>Eu acreditava que não havia como resistir a um poder tão grande.<LF>Eu zombei dos corações que tentaram acreditar mesmo assim.
column2: I thought things would end without a single word said.<LF>I pretended not to see violence inflicted by others.<LF>I had given up, assuming things would never change.<LF>I believed there was no way to oppose such a great power.<LF>I sneered at hearts that tried to believe anyway.
column3: I thought things would end without a single word said.<LF>I pretended not to see violence inflicted by others.<LF>I had given up, assuming things would never change.<LF>I believed there was no way to oppose such a great power.<LF>I sneered at hearts that tried to believe anyway.

column1: Eu ri, pensando neles como tolos sem cérebro.<LF>Aqueles eram os pensamentos em que eu havia me refugiado.<LF>Eu desisti, acreditando que nada era possível no final.<LF>Lamentei a insensatez e a feiura de tudo isso.<LF>Minha vida havia perdido todo o sentido.
column2: I laughed, thinking them brainless fools.<LF>Those were the thoughts I had taken refuge in.<LF>I had given up, believing nothing was possible in the end.<LF>I lamented the foolishness and ugliness of it all.<LF>My life had lost all meaning.
column3: I laughed, thinking them brainless fools.<LF>Those were the thoughts I had taken refuge in.<LF>I had given up, believing nothing was possible in the end.<LF>I lamented the foolishness and ugliness of it all.<LF>My life had lost all meaning.

column1: Eu havia perdido de vista aqueles que eram preciosos para mim.<LF>Não conseguia acreditar em sua bondade.<LF>Não fui capaz de salvá-los do pesar que rasgava seus corações.<LF>Havia esquecido a coragem necessária para proteger as menores das alegrias.<LF>Acreditei que minhas palavras nunca chegariam até você.
column2: I had lost sight of those who were precious to me<LF>I could not believe in their kindness.<LF>I was unable to save them from the grief that tore at their hearts.<LF>I had forgotten the courage it takes to protect the smallest of joys.<LF>I believed my words would never reach you.
column3: I had lost sight of those who were precious to me<LF>I could not believe in their kindness.<LF>I was unable to save them from the grief that tore at their hearts.<LF>I had forgotten the courage it takes to protect the smallest of joys.<LF>I believed my words would never reach you.

column1: Esta é uma história de tempos muito, muito antigos.<LF><LF>Houve um belo pássaro com plumagens resplandecentes que vivia uma vida tranquila, profundamente na floresta.
column2: This is a story of a time long, long ago.<LF><LF>There was once a beautiful bird with resplendent feathers that lived a quiet life deep in the forest.
column3: This is a story of a time long, long ago.<LF><LF>There was once a beautiful bird with resplendent feathers that lived a quiet life deep in the forest.

column1: Um dia, uma criança perdida se aventurou na floresta. Ele vinha de um lugar de fome e tinha sido abandonado na floresta como uma forma de reduzir o número de bocas para alimentar. Com pena da criancinha fraca e faminta, o belo pássaro arrancou uma de suas próprias penas e a deu para ele. Quando ele voltou para casa, sua família ficou radiante com a pena e permitiu que ele vivesse com eles novamente.
column2: One day, a lost child wandered into the woods. He came from a place of famine, and had been abandoned in the forest as a way to reduce the number of mouths to feed.<LF><LF>Taking pity on the feeble, starving child, the beautiful bird plucked one of its own feathers and gave it to him. When he returned home, his family was overjoyed by the feather, and permitted him to live with them once more.
column3: One day, a lost child wandered into the woods. He came from a place of famine, and had been abandoned in the forest as a way to reduce the number of mouths to feed.<LF><LF>Taking pity on the feeble, starving child, the beautiful bird plucked one of its own feathers and gave it to him. When he returned home, his family was overjoyed by the feather, and permitted him to live with them once more.

column1: Ouvindo a história da criança, uma pessoa após outra desceu para a floresta para contar ao belo pássaro quão pobres e infelizes eram. Cada vez, o pássaro arrancaria uma pena e daria de presente, arrancaria uma pena e daria de presente, até não ter mais nenhuma para dar e sua aparência uma vez bela ter se tornado desgastada além do reconhecimento.<LF><LF>Mas o pássaro desgastado não tinha arrependimentos.
column2: Hearing the child's story, one person after another descended on the forest to tell the beautiful bird how poor and unfortunate they were. Each time, the bird would pluck a feather and give it away, pluck a feather and give it away, until it had no more to give and its once-beautiful visage had become shabby beyond recognition.<LF><LF>But the shabby bird had no regrets.
column3: Hearing the child's story, one person after another descended on the forest to tell the beautiful bird how poor and unfortunate they were. Each time, the bird would pluck a feather and give it away, pluck a feather and give it away, until it had no more to give and its once-beautiful visage had become shabby beyond recognition.<LF><LF>But the shabby bird had no regrets.

column1: Um dia, a criança original apareceu diante do pássaro maltrapilho, sem penas e congelando no frio. Ele veio procurando um pássaro com penas resplandecentes para retribuir a gentileza anterior da criatura. Radiante, o pássaro maltrapilho disse à criança: "Sou eu quem você procura. Se eu pudesse pedir um favor, você poderia me segurar no seu peito e aquecer meu corpo congelado?" Sem dar nem uma olhada no pássaro maltrapilho, a criança o chamou de mentiroso e o matou com uma grande lâmina. Então, ele assou o pássaro, comeu cada parte e partiu novamente em busca do belo pássaro que havia salvado sua vida.
column2: One day, the original child appeared before the shabby bird, which was featherless and freezing in the cold. He had come seeking a bird with resplendent feathers, that he might repay the creature's earlier kindness.<LF><LF>Overjoyed, the shabby bird said to the child, "It is I you seek. If I might beg a favor, would you hold me to your chest and warm my freezing body?"<LF><LF>Sparing a single glance at the shabby bird, the child called it a liar and cut it down with a large blade. He then roasted the bird, ate every last part, and set out anew to find the beautiful bird who had once saved his life.
column3: One day, the original child appeared before the shabby bird, which was featherless and freezing in the cold. He had come seeking a bird with resplendent feathers, that he might repay the creature's earlier kindness.<LF><LF>Overjoyed, the shabby bird said to the child, "It is I you seek. If I might beg a favor, would you hold me to your chest and warm my freezing body?"<LF><LF>Sparing a single glance at the shabby bird, the child called it a liar and cut it down with a large blade. He then roasted the bird, ate every last part, and set out anew to find the beautiful bird who had once saved his life.

column1: Há muito tempo, em um reino distante, havia três irmãos. O irmão mais velho era um rei que governava toda a nação. Ele era um rei muito assustador, temido por todos.
column2: Long, long ago in a faraway kingdom, there were three brothers.<LF>The eldest brother was a king who ruled over the nation entire.<LF>He was a most terrifying king, feared by all.
column3: Long, long ago in a faraway kingdom, there were three brothers.<LF>The eldest brother was a king who ruled over the nation entire.<LF>He was a most terrifying king, feared by all.

column1: Todos os dias, o rei selecionava um de seus súditos para executar como sacrifício. Neste dia, ele cortou a cabeça de uma mãe e forçou sua família a assistir. A cabeça girou três vezes no ar antes de cair ao lado da cabeça de seu filho, que o rei tinha matado anteriormente. Que horror! Mas o rei apenas assistiu à cena se desenrolar diante dele e riu em voz alta de forma perturbadora.
column2: Each day, the king would select one of his subjects to execute as a sacrifice. This day, he chopped off a mother's head and forced her family to watch. The head spun three times as it flew through the air before landing next to the head of her son, who the king had previously killed.<LF><LF>Oh, the horror of it all.<LF><LF>But the king merely watched the sight unfold before him and laughed in a most unsettling voice.
column3: Each day, the king would select one of his subjects to execute as a sacrifice. This day, he chopped off a mother's head and forced her family to watch. The head spun three times as it flew through the air before landing next to the head of her son, who the king had previously killed.<LF><LF>Oh, the horror of it all.<LF><LF>But the king merely watched the sight unfold before him and laughed in a most unsettling voice.

column1: Um dia, o rei contraiu uma doença muito grave - uma que fazia seu corpo apodrecer enquanto ele ainda estava vivo. Mas mesmo doente, o rei ainda arrastava sua carne em decomposição para as execuções da mesma forma. Seus servos não ousavam desafiar seu rei, então eles continuaram matando dia após dia, dia após dia, dia após dia.
column2: One day, the king contracted an illness most dire—one which caused his body to rot while he was still alive. But though diseased, the king would still drag his decaying flesh to the executions all the same. His retainers dared not defy their king, so they continued to kill day after day after day after day.
column3: One day, the king contracted an illness most dire—one which caused his body to rot while he was still alive. But though diseased, the king would still drag his decaying flesh to the executions all the same. His retainers dared not defy their king, so they continued to kill day after day after day after day.

column1: No final, o rei apodreceu e morreu. Sua foi uma morte nojenta, repugnante e podre, mas seus servos continuaram realizando execuções diante do cadáver apodrecido do rei todos os dias ... Todos os dias, matando ... Todos os dias, o rei apodrecido e os servos apodrecidos e os cidadãos apodrecidos ... e você apodrecido.
column2: In the end, the king rotted and died. His was a disgusting, foul, rotten death, but his retainers continued carrying out executions before the king's rotted corpse every day... Every day, killing... Every day the rotted king and the rotted retainers and the rotted citizens...and the rotted you.
column3: In the end, the king rotted and died. His was a disgusting, foul, rotten death, but his retainers continued carrying out executions before the king's rotted corpse every day... Every day, killing... Every day the rotted king and the rotted retainers and the rotted citizens...and the rotted you.

column1: Era uma besta que vivia nas profundezas mais intocadas de uma caverna. Tinha chifres enormes. Um corpo como aço. Respirava fogo escaldante. Os aldeões pacíficos odiavam essa besta monstruosa com cabeça de touro e corpo humano. Eles temiam isso. E logo, a besta passou a ser conhecida como o "Minotauro do Labirinto".
column2: It was a beast that lived in a cavern's deepest, most untouched depths.<LF><LF>It had massive horns. A body like steel. Breath of scorching fire.<LF><LF>The peace-loving villagers hated this monstrous beast with the head of a bull and the body of a human. They feared it. And soon, the beast came to be known as the "Minotaur of the Labyrinth."
column3: It was a beast that lived in a cavern's deepest, most untouched depths.<LF><LF>It had massive horns. A body like steel. Breath of scorching fire.<LF><LF>The peace-loving villagers hated this monstrous beast with the head of a bull and the body of a human. They feared it. And soon, the beast came to be known as the "Minotaur of the Labyrinth."

column1: Ao contrário de sua aparência aterrorizante, o minotauro era excepcionalmente gentil. Não só se abstinha de prejudicar outras criaturas, ele tomava muito cuidado para não pisar nas flores com seus pés desajeitados enquanto caminhava. De fato, a razão pela qual vivia tão profundamente dentro de uma caverna era para evitar assustar os aldeões.
column2: Contrary to its terrifying appearance, the minotaur was exceptionally kind. Not only did it refrain from harming other creatures, it took great care not to trample flowers beneath its oafish feet as it walked. Indeed, the reason it lived so deep inside a cavern was to help avoid frightening the villagers.
column3: Contrary to its terrifying appearance, the minotaur was exceptionally kind. Not only did it refrain from harming other creatures, it took great care not to trample flowers beneath its oafish feet as it walked. Indeed, the reason it lived so deep inside a cavern was to help avoid frightening the villagers.

column1: Um dia, uma menina perdida vagou pela caverna da fera. Assustada com a visão dela, ela chorou tanto que eventualmente desmaiou - o que deixou a fera em um grande dilema. "Não tenho escolha", decidiu finalmente a fera. "Devo levar a pobre menina de volta à vila, pois sua mãe e pai ficarão terrivelmente preocupados."
column2: One day, a lost girl wandered into the beast's cavern. Frightened by the sight of it, she cried so hard she eventually passed out—which left the beast in quite the quandary.<LF><LF>"I have no choice," the beast finally decided. "I must take the poor thing back to the village, for her mother and father will be terribly worried."
column3: One day, a lost girl wandered into the beast's cavern. Frightened by the sight of it, she cried so hard she eventually passed out—which left the beast in quite the quandary.<LF><LF>"I have no choice," the beast finally decided. "I must take the poor thing back to the village, for her mother and father will be terribly worried."

column1: Dois dias após a garota ter desaparecido, seus pais apavorados a encontraram dormindo tranquilamente na frente de sua casa. No chão, a pouca distância, estava o corpo morto do minotauro. Ele havia sido empalado por várias espadas e o sangue espalhado ao seu redor tinha uma qualidade quase sobrenatural. <LF><LF>No entanto, não havia indicação de que a besta tivesse atacado a garota. Na verdade, parecia que estava tentando se afastar o máximo possível dela, para não sujá-la com seu sangue - quase como se não quisesse que ela ficasse com medo. E então, tendo se enrolado para se tornar o menor possível, o monstro morreu.
column2: Two days after the girl vanished, her panicked parents found her sleeping soundly in front of their home. On the ground a short distance away was the dead body of the minotaur. It had been impaled by several swords, and the blood scattered around it held an almost otherworldly quality.<LF><LF>Yet there was no indication the beast had attacked the girl. In fact, it looked as though it had been trying to place as much distance between itself and her as possible, so as not to dirty her with its blood—almost as if it didn't want her to be afraid. And then, having curled up to made itself as small as possible, the monster died.
column3: Two days after the girl vanished, her panicked parents found her sleeping soundly in front of their home. On the ground a short distance away was the dead body of the minotaur. It had been impaled by several swords, and the blood scattered around it held an almost otherworldly quality.<LF><LF>Yet there was no indication the beast had attacked the girl. In fact, it looked as though it had been trying to place as much distance between itself and her as possible, so as not to dirty her with its blood—almost as if it didn't want her to be afraid. And then, having curled up to made itself as small as possible, the monster died.

column1: Memória: 6 de junho de 2003, por volta das 15:00<LF><LF>Um humanoide branco e massivo (inicialmente chamado de "a Arma", mas desde então renomeado como "o Gigante") cai do céu sobre o distrito de Shinjuku em Tóquio, causando tremendo estrago. Ao mesmo tempo, uma grande criatura vermelha (doravante denominada "o Dragão") aparece e entra em combate com o Gigante - embora a natureza de seus ataques e sua utilidade permaneçam obscuros.<LF><LF>À medida que as Forças de Autodefesa contemplam métodos pelos quais podem atacar o alvo, o governo estabelece um Bureau de Contramedidas de Emergência.
column2: Memoir: June 6, 2003, approximately 15:00<LF><LF>A massive, white humanoid (initially called "the Weapon" but since renamed "the Giant") falls from the sky above Tokyo's Shinjuku ward, inflicting tremendous damage. At the same time, a large red creature (henceforth referred to as "the Dragon") appears and engages the Giant in combat—though both the nature of its attacks and their utility remain unclear.<LF><LF>As the Self-Defense Force contemplates methods by which they might attack the target, the government establishes a Bureau of Emergency Countermeasures.
column3: Memoir: June 6, 2003, approximately 15:00<LF><LF>A massive, white humanoid (initially called "the Weapon" but since renamed "the Giant") falls from the sky above Tokyo's Shinjuku ward, inflicting tremendous damage. At the same time, a large red creature (henceforth referred to as "the Dragon") appears and engages the Giant in combat—though both the nature of its attacks and their utility remain unclear.<LF><LF>As the Self-Defense Force contemplates methods by which they might attack the target, the government establishes a Bureau of Emergency Countermeasures.

column1: Memórias: 12 de junho de 2003, aproximadamente às 16:00<LF><LF>O Gigante, que estava em combate com o Dragão, começa a desmoronar repentinamente por razões desconhecidas. O Dragão é então abatido pela 6ª divisão, esquadrão 303 da Força de Autodefesa Aérea.<LF><LF>Não existe registro oficial de quem emitiu a ordem para atacar o Dragão.<LF><LF>Começa-se a trabalhar para recuperar os restos do Gigante e do Dragão, mas nunca foi feita nenhuma verificação oficial sobre qual organização realizou a recuperação.
column2: Memoir: June 12, 2003, approximately 16:00<LF><LF>The Giant, which was locked in combat with the Dragon, suddenly begins to collapse for reasons unknown. The Dragon is then shot down by the 6th division, 303rd squadron of the Air Self-Defense Force.<LF><LF>No official record exists of who issued the order to attack the Dragon.<LF><LF>Work is begun to retrieve the remains of both the Giant and the Dragon, but no official verification has ever been made regarding which organization performed the retrieval.
column3: Memoir: June 12, 2003, approximately 16:00<LF><LF>The Giant, which was locked in combat with the Dragon, suddenly begins to collapse for reasons unknown. The Dragon is then shot down by the 6th division, 303rd squadron of the Air Self-Defense Force.<LF><LF>No official record exists of who issued the order to attack the Dragon.<LF><LF>Work is begun to retrieve the remains of both the Giant and the Dragon, but no official verification has ever been made regarding which organization performed the retrieval.

column1: Memórias: dezembro de 2003<LF><LF>O primeiro caso da Síndrome de Coloração Branca é confirmado no bairro Shinjuku, em Tóquio.
column2: Memoir: December 2003<LF><LF>The first case of White Chlorination Syndrome is confirmed in Tokyo's Shinjuku ward.
column3: Memoir: December 2003<LF><LF>The first case of White Chlorination Syndrome is confirmed in Tokyo's Shinjuku ward.

column1: Memória: Julho de 2004<LF><LF>Os humanos continuam a se tornar violentos devido à Síndrome de Coloração Branca, com lutas cada vez mais intensas nas regiões infectadas. Com a causa da doença ainda incerta, os infectados são isolados e tumultos violentos são suprimidos pela força. As principais vias são seladas e o transporte ferroviário é interrompido, levando posteriormente ao isolamento de toda Shinjuku.<LF><LF>Neste momento, a perspectiva de solicitar a intervenção não oficial do exército americano é considerada, mas o governo adia. Enquanto isso, começa a pesquisa sobre partículas Maso obtidas do Gigante e do Dragão, bem como sobre as contramedidas para a Síndrome de Coloração Branca. Essa pesquisa leva eventualmente à fundação do Projeto Gestalt uma década depois.
column2: Memoir: July 2004<LF><LF>Humans continue to turn violent due to White Chlorination Syndrome, with fighting growing increasingly intense in infected regions. With the cause of the disease still unclear, the infected are isolated, and violent riots suppressed by force. Main thoroughfares are sealed and rail transportation is halted, later leading to all of Shinjuku being sealed off.<LF><LF>At this time, the prospect of asking the American military for non-official intervention is considered, but the government defers. Meanwhile, research begins on Maso particles obtained from the Giant and the Dragon, as well as on countermeasures for White Chlorination Syndrome. This research ultimately leads to the founding of Project Gestalt a decade later.
column3: Memoir: July 2004<LF><LF>Humans continue to turn violent due to White Chlorination Syndrome, with fighting growing increasingly intense in infected regions. With the cause of the disease still unclear, the infected are isolated, and violent riots suppressed by force. Main thoroughfares are sealed and rail transportation is halted, later leading to all of Shinjuku being sealed off.<LF><LF>At this time, the prospect of asking the American military for non-official intervention is considered, but the government defers. Meanwhile, research begins on Maso particles obtained from the Giant and the Dragon, as well as on countermeasures for White Chlorination Syndrome. This research ultimately leads to the founding of Project Gestalt a decade later.

column1: Nós estamos juntos desde que nascemos. Nós estamos juntos quando comemos, quando dormimos e quando sonhamos.
column2: We've been together since we were born. We're together when we eat, when we sleep, and when we dream.
column3: We've been together since we were born. We're together when we eat, when we sleep, and when we dream.

column1: Nós dividimos tudo! Nós dividimos o leite que recebemos da Mamãe, e as coisas boas que Papai diz para nós.
column2: We share everything! We share the milk we get from Mommy,<LF>and the nice things Daddy says to us.
column3: We share everything! We share the milk we get from Mommy,<LF>and the nice things Daddy says to us.

column1: Mas não estamos juntos quando morremos. Papai me pegou e cortou a minha cabeça, e Mamãe pegou minha irmã e cortou a cabeça dela.
column2: But we're not together when we die. Daddy took me and cut off my head, and Mommy took my sister and cut off her head.
column3: But we're not together when we die. Daddy took me and cut off my head, and Mommy took my sister and cut off her head.

column1: Mas tudo bem. Nosso sangue foi misturado em um grande machado, então agora podemos ficar juntos para sempre!
column2: But it's okay. Our blood got all mushed up into a big axe, so now we can be together forever!
column3: But it's okay. Our blood got all mushed up into a big axe, so now we can be together forever!

column1: Havia uma reunião ritual de espíritos realizada na noite da décima lua cheia do ano. Durante a cerimônia, eles se reuniam às margens de um lago e se gabavam uns aos outros de todas as más ações que tinham praticado durante o ano.
column2: There once was a ritual gathering of spirits held on the night of the tenth full moon of the year. During the ceremony, they would gather on the shores of a lake and boast to one another of all the evil deeds they had performed during the year.
column3: There once was a ritual gathering of spirits held on the night of the tenth full moon of the year. During the ceremony, they would gather on the shores of a lake and boast to one another of all the evil deeds they had performed during the year.

column1:
O primeiro espírito sentiu grande alegria em contar sobre as formas inconcebivelmente cruéis como matou alguns dos melhores soldados da terra.
Ao longo do ano, ela transformou sua forma em uma dama da noite e chamou vários homens, então arrancou cada pedaço de seus corpos quando chegaram à sua cama. Os soldados, envergonhados por suas habilidades não terem sido suficientes para salvá-los, derramaram lágrimas amargas enquanto morriam e o espírito afirmou que eram a coisa mais deliciosa que já provou.
column2: The first spirit took great joy in telling of the unfathomably cruel ways she had killed some of the finest soldiers in the land.<LF><LF>Over the year, she had transformed her shape into a lady of the night and called out to various men, then tore off every last piece of their body when they came to her bed. The soldiers, ashamed their skills could not save them, shed bitter tears as they died, and the spirit claimed they were the most delicious thing she had ever tasted.
column3: The first spirit took great joy in telling of the unfathomably cruel ways she had killed some of the finest soldiers in the land.<LF><LF>Over the year, she had transformed her shape into a lady of the night and called out to various men, then tore off every last piece of their body when they came to her bed. The soldiers, ashamed their skills could not save them, shed bitter tears as they died, and the spirit claimed they were the most delicious thing she had ever tasted.

column1: O próximo espírito animou os outros com uma história de astúcia e malícia. Uma noite, ela jogou um menino pequeno em um pântano. Quando sua irmã mais velha veio resgatá-lo, ela também afundou na lama. Esses dois foram seguidos por seus pais, então outros irmãos, então parentes distantes, até que finalmente todos os membros da vila estavam dormindo no fundo do pântano. Quando o espírito terminou sua história, ela estava tão feliz que nem percebeu a saliva que escorria pelo queixo.
column2: The next spirit regaled the others with a story of cunning and guile.<LF><LF>One night, she threw a small boy into a bog. When his older sister came to rescue him, she, too, sank into the murk. These two were followed by their parents, then other siblings, then extended relatives, until finally every member of the village was sleeping at the bottom of the bog.<LF><LF>When the spirit finished her story, she was so beside herself with glee that she did not even notice the saliva that dripped down her chin.
column3: The next spirit regaled the others with a story of cunning and guile.<LF><LF>One night, she threw a small boy into a bog. When his older sister came to rescue him, she, too, sank into the murk. These two were followed by their parents, then other siblings, then extended relatives, until finally every member of the village was sleeping at the bottom of the bog.<LF><LF>When the spirit finished her story, she was so beside herself with glee that she did not even notice the saliva that dripped down her chin.

column1: Nervosamente, o espírito mais pequeno do grupo deu um passo à frente para se dirigir à multidão.<LF><LF>"Eu sou o mais incrível de todos nós!" gritou o espírito frequentemente ridicularizado com todas as suas forças. "Porque fui eu quem jogou todas as criaturas vivas nas profundezas mais assustadoras do terror!"<LF><LF>Os outros espíritos, incapazes de conter seu riso, caíram no chão e rolaram - e seu riso não cessou até que o horrível monstro que o pequeno espírito havia convocado do mundo dos demônios devorasse todos eles.
column2: Nervously, the smallest spirit in the group stepped forward to address the crowd.<LF><LF>"I am the most amazing of us all!" cried the oft-ridiculed spirit at the top of her lungs. "For it was I who thrust all living creatures into terror's deepest depths!"<LF><LF>The other spirits, unable to contain their mirth, collapsed to the ground and rolled about—and their laughter did not cease until the horrifying monster the small spirit had summoned from the demon world devoured each and every last one of them.
column3: Nervously, the smallest spirit in the group stepped forward to address the crowd.<LF><LF>"I am the most amazing of us all!" cried the oft-ridiculed spirit at the top of her lungs. "For it was I who thrust all living creatures into terror's deepest depths!"<LF><LF>The other spirits, unable to contain their mirth, collapsed to the ground and rolled about—and their laughter did not cease until the horrifying monster the small spirit had summoned from the demon world devoured each and every last one of them.

column1: A menina encara a cena diante dela.<LF><LF>Seu pai está próximo, desmembrado por inúmeras lâminas. Sua mãe também está morrendo, assim como seu irmão recém-nascido. Todos sofreram terrivelmente em seus últimos momentos, e a menina não pode fazer nada além de chorar enquanto encara os três soldados que mataram sua única família.
column2: The girl stares at the sight before her.<LF><LF>Her father lies nearby, carved to pieces by countless blades. Her mother also lies dying, as well as her newborn baby brother. All had suffered terribly in their final moments, and the girl can do nothing but cry as she stares at the three soldiers who have murdered her only family.
column3: The girl stares at the sight before her.<LF><LF>Her father lies nearby, carved to pieces by countless blades. Her mother also lies dying, as well as her newborn baby brother. All had suffered terribly in their final moments, and the girl can do nothing but cry as she stares at the three soldiers who have murdered her only family.

column1: Anos depois, a garota reaparece, seu semblante fortalecido por sua promessa de vingança.<LF><LF>O primeiro soldado engordou tanto que os botões de seu uniforme mal conseguem conter sua circunferência. A garota se aproxima dele e afirma saber um jeito fácil de perder peso. Sob o pretexto de um exame, ela o faz deitar em uma cama antes de cortar seus braços e pernas com um machado. O pedaço restante do soldado grita e tenta se contorcer para longe, mas a garota o prende e diz que ele ainda tem partes que pode perder.<LF><LF>Algum tempo depois, a garota está sentada em frente ao torso agora arredondado e sorri. "Pronto," ela sussurra. "Olha como você está magrinho."
column2: Years later, the girl reappears, her visage made strong by her vow for revenge.<LF><LF>The first soldier has grown so fat that the buttons on his uniform can barely contain his girth. The girl approaches him and claims to know an easy way to lose weight. On the pretext of an examination, she has him lie down on a bed before suddenly hacking off his arms and legs with an axe. The remaining lump of soldier screams and attempts to wriggle away, but the girl pins him down and tells him he still has parts he can lose.<LF><LF>Some time later, the girl sits in front of the now-rounded torso and smiles. "There we are," she whispers. "Look how nice and slim you are."
column3: Years later, the girl reappears, her visage made strong by her vow for revenge.<LF><LF>The first soldier has grown so fat that the buttons on his uniform can barely contain his girth. The girl approaches him and claims to know an easy way to lose weight. On the pretext of an examination, she has him lie down on a bed before suddenly hacking off his arms and legs with an axe. The remaining lump of soldier screams and attempts to wriggle away, but the girl pins him down and tells him he still has parts he can lose.<LF><LF>Some time later, the girl sits in front of the now-rounded torso and smiles. "There we are," she whispers. "Look how nice and slim you are."

column1: O segundo soldado é um galanteador sem igual; todas as noites, uma nova mulher é convidada para sua mansão para passar a noite. A garota invade sua casa e mata as mulheres ao seu lado, depois usa seu machado para cortar sua masculinidade enquanto ele treme e implora por misericórdia.
column2: The second soldier is a peerless lothario; each night, a new woman is invited to his manor to spend the night. The girl breaks into his home and kills the women at his side, then uses her axe to hack off his manhood as he trembles and begs for mercy.
column3: The second soldier is a peerless lothario; each night, a new woman is invited to his manor to spend the night. The girl breaks into his home and kills the women at his side, then uses her axe to hack off his manhood as he trembles and begs for mercy.

column1: O terceiro soldado já deixou o serviço há muito tempo e agora vive uma vida tranquila com sua família em uma vila remota. Depois que eles caem no sono, a garota pega seu machado e corta as vigas de suporte da casa, fazendo-a desabar. Ela então põe fogo nos destroços, criando uma grande fogueira que pode ser vista por milhas em todas as direções.<LF><LF>De repente, o filho do soldado rasteja dos escombros, coberto da cabeça aos pés em queimaduras terríveis. Quando seus olhos caem sobre a garota que assassinou sua família, ela lhe entrega seu machado e foge para a escuridão da noite, nunca mais sendo vista novamente.
column2: The third soldier has long since left the service, and is now living a quiet life with his family in a remote village. After they have fallen asleep, the girl takes her axe and cleaves the support beams of the house, causing it to collapse. She then sets fire to the wreckage, creating a great bonfire than can be seen for miles in all directions.<LF><LF>Suddenly, the soldier's son crawls from the wreckage, covered from head to toe in terrible burns. As his eyes fall on the girl who has murdered his family, she hands him her axe and flees into the dark of night, never to be seen again.
column3: The third soldier has long since left the service, and is now living a quiet life with his family in a remote village. After they have fallen asleep, the girl takes her axe and cleaves the support beams of the house, causing it to collapse. She then sets fire to the wreckage, creating a great bonfire than can be seen for miles in all directions.<LF><LF>Suddenly, the soldier's son crawls from the wreckage, covered from head to toe in terrible burns. As his eyes fall on the girl who has murdered his family, she hands him her axe and flees into the dark of night, never to be seen again.

column1: Eu levanto o grito do meu nascimento. O som do ferro quente tomando forma; um martelo de aço batendo na minha forma. Nascido para entregar justiça cármica, eu entro no mundo sob o cuidadoso olhar de faíscas e chamas que iluminam a escuridão. Sou uma lâmina nascida de um rugido ensurdecedor. Sou uma arma. Sou Vontade de Ferro.
column2: I raise the cry of my birth.<LF><LF>The sound of heated iron taking shape; a steel mallet striking my form. Born to deliver karmic justice, I enter the world under the careful watch of spark and flame that give light to the gloom.<LF><LF>I am a blade born of a deafening roar. I am a weapon. I am Iron Will.
column3: I raise the cry of my birth.<LF><LF>The sound of heated iron taking shape; a steel mallet striking my form. Born to deliver karmic justice, I enter the world under the careful watch of spark and flame that give light to the gloom.<LF><LF>I am a blade born of a deafening roar. I am a weapon. I am Iron Will.

column1: Eu concedo a morte. Transformo o medo e os gritos dos meus inimigos em alegria. Enfeito minha pele de ferro com suas vísceras. Quando tiro a vida deles, sou preenchido com alegria sombria. Quando os esmago sob mim, encontro um significado em meu nascimento. E continuo matando, para que eu possa compartilhar essa delícia com todos. Mato, e mato, e mato, e mato. Sou uma arma. Sou Vontade de Ferro.
column2: I grant death.<LF><LF>I transform the dread and screams of my foes to elation. I festoon my iron skin with their viscera. When I rob them of life, I am filled with dark joy. When I crush them beneath me, I find meaning in my birth. And I continue to kill, that I might share this delight with all.<LF><LF>I kill, and kill, and kill, and kill. I am a weapon. I am Iron Will.
column3: I grant death.<LF><LF>I transform the dread and screams of my foes to elation. I festoon my iron skin with their viscera. When I rob them of life, I am filled with dark joy. When I crush them beneath me, I find meaning in my birth. And I continue to kill, that I might share this delight with all.<LF><LF>I kill, and kill, and kill, and kill. I am a weapon. I am Iron Will.

column1: Estou destroçado. Na batalha e no fim do sangue, meu corpo é despedaçado pela malícia e pelo ódio. Hoje, eu enfrento novamente o dragão vermelho em batalha, e forças mágicas encontram presas de ferro saltando para criar uma tempestade de sangue. Minha espada amaldiçoada, afundo no negro adormecido. Eu sou uma arma. Eu sou Iron Will.
column2: I am shattered.<LF><LF>At battle and blood's end, my body is torn asunder by malice and hate. Today, I again engage the red dragon in battle, and magical forces meet leaping iron fangs to create a bloodstorm.<LF><LF>My steel cursed, I sink into the slumbering black. I am a weapon.<LF>I am Iron Will.
column3: I am shattered.<LF><LF>At battle and blood's end, my body is torn asunder by malice and hate. Today, I again engage the red dragon in battle, and magical forces meet leaping iron fangs to create a bloodstorm.<LF><LF>My steel cursed, I sink into the slumbering black. I am a weapon.<LF>I am Iron Will.

column1: Eu sonho. É o sonho de uma pequena borboleta. Nela, a borboleta é pega em uma chuva fraca, lutando contra ela com todas as suas forças. Na mais escura das noites, contemplo um sonho que nunca se tornará realidade. Eu sou uma arma. Eu sou Iron Will.
column2: I dream.<LF><LF>It is the dream of a small butterfly. In it, the butterfly is caught in a light rain, struggling against it with all its might.<LF><LF>In the darkest of nights, I behold a dream that will never come true. I am a weapon. I am Iron Will.
column3: I dream.<LF><LF>It is the dream of a small butterfly. In it, the butterfly is caught in a light rain, struggling against it with all its might.<LF><LF>In the darkest of nights, I behold a dream that will never come true. I am a weapon. I am Iron Will.

column1: Eles eram um povo assustadoramente diligente. Eles limpavam florestas e caçavam animais mesmo quando não tinham necessidade. Eles desenvolveram técnicas para preservar alimentos que não podiam comer e ganhavam mais dinheiro do que poderiam gastar. No entanto, não havia um único entre eles que não aceitasse essas práticas, pois nenhum conhecia outros costumes.
column2: They were a frighteningly diligent people.<LF><LF>They would clear forests and hunt animals even when they had no need. They developed techniques to preserve food they were unable to eat, and earned more money than could ever be spent. Yet there was not a single one among them who did not accept these practices, for none knew of any other customs.
column3: They were a frighteningly diligent people.<LF><LF>They would clear forests and hunt animals even when they had no need. They developed techniques to preserve food they were unable to eat, and earned more money than could ever be spent. Yet there was not a single one among them who did not accept these practices, for none knew of any other customs.

column1: Eles eram um povo assustadoramente estudioso. Sua compreensão de cálculo e ciência excedia qualquer pretensão de praticidade, e eles repetidamente se envolviam em debates acalorados sobre previsões do futuro. Eles inventaram uma linguagem cada vez mais difícil e criaram uma série infinita de máquinas complexas que imediatamente descartavam. Mas não havia um único entre eles que olhasse para trás, pois nenhum deles conhecia qualquer razão para se preocupar.
column2: They were a frighteningly studious people.<LF><LF>Their grasp of calculation and science exceeded any pretense of practicality, and they would repeatedly engage in spirited debates regarding predictions of the future. They invented an increasingly difficult language, and created an infinite series of complex machines which they would immediately discard. But there was not a single one among them who looked back, for none knew of any reason for concern.
